author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “alteration (i.e. change that takes place according to causal law) always concerns a particular part of space and, simultaneously and together with this, a particular part of time. Consequently, causality unites space with time.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “he who writes for fools always finds a large public.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “A man who is unintelligent is very likely to show his perfidy, villainy and malice; whereas a clever man understands how to conceal these qualities.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Time is that by virtue of which everything becomes nothingness in our hands and loses all real value.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “and, next in importance after health, the ability to maintain ourselves in independence and freedom from care.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Thus the task is not so much to see what no one yet has seen, but to think what nobody yet has thought about that which everybody sees.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Talent hits a target that no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The world is not a piece of machinery and animals are not articles manufactured for our use. Such views should be left to synagogues and philosophical lecture-rooms, which in essence are not so very different.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The truest fame, the fame that comes after death, is never heard of by its recipient; and yet he is called a happy man.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “There is only one inborn error, and that is the notion that we exist in order to be happy….So long as we persist in this inborn error, and indeed even become confirmed in it through optimistic dogmas, the world seems to us full of contradictions.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “A man is wise only on condition of living in a world full of fools.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “we have found that the whole essence of matter lies in action, a i.e. in causality: as a result, matter must also unify space and time, that is, matter must possess the properties of both time and space simultaneously,”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The anxieties of all of us, our worries, vexations, bothers, troubles, uneasy apprehensions and strenuous efforts are due, in perhaps the large majority of instances, to what other people will say;”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Ignorance is degrading only when it is found in company with riches.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “[...] it is stated that in the world all is illusion, there is no reality in the things; all is empty. (Asiatic Researches, vol. xx. p. 434)”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The life of a fool is worse than death[1].”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The first forty years of life give us the text; the next thirty supply the commentary on it.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The objective half of life and reality is in the hand of fate, and accordingly takes various forms in different cases: the subjective half is ourself, and in essentials it always remains the same.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “What is time? What is this entity consisting of mere movement without anything that moves? and, What is space, this omnipresent nothing out of which no thing can emerge without ceasing to be something? That time and space belong to the subject,”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Reason is of a feminine nature: it can give only after it has received. On its own, it possesses nothing but the empty forms of its own operation. Completely pure rational cognition gives us in fact only four things, the very metalogical truths.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “If you put a spoonful of wine in a barrel full of sewage, you get sewage. If you put a spoonful of sewage in a barrel full of wine, you get... sewage.”
author: Schopenhauer

quote: “[M]an does at all times only what he wills, and yet he does this necessarily. But this is because he already is what he wills.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Time is continually pressing upon us, never letting us take breath, but always coming after us, like a taskmaster with a whip.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Life has no intrinsic worth, but is kept in motion merely by desire and illusion.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Ah, how little they must have had to think about, to have been able to read so much!”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “…Philosophy is essentially world-wisdom; its problem is the world. With this alone it has to do, and it leaves the gods in peace; but in return for this, it expects them to leave it in peace also.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Thus the will-to-live generally feasts on itself, and is in different forms its own nourishment, till finally the human race, because it subdues all the others, regards nature as manufactured for its own use.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “every human individual be aware of the inescapable and arbitrary suffering which is set off by the very existence of the will and refrain from using the imaginative power of our mind to envision it otherwise.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “[M]an does at all times only what he wills, and yet he does this necessarily. But this is because he already is what he wills.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Require the immortality of the individual is wanting to perpetuate an error to infinity.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “it is worthy of consideration, indeed marvelous, how besides his life in concreto, a person always leads a second in abstracto as well.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “they are nothing more than pseudo-accounts by which he seeks to satisfy his own reason about a good deed,”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “You can do what you will, but in any given moment of your life you can will only one definite thing and absolutely nothing other than that one thing.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Has not that fellow abused and insulted you? No, was his answer, what he says is not addressed to me.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Originally, we are all inclined to injustice and violence, because our needs, desires, anger, and hatred immediately enter consciousness and thus have the jus primi occupantis”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “All truth passes through three stages: First, it is ridiculed;Second, it is violently opposed;and Third, it is accepted as self-evident.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Ordinary people think merely how they shall spend their time; a man of any talent tries to use it.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “To marry means to do everything possible to become an object of disgust to each other.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “A man strives to get direct mastery over things either by understanding them or by compulsion. But a woman is always and everywhere driven to indirect mastery, namely through a man; all her direct mastery being limited to him alone.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Kant's greatest service to philosophy was to rid it of the bungling empiricism and of the empty, verbose transcendentalism of his predecessors, and thus to effect a complete revolution in philosophical thought.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Not merely that the world exists, but still more that it is such a miserable and melancholy world, is the tormenting problem of metaphysics.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Materialism is the philosophy of the subject who forgets to take account of himself.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Aristotle says, To be happy means to be self-sufficient.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Voltaire says, we shall leave this world as foolish and as wicked as we found it on our arrival.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Directly after copulation the devil’s laughter is heard”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Life is a business that does not cover the costs.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Great intellectual gifts mean an activity pre-eminently nervous in its character, and consequently a very high degree of susceptibility to pain in every form.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “That is what Schopenhauer means by asserting that the world, as it exhibits itself to our senses is "an idea", an appearance within the knower himself and that, considered independently of any reality lying beyond it, it is, in all its vastness and dicersity, nothing.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Nature does not err. Her pace is sure and she does not conceal it. Everything is entirely in her, and she is entirely in everything.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “There is in the world only the choice between loneliness and vulgarity.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Time is merely the spread-out and piecemeal view that an individual being has of the Ideas.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “This need for excitement of the will manifests itself very specially in the discovery and support of card-playing, which is quite peculiarly the expression of the miserable side of humanity.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Every nation mocks at other nations, and all are right.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “We should rather consider the events, as they happen, with the same eye as we consider the printed word which we read, knowing full well that it was there before we read it.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Could the completed life course of such a man turn out in any respect, even the smallest, in any happening, any scene, differently from the way it did? – No! is the consistent and correct answer.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “This truth, which must be very serious and impressive if not awful to every one, is that a man can also say and must say, "the world is my will.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Whoever takes a gloomy view regards this world as a kind of hell and is accordingly concerned only with procuring for himself a small fireproof room.”
author: Schopenhauer

quote: “The true emblem of causa sui is Baron Münchhausen, who, clamping his legs around his horse as it sinks in the water, pulls his pigtail up over his head and raises himself and the horse into the heights; under this emblem, put: causa sui.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Stupid people cannot see the inter-connections between natural phenomena, either when these phenomena occur on their own or when they are consciously controlled, that is, pressed into service as machines; they therefore easily believe in magic and miracles.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The life of a man is a struggle for existence with the certainty of defeat.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “In short, a large part of the powers of the human race is taken away from the production of what is necessary, in order to bring what is superfluous and unnecessary within the reach of a few.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The perverse, obtuse, wicked biped race”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “A friend of his ego, not a friend of wisdom.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Imitation and custom are the spring of almost all human action. The cause of it is that men fight shy of all and any sort of reflection, and very properly mistrust their own discernment. At the same time this remarkably strong imitative instinct”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Beauty is an open letter of recommendation, predisposing the heart to favor the person who presents it.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “No truth therefore is more certain, more independent of all others, and less in need of proof than this, that all that exists for knowledge, and therefore this whole world, is only object in relation to subject/perception of a perceiver, in a word, idea.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Conscience accompanies every act with the comment: You should act differently, although its true sense is: You could be other than you are.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “All truth passes through three stages: First, it is ridiculed; second, it is violently opposed; and third, it is accepted as self-evident.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “What does the absolute mean? Something that is, and of which (under pain of punishment) we dare not ask further whence and why it is. A precious rarity for professors of philosophy!”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “There is in the world only the choice between loneliness and vulgarity. All young people should be taught now to put up with loneliness ... because the less man is compelled to come into contact with others, the better off he is.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “If your abilities are only mediocre, modesty is mere honesty; but if you possess great talents, it is hypocrisy.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “to be superior (überlegen) to others in real life, the indispensable condition is to be thoughtful and deliberate (überlegt), in other words, to set to work in accordance with concepts.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “A man finds himself, to his great astonishment, suddenly existing, after thousands and thousands of years of non-existence: he lives for a little while; and then, again, comes an equally long period when he must exist no more.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “man is the only animal which causes pain to others with no other object than causing pain.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “What is mortal in him, his own individuality, desires everything else, but counts for absolutely nothing.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “To free a man from error is to give, not take away”
author: Arhtur Schopenhaueur

quote: “as experience in fact shows that those purely rational characters commonly called practical philosophers (and rightly so, since real, i.e., theoretical, philosophers translate life into concepts, while they translate concepts into life) are surely the happiest”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Republics are anti-natural, artificial, and derive from reflection: consequently there are also very few of them in the entire history of mankind...”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Truth, my friend, truth alone holds firm, endures and stays steadfast : truth's consolation is the only solid consolation : it is the indestructible diamond.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Therefore, without doubt, the happiest destiny on earth is to have the rare gift of a rich individuality, and, more especially to be possessed of a good endowment of intellect; this is the happiest destiny, though it may not be, after all, a very brilliant one.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “religions are like glow-worms: they need darkness in order to shine.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “No man has ever felt perfectly happy in the present; if he had it would have intoxicated him.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The happiness we receive from ourselves is greater than that which we obtain from our surroundings.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The life of the individual is only borrowed from that of the species.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “In their hearts women think that it is the men’s business to earn money and theirs to spend it – if possible during their husband’s life, but, at any rate, after his death”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Nonetheless, everyone desires to achieve old age, that isto say a condition in which one can say: ‘Today it is bad, and day byday it will get worse – until at last the worst of all arrives.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “our memory of joys and sorrows is always imperfect, and they become a matter of indifference to us as soon as they are over.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Thus music is as immediate an objectification and copy of the whole will as the world itself is,”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The way to keep down hatred and contempt is certainly not to look for a man's alleged "dignity," but, on the contrary, to regard him as an object of pity.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Literary newspapers, since they print the daily smatterings of commonplace people, are especially a cunning means for robbing from the aesthetic public the time which should be devoted to the genuine productions of art for the furtherance of culture.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Give way neither to love nor to hate, is one-half of worldly wisdom: say nothing and believe nothing, the other half.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “there is some wisdom in taking a gloomy view, in looking upon the world as a kind of Hell, and in confining one’s efforts to securing a little room that shall not be exposed to the fire.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “And then, again, the more distinctly a man knows, the more intelligent he is, the more pain he has; the man who is gifted with genius suffers most of all.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The fool chases pleasure and finds disappointment, the sage only avoids grief.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “We sometimes forget even what we have done, so how much more what we have thought.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “it truly seems as though a demon had maliciously shut off all further knowledge from us so as to enjoy our discomfiture.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Courage, however, may also be explained as a readiness to meet ills that threaten at the moment, in order to avoid greater ills that lie in the future; whereas cowardice does the contrary.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “the longer you live the more clearly you will feel that, on thewhole, life is a disappointment, nay, a cheat.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Truth is no harlot who throws her arms around the neck of him who does not desire her; on the contrary, she is so coy a beauty that even the man who sacrifices everything to her can still not be certain of her favours.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “We should always be mindful of the fact that no man is ever very far from the state in which he would readily want to seize a sword or poison in order to bring his existence to an end.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “While illusion distorts reality for a moment, error can reign for millennia in abstractions, throw its iron yoke over whole peoples and stifle the noblest impulses of humanity; those it cannot deceive are left in chains by those it has, by its slaves.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “In its death throes, we see religion clinging to morality, whose mother it would like to pretend to be. In vain! – genuine morality is dependent on no religion, although religion sanctions and thereby sustains it.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The younger we are, the more each individual object represents for us the whole class to which it belongs.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The world is just a hell and in it human beings are the tortured souls on the one hand, and the devils on the other”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Schopenhauer on Hegel: "A flat-headed, insipid, nauseating, illiterate charlatan.”
author: Schopenhauer

quote: “To the honor of Spinoza I must mention that his more accurate understanding explained all general concepts as having to the contrary arisen from an obfuscation of that of which one is perceptually cognizant”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “these people would indeed only be concerned for themselves, for their egoism, just like the bandit, from whom they are distinguished only by the absurdity of their means.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Every parting is a foretaste of death, and every reunion is a foretaste of resurrection. That is why even people who were indifferent to one another rejoice so much when they meet again after twenty or thirty years.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “If anyone spends almost the whole day in reading...he gradually loses the capacity for thinking...This is the case with many learned persons; they have read themselves stupid.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The world is idea.”
author: Arthur Shopenhauer

quote: “Right in itself is powerless; in nature, it is Might that rules. To enlist might on the side of right, so that by means of it right may rule, is the problem of statesmanship.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “For the more a man has in himself, the less he will want from other people,—the less, indeed, other people can be to him. This is why a high degree of intellect tends to make a man unsocial.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Scoundrels are always sociable.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The actual facts of morality are too much on my side for me to fear that my theory can ever be replaced or upset by any other.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Those who are so zealous and eager to settle debated questions by citing authorities, are really glad when they are able to put the understanding and the insight of others into the field in place of their own, which are wanting.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “A young man of rich family enters upon life with a large patrimony, and often runs through it in an incredibly short space of time, in vicious extravagance; and why? Simply because, here too, the mind is empty and void, and so the man is bored with existence.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “To buy books would be a good thing if we also could buy the time to read them”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “just as the mistakes princes make are paid for by whole peoples, so the errors of great minds spread their malign influence over whole generations, even for hundreds of years, growing and proliferating until in the end they degenerate into monstrosities.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “We forfeit three-fourths of ourselves in order to be like other people.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “In general, indeed, the wise in all ages have always said the same thing, and the fools, who at all times form the immense majority, have in their way too acted alike, and done just the opposite; and so it will continue.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Noise is the most impertinent of all forms of interruption. It is not only an interruption, but also a disruption of thought. Of course, where there is nothing to interrupt, noise will not be so particularly painful”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “If an ecclesiastic defends a philosophical dogma, it will be pointed out to him that he is indirectly contravening a fundamental dogma of his church.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “To secure and promote this feeling of cheerfulness should be the supreme aim of all our endeavors after happiness.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “The happiest lot is not to have experienced the keenest delights or the greatest pleasures, but to have brought life to a close without any very great pain, bodily or mental.”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “How time, we might say, with its one dimension must torture itself, in order to reproduce the three dimensions of space!”
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: “Imagine smiling after a slap in the face. Then think of doing it twenty-four hours a day.”
author: Markus Zusak

quote: “If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Warriors should suffer their pain silently.”
author: Erin Hunter

quote: “Until we have begun to go without them, we fail to realize how unnecessary many things are. We've been using them not because we needed them but because we had them.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Complaining does not work as a strategy. We all have finite time and energy. Any time we spend whining is unlikely to help us achieve our goals. And it won't make us happier.”
author: Randy Pausch

quote: “A Stoic is someone who transforms fear into prudence, pain into transformation, mistakes into initiation, and desire into undertaking.”
author: Taleb Nassim Nicholas

quote: “People hide their truest nature. I understood that; I even applauded it. What sort of world would it be if people bled all over the sidewalks, if they wept under trees, smacked whomever they despised, kissed strangers, revealed themselves?”
author: Alice Hoffman

quote: “Feeling too much is a hell of a lot better than feeling nothing.”
author: Nora Roberts

quote: “The things you think about determine the quality of your mind.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “How do you defeat terrorism? Don’t be terrorized.”
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: “Always resignation and acceptance. Always prudence and honour and duty. Elinor, where is your heart?”
author: Jane Austen

quote: “Misfortune nobly born is good fortune.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Regard [a friend] as loyal, and you will make him loyal.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “To be everywhere is to be nowhere.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “You should … live in such a way that there is nothing which you could not as easily tell your enemy as keep to yourself.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “What really frightens and dismays us is not external events themselves, but the way in which we think about them. It is not things that disturb us, but our interpretation of their significance.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Nothing is burdensome if taken lightly, and nothing need arouse one's irritation so long as one doesn't make it bigger than it is by getting irritated.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “There will never come a time when I will be able to resist my emotions.”
author: Louise Erdrich

quote: “I hear my silence talked of in every lane;The suppression of a cry is itself a cry of pain.”
author: Darshan Singh

quote: “It is not the man who has too little that is poor, but the one who hankers after more.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Today I escaped anxiety. Or no, I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions — not outside.”
author: Marcus Aurelius Meditations

quote: “From the philosopher Catulus, never to be dismissive of a friend's accusation, even if it seems unreasonable, but to make every effort to restore the relationship to its normal condition.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “We love being mentally strong, but we hate situations that allow us to put our mental strength to good use.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “If what you have seems insufficient to you, then though you possess the world, you will yet be miserable.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Some people avoid thinking deeply in public, only because they are afraid of coming across as suicidal.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “In your actions, don't procrastinate. In your conversations, don't confuse. In your thoughts, don't wander. In your soul, don't be passive or aggressive. In your life, don't be all about business.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “When force of circumstance upsets your equanimity, lose no time in recovering your self-control, and do not remain out of tune longer than you can help. Habitual recurrence to the harmony will increase your mastery of it.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “It is more necessary for the soul to be cured than the body; for it is better to die than to live badly.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “For death remembered should be like a mirror,Who tells us life’s but breath, to trust it error.”
author: William Shakespeare

quote: “My boyfriends have all been as stoical as queen's guards. They'd been patient, committed, and dispassionate, and I'd had to really debase myself to extract any emotion, either grin or grimace, from them.”
author: Koren Zailckas

quote: “Thoroughly convinced of the impossibility of his own suit, a high resolve constrained him not to injure that of another. This is a lover's most stoical virtue, as the lack of it is a lover's most venial sin.”
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: “Here is your great soul—the man who has given himself over to Fate; on the other hand, that man is a weakling and a degenerate who struggles and maligns the order of the universe and would rather reform the gods than reform himself.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Common man's patience will bring him more happiness than common man's power.”
author: Amit Kalantri

quote: “Concern should drive us into action and not into a depression. No man is free who cannot control himself.”
author: Pythagoras

quote: “It is impossible to lose everything and still be alive.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is and pass some time in his own company.”
author: Seneca

quote: “I've come to the point where I never feel the need to stop and evaluate whether or not I am happy. I'm just 'being', and without question, by default, it works.”
author: Criss Jami

quote: “And why should we feel anger at the world?As if the world would notice.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “It is quite possible to be a good man without anyone realizing it.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “[A] resistance that dispenses with consolations is always stronger than one which relies on them.”
author: Perry Anderson

quote: “Don't be overheard complaining ... not even to yourself.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “For in this Case, we are not to give Credit to the Many, who say, that none ought to be educated but the Free; but rather to the Philosophers, who say, that the Well-educated alone are free.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “To the wise, peace of mind is the result of being fine with how things are; to the foolish, the result of things being fine.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It is better to be despised for simplicity than to suffer agonies from everlasting pretense.”
author: Seneca

quote: “We are good to others only because we think that that is, or will be, good for us.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “If you are told that such an one speaks ill of you, make no defence against what was said, but answer, He surely knew not my other faults, else he would not have mentioned these only!”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Sometimes silence is a sign, not of not knowing what to say, but of knowing when to say what you know.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Man, consider first what the matter is (which you propose to do), then your own nature also, what it is able to bear. If you are a wrestler, look at your shoulders, your thighs, your loins: for different men are naturally formed for different things.”
author: Epictetus Discourses

quote: “Employers pay with their money for what employees have paid for with portions of their lives.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The world is asking us the questions, and it couldn’t care less what we expect from it. But here’s the good news: real meaning doesn’t come from what the world gives you, but how you respond to it.”
author: Phil Van Treuren

quote: “Birds weren’t given wings just to walk everywhere . . . and you weren’t born with resilience and a beautiful mind just to have an easy life.”
author: Phil Van Treuren

quote: “Life is short but life is long”
author: Seneca

quote: “Death is nothing to us. When we exist, death is not; and when death exists, we are not.”
author: Epicurus

quote: “You are more likely to feel an inner disturbance if you set your heart and mind on something that is beyond your control to obtain.”
author: Brigid Delaney

quote: “How much longer are you going to wait to demand the best for yourself?" he asked her, as she sat quietly in the back.”
author: Ryan Holiday

quote: “Our minds are a sanctuary; a safe haven which is totally impregnable to the outside world. It is only when we allow external problems and anxieties to enter our mind that this sanctuary becomes vulnerable.”
author: Alexander Zenon

quote: “To the Stoics, a good life meant living in accordance with nature, both universal nature – accepting the world for what it is, not resisting it because we think it should be different – and our own nature as human beings.”
author: Alexander Zenon

quote: “We human beings are not hive animals. We aren’t like bees or ants who just work constantly for the good of the community.”
author: Alexander Zenon

quote: “Tomorrow will arrive, come what may. The sun will rise, as it has always done, and will set in the evening when nature commands it.”
author: Alexander Zenon

quote: “The events that may befall you tomorrow are not new or novel, and the emotions that you will experience have been felt by countless others throughout the crashing torrent of time. They survived. Why can’t you?”
author: Alexander Zenon

quote: “We are existing in a thin sliver of light between two potentially infinite portions of darkness.”
author: Alexander Zenon

quote: “Distractions adorn themselves in the grandeur of the immediate, urgent, and superficial, dazzling our senses and demanding our attention. They leap into the spotlight, shouting loudly to drown the quiet callings of our deepest intentions.”
author: Kevin L. Michel

quote: “The Stoic approach is the lighthouse that guides us amidst the tempest, leading us to the land of dreams crafted in the forge of the unyielding present.”
author: Kevin L. Michel

quote: “True focus is the ability to summon our mental strength when it is required and to let it rest when it is not.”
author: Kevin L. Michel

quote: “True focus requires wisdom in choosing the worthy target, courage in maintaining a resolute mind, and prudence in knowing when to exert effort and when to seek rest. Master these elements, and you begin to understand the nature of focus.”
author: Kevin L. Michel

quote: “Pursuing similar results for dissimilar peoplewill make fools of kings and kings of fools.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “One will never be able to control all things that concern an endeavor, but the magic is in riding the wave.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “Strive to articulate your wants loudly so they become interwoven with reality, more than thoughts.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “Verily, life is a series of championships and the joy is to be found in playing the game.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “We should refrain from attempting to change things to fit our narrative of explaining the world, and start changing this narrative to better host the things we experience.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “The reaction that art produces in you has more to do with you than it does with art.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “A good story has no end, it continues being a part of reality well after its last point by forming a union with us.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “You can also commit injustice by doing nothing.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “The only way to know what lies ahead is by continuing onward.”
author: Shonjuk Chakma

quote: “Add nothing of your own from within, and that's an end of it.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “It is only when you fall that you learn whether you can fly.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “The closest we can get to “winning” at life is to never give up.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “There will come a day when i will be able to resist and control my emotions... And when that day comes, i will know that i truly made it,”
author: Plandertaker

quote: “It matters not how long the action is spun out, but how good the acting is”
author: Seneca

quote: “Perchance some day the memory of this sorrow Will even bring delight”
author: Seneca

quote: “The most beautiful things come from the hardest conditions.”
author: Ezedi Souvenir

quote: “Take pride in your courage for it leads to difficult situations which, once overcome, leave you more than what you were before. Only in the most extreme of pressures does carbon become diamond”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “Do not underestimate the quiet and laid-back individuals because displaying stoicism, at certain times, is a superpower.”
author: Robin S. Baker

quote: “Speak the truth and above all claim the things you want, at least to yourself.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “The crossing of a blue bridge which bystanders who cannot distinguish from the blue of the horizon deem invisible.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “No action in the human context will succeed without reference to the divine, nor vice versa.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “He is a slave.'' But shall that stand in his way?Show me a man who is not a slave; one is a slave to lust, another to greed, another to ambition, and all men are slaves to fear.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The only good and evil in your life lies within you – in your choices.”
author: Alexander Zenon

quote: “There will come a day when i will be able to resist and control my emotions... And when that day comes, i will know that i truly made it.”
author: Plandertaker

quote: “Time is a river, a violent current of events, glimpsed once and already carried past us, and another one follows and is gone.”
author: Marcus Aurelious

quote: “Externals are nothing to a stoic. The falsehoods and artificial limitations of human society are nothing to proponents of the theater principle”
author: Lashon Byrd

quote: “As the still dawn breaks and first light graces the horizon, we humans are presented with tremendous opportunity. We are gifted with a fresh start, a blank canvas upon which we can paint however we choose.”
author: Alexander Zenon

quote: “You are scared of dying - and, tell me, is the kind of life you lead really any different from being dead?”
author: Seneca

quote: “True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.”
author: Seneca

quote: “If it should ever happen to you to be turned to externals in order to please some person, you must know that you have lost your purpose in life.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Every life without exception is a short one.”
author: Seneca

quote: “We cannot believe in the fundamental goodness of the world until and unless we ourself become that goodness.”
author: Neel Burton

quote: “So - to the best of your ability - demonstrate your own guilt, conduct inquiries of your own into all the evidence against yourself. Play the part first of prosecutor, then of judge, and finally of pleader in mitigation. Be harsh with yourself at times.”
author: Seneca

quote: “You never know what will be the consequence of misfortune; or, you never know what will be the consequences of good fortune”
author: Allan Watts

quote: “Associate with those who will make a better of man. Welcome those whom yourself can improve. Men learn while they teach.”
author: Seneca

quote: “For when you have subjected to externals what is your own, then be a slave and do not resist, and do not sometimes choose to be a slave, and sometimes not choose, but with all your mind be one or the other.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “[I]f you gape after externals, you must of necessity ramble up and down in obedience to the will of your master. And who is the master? He who has the power over the things which you seek to gain or try to avoid.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “The part of life we really live is small. For all the rest of existence is not life, but merely time.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It's only when you're breathing your last that the way you've spent your time will become apparent, "I accept the terms, and feel no dread of the coming judgment.”
author: Seneca

quote: “People look for retreats for themselves, in the country, by the coast, or in the hills. There is nowhere that a person can find a more peaceful and trouble-free retreat than in his mind. So constantly give yourself this retreat, and renew yourself.”
author: Maya Bennett

quote: “In life our first job is this, to divide and distinguish things into two categories: externals that I cannot control, but the choices I make with regard to them I do control. Where will I find food and bad? In me, in my choices.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Kindness has become so rare that it provokes perplexity about what's sincere and what's deceitful.”
author: Shonjuk Chakma

quote: “Having in mind not how bravely I was capable of dying but how far from bravely he was capable of bearing the loss, I commanded myself to live.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Thinking of departed friends is to me something sweet and mellow. For when I had them with me it was with the feeling that I was going to lose them, and now that I have lost them I keep the feeling that I have them with me still.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Everywhere means nowhere.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Consider above all else whether you've advanced in philosophy or just in actual years.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Life is a series of problems we must navigate with grace - one problem solved, another arises, again and again until we die.”
author: Pamela Anderson Love Pamela

quote: “Don’t let the force of an impression when it first hits you knock you off your feet; just say to it, “Hold on a moment; let me see who you are and what you represent. Let me put you to the test.” ~ Epictetus”
author: Maya Bennett

quote: “Be careful to leave your sons well instructed rather than rich, for the hopes of the instructed are better than the wealth of the ignorant.” ~ Epictetus”
author: Maya Bennett

quote: “The most terrifying ghosts that haunt us are the ones of our dead dreams, especially if we were the murderers.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “How does one go about persuading the rain to stop?”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “Me? I'm a Stoic. Every time my eyes are opened, I am eager to see the world anew.”
author: Ioannis Loukopoulos

quote: “Milo's Way- A HaikuStrength sought in small steps,Like Milo's calf on shoulders,Grow with steady will.”
author: Amogh Swamy

quote: “Well, when do we act like sheep: when we act for the sake of the belly, or of our sex-organs, or at random, or in a filthy fashion, or without due consideration, to what level have we degenerated?To the level of sheep.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “[...] Say good-bye at last to those deceptive prizes more precious to those who hope for them than to those who have won them.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Do not trust her seeming calm; in a moment the sea is moved to its depths.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The best way to have people laugh with you and not at you, is to get ahead of them and laugh at yourself first.”
author: Nate Hamon

quote: “It was the first and most striking characteristic of Socrates never to become heated in discourse, never to utter an injurious or insulting word - on the contrary, he persistently bore insult from others and thus put an end to the fray.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Success is not a stamp of approval given by others.”
author: Nate Hamon

quote: “I am acting on behalf of later generations. I am writing down a few things that may be of use to them.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Every hour of the day, countless situations arise that call for advice, and for that advice we have to look to philosophy.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Man, if you are anything, both walk alone and talk to yourself, and do not hide yourself in the chorus. Examine a little at last, look around, stir yourself up, that you may know who you are.”
author: Epictetus Discourses

quote: “Even as the Sun doth not wait for prayers and incantations to rise, but shines forth and is welcomed by all: so thou also wait not for clapping of hands and shouts and praise to do thy duty; nay, do good of thine own accord, and thou wilt be loved like the Sun.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Amor Fati”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Will you never come to a realisation of who you are, what you have been born for and the purpose for which the gift of vision was made in our case?”
author: Epictetus

quote: “There was an iron simplicty in the seer. He was like a monolith of logic standing against waves of angry nonsense.”
author: John Steinbeck

quote: “Reflect that nothing merits admiration except the spirit, the impressiveness of which prevents it from being impressed by anything.”
author: Seneca

quote: “We need to set our affections on some good man and keep him constantly before our eyes, so that we may live as if he were watching us and do everything as if he saw what we were doing.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The ability to do without a kingdom is a kingdom.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Everything that we see is changing and will soon be gone, and we should bear in mind how many things have already changed over time, like the waters of streams flowing ceaselessly past—an idea that we can call the contemplation of impermanence.”
author: Donald Robertson

quote: “Ill Fortune is of more use to men than Good Fortune.”
author: Boethius

quote: “Fools act wise, not wisely.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Most of us would eventually lose count if we were to literally count our blessings.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Like an attachment to a sparrow: we glimpse it and it’s gone.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Many millions of people secretly feel caged by employment, marriage, and/or parenthood.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “In a little while you too will close your eyes, and soon there will be others mourning the man who buries you.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Paying someone to do something on our behalf is the closest we can get to buying time.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “An apology is usually a disguised request for a key to the cage of guilt or regret.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “To act wise isn’t to act wisely.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A cup with a broken handle can still handle its task.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Most people would rather have their remarks be misunderstood than be disagreed with.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Where is the harm or surprise in the ignorant behaving as the ignorant do?”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “What right hast thou to talk of ill of Fortune whilst keeping all Fortune's better gifts?”
author: Boethius

quote: “Nature is content with few things, and with a very little of these.”
author: Boethius

quote: “Precision of thought comes from a tranquil mindset. A presenter can have a competitive edge if they are unmoved by the jabs and provocations that are directed at them”
author: Josh King Madrid

quote: “Every goal or desire is a seed of an excuse to be unhappy.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The present moment is the entirety of reality.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The passage of time is as real as the movement of an animated object.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Life is not more kind, or less cruel, towards those who take it seriously.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We always put ourselves first: the fulfilment of our desire sometimes comes last.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Small talk is one of the most common symptoms of small-mindedness.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Mindfulness is the only doorway to the unhurried life.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A better attitude towards life is better than a better life, and leads to a better life.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “If one accomplishes some good though with toil, the toil passes, but the good remains; if one does something dishonourable with pleasure, the pleasure passes, but the dishonour remains.”
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: “Most adult geniuses are more playful than most children.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Most adults make adulthood seem like a disease that is caused by a deficiency of playfulness.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We are often blind to the fact that our situation is not as bad as we think, until it gets worse.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Some children’s lives begin before the end of their parents’ childhood.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Conformity eats away individuality.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Most people usually talk faster than they think.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The good and the bad occur at all times and will keep happening. We can become lost if we go with the hype of ‘good and bad’ every time.”
author: Tiisetso Maloma

quote: “Press on and make all your actions and words cohere and fit with one another, all struck from the same mold.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “If ever you want to find out whether anything has been achieved, observe whether your intentions are the same today as they were yesterday. A change of intention shows that the mind is at sea, drifting here and there as carried by the wind.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Things we wouldn't be willing to pay for if it meant giving up our house for them, or some pleasant or productive estate, we are quite ready to obtain at the cost of anxiety, of danger, of losing our freedom, our decency, our time.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Count yourself fortunate when you are able to live in a manner open to the public—when walls are there for shelter, not for concealment. For as a rule we think we have walls around us not to protect us but to afford greater privacy to our misdeeds.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Flattery looks very much like friendship, indeed not only resembles it but actually wins out against it. A person drinks it in with eager ears and takes it deeply to heart, delighted by the very qualities that make it dangerous.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “A charming enemy comes to me as a friend; faults creep in calling themselves virtues; temerity cloaks itself with the name of courage; cowardice gets called moderation; and timidity passes itself off as caution.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “It is doubly foolish to underuse what you have overpaid for.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Most people frequently waste their life, mostly in front of a screen.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We are not the firstWho with best meaning have incurred the worst.For thee, oppressèd king, I am cast down.Myself could else outfrown false Fortune’s frown.”
author: William Shakespeare

quote: “The first sign of a settled mind is that it can stay in one place and spend time with itself.” – Seneca, Letter 2.1”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Well begun is half done. This is something that depends on the mind; so when one is willing to become good, goodness is in large part achieved.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Philosophy neither rejects anyone nor chooses anyone; it shines for all.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Even if you had a lot of life left to live, you would need to parcel out your time sparingly so as to have enough for necessities. As it is, with time in such short supply, what madness it is to learn things that are superfluous.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Some sentences take seconds to read, but take minutes, hours, days, weeks, months, or even years to understand.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We are all talented at coming up with plausible excuses.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Being in a hurry gives us the illusion of doubling the length of every second.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Praying deceives us into thinking that we are doing something about what we are praying for.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Difficulty is the foundation of growth, which is the foundation of greatness.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Hatred is as powerful an intoxicant as love.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Fools are often unable to do what needs to be done, because they were doing, or are doing, what need not be done at that time … or at all.”
author: @Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We suffer more in imagination than in reality.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Don’t seek for everything to happen as you wish it would, but rather wish that everything happens as it actually will — then your life will flow well.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.”
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: “We cannot but obey the powers above us.Could I rage and roar as doth the sea She lies in, yet the end must be as ’tis.”
author: William Shakespeare

quote: “When that which we are enjoying is a true good, we feel joy; when it is not, we feel, at best, pleasure.”
author: Neel Burton

quote: “We get addicted, not to the substance, but to the effect.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Nature has given to men one tongue, but two ears, that we may hear from others twice as much as we speak.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “We cannot really save time. We can merely avoid wasting it.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We are hurried, not by what is happening, but by what we are desiring.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Eternal Spirit of the chainless Mind!Brightest in dungeons, Liberty! thou art,For there thy habitation is the heart—”
author: Lord Byron

quote: “It isn't manly to be enraged. Rather gentleness and civility are more human, therefrom more manly.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Avoid talking often and excessively about your accomplishments and dangers, for however much you enjoy recounting your dangers, it's not so pleasant for others to hear about your affairs.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Whatever you're going through, there is wisdom from the stoics that can help. In fact, in many cases, they have addressed it explicitly in terms that feel shockingly modern.”
author: Ryan Holiday

quote: “Capitalism is disgusted by those whose happiness is not a result of buying … or selling.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Unlearning makes learning at least three times longer than necessary.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Mental suffering is an inferno started, and kept burning, by thinking; and its smoke sometimes leaves one crying.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We played the main role in the doing of some things we didn’t do, by saying they couldn’t or wouldn’t be done.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Every life is a different path to death.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “For making a good voyage a pilot and wind are necessary: and for happiness, reason and art.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Most people celebrate the continuity of their existence so passionately that you would swear they chose to exist.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Our rationality is a visitor.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “What is heard is pushed, but what is read is pulled, into the mind.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Life cannot, not even for a millisecond, remain exactly how it is.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It is sometimes foolish to assume that someone is wise, or vice versa.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Just as chickens wake up and scream, being reborn is the polar opposite. You are blinded by bliss and numb to such pain.”
author: Jordan Binless

quote: “Just as roosters scream in the morning, being reborn is the polar opposite. You are blinded by bliss and numb to such pains.”
author: Jordan Binless

quote: “We are food even before we are dead.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “That kindness is invincible, provided it's sincere- not ironic or an act. What can even the most vicious person do if you keep treating him with kindness and gently set him straight”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “When you start to lose your temper, remember: There's nothing manly about rage. It's courtesy and kindness that define a human being- and a man. That's who possesses strength and nerves and guts, not the angry whiners.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “We would rarely waste time if our existence were earned.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It takes a great degree of tolerance, and that of humility, to strongly disagree with someone, and not express your disagreement.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “He never exhibited rudeness, lost control of himself, or turned violent. No one ever saw him sweat. Everything was to be approached logically and with due consideration, in a calm and orderly fashion but decisively, and with no loose ends.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “The world is maintained by change- in the elements and in the things they compose. That should be enough for you; treat it as an axiom.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “There is a limit to the time assigned to you, and if you don't use it to free yourself it will be gone and will never return.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “But true good fortune is what you make for yourself. Good fortune: good character, good intentions, and good actions.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “It is a humbling practice to make a mental note whenever your assumption turns out to be wrong.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Some real kings are drama queens.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It takes the whole of life to learn how to live... it takes the whole of life to learn how to die.”
author: Lucius Seneca

quote: “What is divine deserves our respect because it is good; what is human deserves our affection because it is like us. And our pity too, sometimes, for its inability to tell good from bad- as terrible a blindness as the kind that can't tell white from black.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Don't waste the rest of your time here worrying about other people- unless it affects the common good. It will keep you from doing anything useful.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Each of us lives only now, this brief instant. The rest has been lived already, or is impossible to see.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “It was for the best. So Nature had no choice but to do it.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Does anything genuinely beautiful need supplementing? No more than justice does- or truth, or kindness, or humility. Are any of those improved by being praised? Or damaged by contempt? Is an emerald suddenly flawed if no one admires it?”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “So there are two reasons to embrace what happens. One is that it's happening to you. It was prescribed for you, and it pertains to you. The thread was spun long ago, by the oldest cause of all.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Today I escaped from anxiety. Or no, I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions- not outside.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “When faced with people's bad behavior, turn around and ask when you have acted like that. When you saw money as a good, or pleasure, or social position. Your anger will subside as soon as you recognize that they acted under compulsion (what else could they do?)”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Intelligent people question everything. Stupid people answer every question.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Most people want more than they have without having made the most of what they have.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We live life passively whenever we are not practicing mindfulness.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “If being better is the surest way of feeling better, it must be better than feeling better.”
author: Neel Burton

quote: “Saving money, when buying an unnecessary thing, leads to wasting time, when using the thing.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We almost never teach or learn when arguing.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “He who has more money or possessions than you is not necessarily happier than you, happy more often than you, or happy like you.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Most people would rather believe something that is not true about something than accept the fact that they do not understand a thing about that thing.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “That we can change the shadow of an object without changing the object (by changing the position of the source of light) reminds us that we can change how we feel about a situation or person by changing only how we look at it or them.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The best kind of pleasure comes from the indifference to pain … and pleasure.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “If you care about yourself at all, come to your own aid while there’s still time.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Our education system would be betraying its master, capitalism, if it taught us to be content with what we have. Or if it told us about the fruits of practicing minimalism.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We do not need to lose people or things to appreciate them.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Sometimes the only thing you can do is accept the fact that there is nothing you can do.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Gluttony is nothing other than lack of self-control with respect to food, and human beings prefer food that is pleasant to food that is nutritious.”
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: “We gain the highest degree of freedom when we lose the desire to live, and gain the second highest degree when we lose the desire to live as long as we possibly can.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We do things for others for ourselves.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It is foolish to expect a fool to act wisely.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “What is happening is life’s way of telling us what should be happening.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Learning how to live would take most people at least three lifetimes.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Our efforts do not owe us our desired outcomes.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Freedom of speech does not come with opinions worth listening to.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It is joyful to see someone who is hopeful in a situation that is hopeless.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Sometimes we want not freedom of choice, but freedom from choice.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A millionaire who is a minimalist feels and is a trillion times richer than billionaires who are not minimalists.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Complaining about a person is way less annoying when we complain to that person.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Some solutions are seeds of some problems.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “You can be too old to live, but not too young to die.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “You cannot love what you have become, yet hate what you have overcome.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Funerals greatly exaggerate the pleasantness of being alive, while they prevent us from thinking about the advantages of being dead.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “To complain about life is to complain about being alive.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Hating our opponent benefits us. Underestimating them benefits them.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We each unwittingly contribute, each and every day, to the preventions and to the causes of millions of accidents.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We must say nothing, when we have nothing to say.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A wise answer is even more pleasing when it is a response to a foolish question.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Not everything that could have been done should have been done.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It is not that we have so little time but that we lose so much… The life we receive is not short but we make it so”
author: Seneca

quote: “Take it to mind, not to heart.”
author: Nate Hamon

quote: “Hunger is by far the best spice.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Show by a cheerful look that you don't need the help or comfort of others. Standing up - not propped up.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Life is the struggle of delaying death.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “You cannot really not care about what others think about you, yet care about whether or not they know that you do not care about what they think about you.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Be like a headland: the Waves beat against it continuously, but it stands fast and around it the boiling water dies down.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “We often mistake assuming or hoping for knowing.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It usually takes maturity in a child, and immaturity in an adult, not to be on speaking terms with someone.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The triviality of a question does not make a profound answer an impossibility.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “You can wear an expensive watch and still be late.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A family member is initially loved out of expectation … and is eventually loved out of habit.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Some fools have children. Some have children who have children. And some have children who have children who have children.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Stoicism is a mild form of pessimism … sprinkled with optimism.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “No one is too old to live another day, or too young to die today.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Only those who are stupid mind coming across as stupid.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Pleasure and pain are often each other’s seed.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “To make life very pleasurable, expect nothing. To make it even more pleasurable than that, expect nothing … but the worst.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “You have two essential tasks in life: to be a good person and to pursue the occupation that you love. Everything else is a waste of energy and a squandering of your potential.”
author: Ryan Holiday

quote: “We all die having lived a full life, even those who die while they are being born.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Anxiety is the shadow of what we do not want to lose.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Being spiritually asleep has deceived the vast majority of people into thinking that poverty is a poor person’s main problem in life. To those who are spiritually awake, poverty is not even a problem.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Happiness is sweet; its pursuit, bitter.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We cannot be too young to die.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Unless you are spiritually awakened, being happy requires you to ignore or forget other people’s suffering.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Show by a cheerful look that you don't need the help or comfort of others. Standing up - not propped up.”
author: Marcus Aruelius

quote: “One of the main goals and effects of stoicism is to stop an adult from being a crybaby.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We all too often invite a lie by asking someone how he or she is doing.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “There is no correlation between how many people or things, how much money, or how many problems you have … and how grateful, happy, or peaceful you can be.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “To plan is to hope … without feeling passive.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Whenever an animal is overworking, a human is to blame.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Time and money are almost always saved to be wasted.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Appreciating what you have is the best cure for wanting what you have not.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Our caring about what others think about us is one of the pillars of the economy.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Pleasure is often felt through the tongue or genitals as an attempt to distract oneself from the pain one is feeling through the heart.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “To chase pleasure is to be chased by pain.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “To live is to owe life to die.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Disappointment is an unwanted—but invited—guest.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Whoever then has knowledge of good things, would know how to love them; but how could one who cannot distinguish good things from evil and things indifferent from both have power to love?”
author: Epictetus

quote: “A child is one of the most common results of the lack or loss of self-control.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “What does it mean to be getting an education? It means learning to apply natural preconceptions to particular cases as nature prescribes, and distinguishing what is in our power from what is not.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “It is foolish to waste time in order to save money.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We prefer ourselves into unhappiness.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The vast majority of people are each a puppet that is forever pulled in this or that direction, or pushed into this or that action, by things such as public opinion and an emotion.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A book can be read to you, not for you.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We are born old enough to die.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The mind, unconquered by violent passions, is a citadel, for a man has no fortress more impregnable in which to find refuge and remain safe forever.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “There is no correlation between the degree to which you are confident that you are right and the chances of you not being wrong.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Some of the things we are trying to pray away were caused by some of our answered prayers.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Alcohol is the worst thing to mix with anger.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Getting something or someone we want is often a guaranteed way to eventually stop us from wanting it, him, or her.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Sex for pleasure is chewing gum for genitals.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Having to make a difficult or important decision is sometimes more agonizing than not having a choice.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Wishing is usually an indirect way of feeling sorry for yourself.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Failing can ultimately be way more rewarding than succeeding.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Developing the extremely rare attitude of not minding how life is happening is a billion times better than prolonging your life, even if by a trillion years.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Some people would be ashamed of driving the cars, or living in the houses, some people are showing off.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It is a curse to be childish, but a blessing to be childlike.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Being grateful for the shade of a tree is not nearly as honourable as planting a tree.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It takes selfishness to stop someone from killing themself.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “man was given two ears and one mouth for a reason”
author: Account of The Stoic Zeno by Ryan Holiday and Stephen Haselman

quote: “It is impossible to separate the art of living from the art of dying, because to be living is to be dying.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A suicide attempt is an act of fighting for one’s death.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Death is freedom from life.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Not complaining is sometimes a show off of tolerance or patience.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The ability to utter wise words is not exclusive to the wise.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Growth is often the cause or the result of pain.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Education teaches us how to make a living, not how to live.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Like a problem, time is nothing but a shadow of thought.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Sunglasses are all too often used to hide shyness … or unhappiness.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A thing named, misnamed, unnamed, or renamed is still itself.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “To give something or someone your attention is to give it or them a portion of your life.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Life sometimes shows kindheartedness by not handing us the success or fame we want, until we have matured enough to be able to handle it.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Being patient with a fool requires one not to be one.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Unhappiness and the like often inspire us to perform random acts of unkindness.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A truth is not any less truthful, when it is said by someone who did not discover, or does not understand, it.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A long life is a curse if you have a short temper.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Slavery often masquerades as freedom.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The person you are mad at for being late could be late.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A surprising number of people believe that other people can hurt their feelings.”
author: Vincent P. Collins

quote: “Because of things such as arrogance, alcohol, and promiscuity, some people are each a legend in the unmaking.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “There is usually at least one person praying for a situation, or an outcome, that is the exact opposite of the one someone or some people are praying for.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Living is the outside of dying.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “You have not yet reaped the sweetest fruits of meditation, if you still do not meditate only to meditate.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “You can look unhappy but feel the opposite. Or vice versa.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It is humanly impossible to be unhappy while you are dancing or laughing willingly.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Soon you will be dead and none of it will matter”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “Appreciating what you have is the best cure for missing what you have lost.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The most fruitful breaks are often those we are or were forced to take by life.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “When you are unhappy, happy people are disgusting.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “You owe it to yourself and to the world to actively engage with the brief moment you have with this planet. You cannot retreat exclusively into ideas. You must contribute.”
author: Ryan Holiday

quote: “Fools refuse to truly believe that a thing can be both delicious or pleasurable … and harmful.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “99.99% of fools deny their foolishness. The rest underestimate it.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “When conversing, some people regularly stop talking, not to listen, but to rest their tongues.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “I sacrificed much to be where I am today, yet I will sacrifice much more to get to where I need to be someday.”
author: Justus Wiezorek

quote: “Part of patience is knowing your truth and staying loyal to it; you just can’t allow your face to betray what an attack on it actually makes you feel.”
author: A.D. Aliwat

quote: “A shallow reading of a problem begets outrage; a detailed approach to a problem encourages moderation.”
author: Dan Crenshaw

quote: “Life is a pilgrimage and a struggle. All we have of time is a moment; the universe is in constant flux; our bodies are fragile; our senses grasp so little; our souls are a mist; the future is a fog; and fame is fleeting.”
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: “How does a person deal with all the heartache and tragedy that fills their life without becoming insane or committing suicide?”
author: Kilroy J Oldster

quote: “Admitting that their child is, or can be, more educated than them is the closest most parents are willing to get to admitting that their child is, or can be, smarter or wiser than them.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Halleck came from people who regarded a slight change of facial expression as adequate to convey the pain of a severed limb.”
author: Miles Watson

quote: “Stoicism is designed to be medicine for the soul.”
author: Ryan Holiday

quote: “See? You're using the stoic glacier method." "Remind me, what's the stoic glacier method?" "It's the slow process of shaping someone's behavior by force of one's own personal stoicism.”
author: Elizabeth Mckenzie

quote: “There was no meaning in why he was here, but he was, and that was enough.”
author: AkshatThakur

quote: “No man is good by chance. Virtue is something which must be learned.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The problem with pleasure is that it needs to be intermittent in order to retain its pleasantness.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “For I am not everlasting, but a human being, a part of the whole as an hour is a part of the day. Like an hour I must come, and like an hour pass away.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Some people are lucky to no longer be, and some are unlucky to still be, alive.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A truth whispered is not less truthful. And an untruth shouted is not less untruthful.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Destroying your mirrors leaves your facial blemishes intact.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “The universe is change, and life mere opinion.”
author: Democrates

quote: “Unless you learn your lesson, it will keep hurting. Not only it will never stop, it will also keep increasing the amount, so you won’t get used to it.”
author: Cave Man

quote: “You are indeed a man of sorrows and have suffered much...pray be seated now, here on this chair, and let us leave our sorrows, bitter though they are, locked up in our own hearts, for weeping is cold comfort and does little good.”
author: Homer

quote: “You can be invincible, if you enter into no contest in which it is not in your power to conquer.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Let death and exile and every other thing which appears dreadful be daily before your eyes; but most of all death: and you will never think of anything mean nor will you desire anything extravagantly.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Some of our problems came to us; some, we went to them.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “It is foolish to give up on yourself. And doubly so to do that before everyone has given up on you.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Engineers can prove that a bumblebee, with its heavy body and little bitty wings, can't fly. But nobody tells the bumblebees ... and they fly just fine.”
author: Bill Bowerman

quote: “Nothing can affect a person’s mind if he chooses not to be affected by it.”
author: Cave Man

quote: “When you are alone, you should call this tranquility and freedom and when you are with many you shouldn’t call this a crowd, or trouble or uneasiness but festival and company and contentedly accept it.”
author: Epictetus

quote: “Destroying your mirrors hides your ugliness or facial blemishes from only you.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Some of the people who we think care that we hate them do not even care that there are people who love them.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Sometimes you find yourself so grateful that a prayer of yours was not answered that you pray that it be ignored. Just in case it is on the waiting list of prayers to be answered.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “A desired thing often comes with seeds of at least one desire.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “Poverty is greatly exaggerated by sanity.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: “We get a taste of death, not when we’re asleep, but when we awake.”
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana
