quote: “The conceptions of life and the world which we call 'philosophical' are a product of two factors: one, inherited religious and ethical conceptions; the other, the sort of investigation which may be called 'scientific”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “It is preoccupation with possessions, more than anything else that prevents man from living freely and nobly.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The secret of happiness is to face the fact that the world is horrible, horrible horrible.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “On the one hand the purposes of the community are enforced upon the individual, and, on the other hand the individual, having acquired the habit of viewing his life as a whole, increasingly sacrifices his present to his future.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “went to Russia a Communist; but contact with those who have no doubts has intensified a thousandfold my own doubts, not as to Communism in itself, but as to the wisdom of holding a creed so firmly that for its sake men are willing to inflict widespread misery.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Unless you assume a God, the question of life's purpose is meaningless.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “William James used to preach the “will to believe.” For my part, I should wish to preach the “will to doubt.” None of our beliefs are quite true; all have at least a penumbra of vagueness and error.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The relation of husband and wife is what is called “one-one.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “I have not found in Wittgenstein's Philosophical Investigations anything that seemed to me interesting and I do not understand why a whole school finds important wisdom in its pages.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The men who founded modern science had two merits which are not necessarily found together: immense patience in observation, and great boldness in framing hypotheses.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “...As soon as the definite knowledge concerning any subject becomes possible, this subject ceases to be called philosophy, and becomes a separate science.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “No one can understand the Stoics and Epicureans without some knowledge of the Hellenistic age, or the scholastics without a modicum of understanding of the growth of the Church from the fifth to the thirteenth centuries.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The fundamental cause of trouble in the world is that the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt.Bertrand Russell (1872-1970)”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Industrial conscription is, of course, rigidly enforced. Every man and woman has to work, and slacking is severely punished, by prison or a penal settlement.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The fact that an opinion has been widely held is no evidence whatever that it is not utterly absurd; indeed, in view of the silliness of the majority of mankind, a widespread belief is more likely to be foolish than sensible”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “When the rapacity of capitalists grows oppressive, one may be suddenly consoled by the recollection that Brutus, that exemplar of republican virtue, lent money to a city at 40 per cent, and hired a private army to besiege it when it failed to pay the interest.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “...Whoever wishes to become a philosopher must learn not to be frightened by absurdities.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Philosophy, if it cannot answer so many questions as we could wish, has at least the power of asking questions which increase the interest of the world, and show the strangeness and wonder lying just below the surface even in the commonest things of daily life. ✦✦✦”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “the fact that the actual inequalities of power exceed what is made necessary by technical causes, can only be explained in terms of individual psychology and physiology.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The energy used in thinking seems to have a chemical origin; for instance, a deficiency of iodine will turn a clever man into an idiot”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The intoxicating delight of sudden understanding.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The examination system, and the fact that instruction is treated mainly as training for a livelihood, leads the young to regard knowledge, from a purely utilitarian point of view, as the road to money, not as the gateway to wisdom.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Draw significant conclusions slowly.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Hence, two very difficult questions at once arise; namely, (1) Is there a real table at all? (2) If so, what sort of object can it be?”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Plato possessed the art to dress up illiberal suggestions in such a way that they deceived future ages, which admired the Republic without ever becoming aware of what was involved in its proposals.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “It seems natural to suppose that self-consciousness is one of the things that distinguish men from animals: animals, we may suppose, though they have acquaintance with sense-data, never become aware of this acquaintance.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Thinking that you know when in fact you don’t is a fatal mistake, to which we are all prone.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wise people so full of doubts.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “There is a possibility in human minds of something mysterious as the night-wind, deep as the sea, calm as the stars, and strong as Death, a mystic contemplation, the “intellectual love of God”.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “self-consciousness is the source of all our knowledge of mental things.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “As soon as we abandon our own reason, and are content to rely upon authority, there is no end to our troubles.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “we can only infer it, and can never be directly and immediately aware of it.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “A good world needs knowledge, kindness and courage. It does not need a regretful hankering after the past or a fettering of free intelligence by the words uttered long ago by ignorant men.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “...the Churches, everywhere, opposed as long as they could practically every innovation that made for an increase of happiness or knowledge here on Earth”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “even Aristotle, though in his time Alexander was making the City State obsolete, could see no merit in any other kind of polity. The degree to which the individual's liberty was”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Instinctive happiness, or joy of life, is one of the most important widespread popular goods that we have lost through industrialism and the high pressure at which most of us live; its commonness in China is a strong reason for thinking well of Chinese civilization.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Throughout the long period of religious doubt, I had been rendered very unhappy by the gradual loss of belief, but when the process was completed, I found to my surprise that I was quite glad to be done with the whole subject.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The happy man is the man who lives objectively, who has free affections and wide interests, who secures his happiness through these interests and affections and through the fact that they, in turn, make him an object of interest and affections to many others.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “See the world as it is and be not afraid of it. Conquer the world by intelligence and not merely by being slavishly subdued by the terror that comes from it!”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “What is matter? Never mind. What is mind? No matter.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “All submissiveness is rooted in fear, whether the leader to whom we submit be human or divine.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Persecution mania is always rooted in a too exaggerated conception of our own merits.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, but wiser people so full of doubts.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “If the matter is one that can be settled by observation, make the observation yourself.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Moral rules ought not to be such as to make instinctive happiness impossible.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “And I gave my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit. For in much wisdom is much grief: and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The modern man thinks that everything ought to be done for the sake of something else, and never for it's own sake.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The State has one purpose which is on the whole good, namely, the substitution of law for force in the relations of men. But”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “For either death is a dreamless sleep—which is plainly good—or the soul migrates to another world.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The modern world unlearned us how to enjoy leisure time, making us think we need to be productive in order to be worthy.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “I do not agree with Plato, but if anything could make me do so, it would be Aristotle’s arguments against him.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves and wiser people so full of doubts.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “All our knowledge, both knowledge of things and knowledge of truths, rests upon acquaintance (connaitre, kennen) as its foundation”
author: bertrand russell

quote: “revert to the analogy of physics: power, like energy, must be regarded as continually passing from any one of its forms into any other, and it should be the business of social science to seek the laws of such transformations”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “But between theology and science there is a No Man's Land, exposed to attack from both sides; this No Man's Land is philosophy.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Whatever can be thought of is an idea in the mind of the person thinking of it; therefore, nothing can be thought of except ideas in minds; therefore, anything else is inconceivable, and what is inconceivable cannot exist.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “...is the argument from design. It sometimes takes a rather curious form; for instance, it is argued that rabbits have white tails in order to be easy to shoot. I do not know how rabbits would view that application. It is an easy argument to parody.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The youth who is capable of becoming a philosopher will be distinguished among his fellows as just and gentle, fond of learning, possessed of a good memory and a naturally harmonious mind.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “0 is the class whose only member is the null-class.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “History should be taught as the history of the rise of civilization, and not as the history of this nation or that. It should be taught from the point of view of mankind as a whole, and not with undue emphasis upon one’s own country.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Obloquy is, to most men, more painful than death; that is one reason why, in times of collective excitement, so few men venture to dissent from the prevailing opinion.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it.”- Bertrand Russell”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “If there is to be less envy, means must be found for remedying this state of affairs, and if no such means are found our civilization is in danger of going down to destruction in an orgy of hatred.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “the circumstances of men’s lives do much to determine their philosophy, but, conversely, their philosophy does much to determine their circumstances.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The number 0 is the number of terms in a class which has no members, i.e. in the class which is called the "null-class.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “very many philosophers, perhaps a majority, have held that there is nothing real except minds and their ideas. Such philosophers are called 'idealists'.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Where the environment is stupid or prejudiced or cruel, it is a sign of merit to be out of harmony with it. And to some degree these characteristics exist in almost every environment.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “one should not regard anything that one accepts as quite certain, but only as probable in a greater or a less degree. Not to be absolutely certain is, I think, one of the essential things in rationality.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “CONQUER THE WORLD BY INTELLIGENCE and not merely by being slavishly subdued by the terror that comes from it.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Philosophic contemplation does not, in its widest survey, divide the universe into two hostile camps -- friends and foes, helpful and hostile, good and bad -- it views the whole impartially.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Under the influence of great fear, almost everybody becomes superstitious.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “There is a certain tendency in our practical age to consider that it does not much matter whether religious teaching is true or not, since the important question is whether it is useful.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “It can be shown that a mathematical web of some kind can be woven about any universe containing several objects. The fact that our universe lends itself to mathematical treatment is not a fact of any great philosophical significance.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “In daily life, we assume as certain many things which, on a closer scrutiny, are found to be so full of apparent contradictions that only a great amount of thought enables us to know what it is that we really may believe.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “all our reasonings concerning causes and effects are derived from nothing but custom; and that belief is more properly an act of the sensitive, than of the cogitative part of our natures.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “The quarrel between Hume and Rousseau is symbolic: Rousseau was mad but influential; Hume was sane but had no followers.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “It will be seen that no sentence can be made up without at least one word which denotes a universal”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three-parts dead.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “For my part, I prefer the ontological argument, the cosmological argument and the rest of the old stock-in-trade, to the sentimental illogicality that has sprung from Rousseau.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Seeing that nearly all the words to be found in the dictionary stand for universals, it is strange that hardly anybody except students of philosophy ever”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “All pure mathematics is a priori, like logic.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “One of the symptoms of approaching nervous breakdown is the belief that one's work is terribly important.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “People believe that what a man needs is work. This, of course, is absurd. What he needs is the goods produced by work, and the less work involved in making a given amount of goods, the better.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Going backward over the day, I find things of which I am quite certain, other things of which I am almost certain, other things of which I can become certain by thought and by calling up attendant circumstances, and some things of which I am by no means certain.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “This failure of the family to provide the fundamental satisfaction which in principle it is capable of yielding is one of the most deep-seated causes of the discontent which is prevalent in our age.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Laws of Thought'. They are as follows: (1) The law of identity: 'Whatever is, is.' (2) The law of contradiction: 'Nothing can both be and not be.' (3) The law of excluded middle: 'Everything must either be or not be.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “we cannot know that anything exists which we do not know.”
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: “Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Man suffers only because he takes seriously what the gods made for fun.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “We seldom realize, for example that our most private thoughts and emotions are not actually our own. For we think in terms of languages and images which we did not invent, but which were given to us by our society.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple. And yet, everybody rushes around in a great panic as if it were necessary to achieve something beyond themselves.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “This is the real secret of life -- to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “To have faith is to trust yourself to the water. When you swim you don't grab hold of the water, because if you do you will sink and drown. Instead you relax, and float.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “You are an aperture through which the universe is looking at and exploring itself.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Through our eyes, the universe is perceiving itself. Through our ears, the universe is listening to its harmonies. We are the witnesses through which the universe becomes conscious of its glory, of its magnificence.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The menu is not the meal.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “You are a function of what the whole universe is doing in the same way that a wave is a function of what the whole ocean is doing.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The more a thing tends to be permanent, the more it tends to be lifeless.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “The art of living... is neither careless drifting on the one hand nor fearful clinging to the past on the other. It consists in being sensitive to each moment, in regarding it as utterly new and unique, in having the mind open and wholly receptive.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Try to imagine what it will be like to go to sleep and never wake up... now try to imagine what it was like to wake up having never gone to sleep.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Problems that remain persistently insoluble should always be suspected as questions asked in the wrong way.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Things are as they are. Looking out into the universe at night, we make no comparisons between right and wrong stars, nor between well and badly arranged constellations.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “A scholar tries to learn something everyday; a student of Buddhism tries to unlearn something daily.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “We do not "come into" this world; we come out of it, as leaves from a tree. As the ocean "waves," the universe "peoples." Every individual is an expression of the whole realm of nature, a unique action of the total universe.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Every intelligent individual wants to know what makes him tick, and yet is at once fascinated and frustrated by the fact that oneself is the most difficult of all things to know.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Life is like music for its own sake. We are living in an eternal now, and when we listen to music we are not listening to the past, we are not listening to the future, we are listening to an expanded present.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “When we attempt to exercise power or control over someone else, we cannot avoid giving that person the very same power or control over us.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Never pretend to a love which you do not actually feel, for love is not ours to command.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “If you say that getting the money is the most important thing, you'll spend your life completely wasting your time. You'll be doing things you don't like doing in order to go on living, that is to go on doing thing you don't like doing, which is stupid.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Zen does not confuse spirituality with thinking about God while one is peeling potatoes. Zen spirituality is just to peel the potatoes.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “One is a great deal less anxious if one feels perfectly free to be anxious, and the same may be said of guilt.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “If we cling to belief in God, we cannot likewise have faith, since faith is not clinging but letting go.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “And people get all fouled up because they want the world to have meaning as if it were words... As if you had a meaning, as if you were a mere word, as if you were something that could be looked up in a dictionary. You are meaning.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “You and I are all as much continuous with the physical universe as a wave is continuous with the ocean.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “How is it possible that a being with such sensitive jewels as the eyes, such enchanted musical instruments as the ears, and such fabulous arabesque of nerves as the brain can experience itself anything less than a god.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “A priest once quoted to me the Roman saying that a religion is dead when the priests laugh at each other across the altar. I always laugh at the altar, be it Christian, Hindu, or Buddhist, because real religion is the transformation of anxiety into laughter.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “But I'll tell you what hermits realize. If you go off into a far, far forest and get very quiet, you'll come to understand that you're connected with everything.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Other people teach us who we are. Their attitudes to us are the mirror in which we learn to see ourselves, but the mirror is distorted. We are, perhaps, rather dimly aware of the immense power of our social enviornment.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The world is filled with love-play, from animal lust to sublime compassion.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “You're under no obligation to be the same person you were 5 minutes ago.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “So then, the relationship of self to other is the complete realization that loving yourself is impossible without loving everything defined as other than yourself.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Irrevocable commitment to any religion is not only intellectual suicide; it is positive unfaith because it closes the mind to any new vision of the world. Faith is, above all, openness - an act of trust in the unknown.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “What we have to discover is that there is no safety, that seeking is painful, and that when we imagine that we have found it, we don’t like it.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Real travel requires a maximum of unscheduled wandering, for there is no other way of discovering surprises and marvels, which, as I see it, is the only good reason for not staying at home.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “If, then, my awareness of the past and future makes me less aware of the present, I must begin to wonder whether I am actually living in the real world.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “There is nothing at all that can be talked about adequately, and the whole art of poetry is to say what can't be said.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “If you cannot trust yourself, you cannot even trust your mistrust of yourself - so that without this underlying trust in the whole system of nature you are simply paralyzed”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “It’s better to have a short life that is full of what you like doing, than a long life spent in a miserable way.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “I am what happens between the maternity ward and the Crematorium”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “...[W]ords can be communicative only between those who share similar experiences.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “If you get the message, hang up the phone. For psychedelic drugs are simply instruments, like microscopes, telescopes, and telephones. The biologist does not sit with eye permanently glued to the microscope, he goes away and works on what he has seen.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “There was a young man who said though, it seems that I know that I know, but what I would like to see is the I that knows me when I know that I know that I know.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Just as true humor is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledgeof oneself.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “We do not "come into" this world; we come out of it, as leaves from a tree.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The clash between science and religion has not shown that religion is false and science is true. It has shown that all systems of definition are relative to various purposes, and that none of them actually “grasp” reality.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “No one is more dangerously insane than one who is sane all the time: he is like a steel bridge without flexibility, and the order of his life is rigid and brittle.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “But my dear man, reality is only a Rorschach ink-blot, you know.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “If the universe is meaningless, so is the statement that it is so. If this world is a vicious trap, so is its accuser, and the pot is calling the kettle black.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Peace can be made only by those who are peaceful, and love can be shown only by those who love. No work of love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “You do not play a sonata in order to reach the final chord, and if the meanings of things were simply in ends, composers would write nothing but finales.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Zen is a liberation from time. For if we open our eyes and see clearly, it becomes obvious that there is no other time than this instant, and that the past and the future are abstractions without any concrete reality.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Hospitals should be arranged in such a way as to make being sick an interesting experience. One learns a great deal sometimes from being sick. ”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “For if you know what you want, and will be content with it, you can be trusted. But if you do not know, your desires are limitless and no one can tell how to deal with you. Nothing satisfies an individual incapable of enjoyment.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Technology is destructive only in the hands of people who do not realize that they are one and the same process as the universe. ”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “I find that the sensation of myself as an ego inside a bag of skin is really a hallucination.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “If happiness always depends on something expected in the future, we are chasing a will-o’-the-wisp that ever eludes our grasp, until the future, and ourselves, vanish into the abyss of death.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “the future is a concept—it doesn’t exist﻿ There is no such thing as tomorrow There never will be because time is always now. That’s one of the things we discover when we stop talking to ourselves and stop thinking. We find there is only present, only an eternal now.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “You are that vast thing that you see far, far off with great telescopes.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “We know that from time to time, there arise among human beings, people who seem to exude love as naturally as the sun gives out heat.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “When we dance, the journey itself is the point, as when we play music the playing itself is the point. And exactly the same thing is true in meditation. Meditation is the discovery that the point of life is always arrived at in the immediate moment.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “The source of all light is in the eye.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Jesus was not the man he was as a result of making Jesus Christ his personal savior.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “You didn't come into this world. You came out of it, like a wave from the ocean. You are not a stranger here.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Philosophers, for example, often fail to recognize that their remarks about the universe apply also to themselves and their remarks. If the universe is meaningless, so is the statement that it is so.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “I owe my solitude to other people.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Normally, we do not so much look at things as overlook them.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “People become concerned with being more humble than other people.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “a man does not really begin to be alive until he has lost himself, until he has released the anxious grasp which he normally holds upon his life, his property, his reputation and position.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “In reality there are no separate events. Life moves along like water, it's all connected to the source of the river is connected to the mouth and the ocean.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The morning glory which blooms for an hour differs not at heart from the giant pine, which lives for a thousand years.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “For there is never anything but the present, and if one cannot live there, one cannot live anywhere.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “The centipede was happy, quite, Until a toad in fun Said, “Pray, which leg goes after which?” This worked his mind to such a pitch, He lay distracted in a ditch, Considering how to run.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “In looking out upon the world, we forget that the world is looking at itself.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Like love, the light or guidance of truth that influences us exists only in living form, not in principles or rules or expectations or advice, however widely circulated”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “It is hard indeed to notice anything for which the languages available to us have no description.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Our pleasures are not material pleasures, but symbols of pleasure – attractively packaged but inferior in content.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Just as money is not real, consumable wealth, books are not life. To idolize scriptures is like eating paper currency.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “I have no other self than the totality of things of which I am aware.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “He who thinks that God is not comprehended, by him God is comprehended; but he who thinks that God is comprehended knows him not. God is unknown to those who know him, and is known to those who do not know him at all.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “To travel is to be alive, but to get somewhere is to be dead, for as our own proverb says, “To travel well is better than to arrive.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Belief clings, but faith lets go.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “When you find out that there was never anything in the dark side to be afraid of … Nothing is left but to love.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Instant coffee, for example, is a well–deserved punishment for being in a hurry to reach the future.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The religious idea of God cannot do full duty for the metaphysical infinity.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Stay in the center, and you will be ready to move in any direction.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “The mystery of life is not a problem to be solved but a reality to be experienced.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Genuine love comes from knowledge, not from a sense of duty or guilt.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Do not let the rapidity with which these thoughts can change deceive you into feeling that you think them all at once.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Human desire tends to be insatiable.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Life exists only at this very moment, and in this moment it is infinite and eternal. For the present moment is infinitely small; before we can measure it, it has gone, and yet it persists for ever.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Society is our extended mind and body.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Nothing fails like success—because the self-imposed task of oursociety and all its members is a contradiction: to force things to happenwhich are acceptable only when they happen without force.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “You will never get to the irreducible definition of anything because you will never be able to explain why you want to explain, and so on. The system will gobble itself up.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The ego-self constantly pushes reality away. It constructs a future out of empty expectations and a past out of regretful memories.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “only doubtful truths need defense.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Great power is worry, and total power is boredom, such that even God renounces it and pretends, instead, that he is people and fish and insects and plants: the myth of the king who goes wandering among his subjects in disguise.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Hurrying and delaying are alike ways of trying to resist the present.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Playing a violin is, after all, only scraping a cat's entrails with horsehair.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “A world which increasingly consists of destinations without journeys between them, a world which values only "getting somewhere" as fast as possible, becomes a world without substance.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “If we are open only to discoveries which will accord with what we know already, we may as well stay shut.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “life requires no future to complete itself nor explanation to justify itself. In this moment it is finished.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Only words and conventions can isolate us from the entirely undefinable something which is everything.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “For if we open our eyes and see clearly, it becomes obvious that there is no other time than this instant, and that the past and the future are abstractions without any concrete reality.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “I am basically an eternal existence momentarily and perhaps needlesslyterrified by one half of itself..”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Man aspires to govern nature, but the more one studies ecology, themore absurd it seems to speak of any one feature of an organism, or ofan organism/environment field, as governing or ruling others.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Paradox as it may seem, we likewise find life meaningful only when we have seen that it is without purpose, and know the “mystery of the universe” only when we are convinced that we know nothing about it at all.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “every individual is a unique manifestation of the Whole, as every branch is a particular outreaching of the tree.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “My death will be the disappearance of a particular pattern in the water.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “But when you know for sure that your separate ego is a fiction, you actually feel yourself as the whole process and pattern of life. Experience and experiencer become one experiencing, known and knower one knowing.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Much of the secret of life consists in knowing how to laugh, and also how to breathe.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “One's life is an act with no actor, and thus it has always been recognized that the insane man that has lost his mind is a parody of the sage who has transcended his ego. If one is paranoid, the other is metanoid.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “As long as you do not know how to die and come to life again, you are but a sorry traveler on this dark earth.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “The frightened mind that runs away from everyday terrors meets the seeking mind that wants a better world.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “The common error of ordinary religious practice is to mistake the symbol for the reality, to look at the finger pointing the way and then to suck it for comfort rather than follow it.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “The paradox about waking up—I mean the ordinary kind of waking up that occurred to you and me this morning—is that you can’t make it happen, yet it’s inevitable. The same holds true spiritually. You can’t wish, pray, beg, force, or meditate yourself awake.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Self-consciousness is a stoppage because it is like interrupting a song after every note so as to listen to the echo, and then feeling irritated because of the loss of rhythm.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “For eternally and always there is only now, one and the same now; the present is the only thing that has no end.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “To travel is to be alive, but to get somewhere is to be dead.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Reasonable–that is, human–men will always be capable of compromise, but men who have dehumanized themselves by becoming the blind worshipers of an idea or an ideal are fanatics whose devotion to abstractions makes them the enemies of life.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The more a person knows of himself, the more he will hesitate to define his nature and to assert what he must necessarily feel, and the more he will be astounded at his capacity to feel in unsuspected and unpredictable ways.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “In a relativistic universe you don't cling to anything, you learn to swim. And you know what swimming is - it's kind of a relaxed attitude with the water. In which you don't keep yourself afloat by holding the water, but by a certain giving to it.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “For we have never actually understood the revolutionary sense beneath them – the incredible truth that what religion calls the vision of God is found in giving up any belief in the idea of God.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Problems that remain persistently insoluble should always be suspected as questions asked in the wrong way”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “This is the inevitable disadvantage of studying Asian philosophy by the purely literary methods of Western scholarship, for words can be communicative only between those who share similar experiences.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Evil” read backwards is “live.” Demon est deus inversus.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “A mind that is single and sincere is not interested in being good, in conducting relations with other people so as to live up to a rule. Nor, on the other hand, is it interested in being free, in acting perversely just to prove its independence.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Today we hear a lot of songs about love, and the mention of the big love thing on the way. You know what I would do? I would buy a gun and bar my door because I would know there is a storm of hypocrisy brewing.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “If you want to get the plain truth, Be not concerned with right and wrong. The conflict between right and wrong Is the sickness of the mind.1 a”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “When life is empty, with respect to the past, and aimless, with respect to the future, the vacuum is filled by the present - normally reduced to a hairline, a split second in which there is no time for anything to happen.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “tomorrow and plans for tomorrow can have no significance at all unless you are in full contact with the reality of the present, since it is in the present and only in the present that you live.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Make a spurious division of one process into two, forget that you have done it, and then puzzle for centuries as to how the two get together.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Idolatry is not the use of images, but confusing them with what they represent, and in this respect mental images and lofty abstractions can be more insidious than bronze idols”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Chuang-tzu: ‘‘The perfect man employs his mind as a mirror; it grasps nothing; it refuses nothing; it receives, but does not keep.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “We do not dance to reach a certain point on the floor, but simply to dance. Energy itself, as William Blake said, is eternal delight—and all life is to be lived in the spirit of rapt absorption in an arabesque of rhythms.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “who believe more firmly in the Devil than in God are always afraid that if they let go, the Devil will take over first, unaware that not having let go is the Devil already in full control.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Trust in human nature is acceptance of the good-and-bad of it, and it is hard to trust those who do not admit their own weakness.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Herein lies the crux of the matter. To stand face to face with insecurity is still not to understand it. To understand it, you must not face it but be it.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “To be free from convention is not to spurn it but not to be deceived by it. It is to be able to use it as an instrument instead of being used by it.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Once the mind has seen through all fear and all hope, it finds peace within itself, in a state of awareness beyond thought.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “The brain can only assume its proper behavior when consciousness is doing what it is designed for: not writhing and whirling to get out of present experience, but being effortlessly aware of it.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Lao-tzu, that master of the law of reversed effort, who declared that those who justify themselves do not convince, that to know truth one must get rid of knowledge, and that nothing is more powerful and creative than emptiness—from which men shrink.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “the most basic Buddhist stance: sober examination of what lies before you, leaving aside all assumptions.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Just as true humour is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledge of oneself.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “[A] certain amount of "sitting just to sit" might well be the best thing in the world for the jittery minds and agitated bodies [...].”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “If a man seeks the Buddha, that man loses the Buddha.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “We can’t reimpose old myths on ourselves or believe in new ones made up out of a desire for comfort; therefore, the path of self-examination is the only one a person of conscience can reasonably follow.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Nobody believes in God like an atheist: 'There is no God, and I am His prophet.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “[T]he joy of travel is not nearly so much in getting where one wants to go as in the unsought surprises which occur on the journey.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Kindly let me help you or you will drown said the monkey putting the fish safely up a tree.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Taoists do not look upon meditation as 'practice,' except in the sense that a doctor 'practices' medicine. They have no design to subjugate or alter the universe by force or willpower, for their art is entirely to go along with the flow of things in an intelligent way.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Life and love generate effort, but effort will not generate them.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “it is really impossible to appreciate what is meant by the Tao without becoming, in a rather special sense, stupid.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Part of man's frustration is that he has become accustomed to expect language and thought to offer explanations which they cannot give.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “I’m a philosopher. If you don’t argue with me, I don’t know what to think. So if we argue, I have to say “thank you,” because owing to the courtesy of your taking a different point of view, I understand what I think and mean. So I can’t get rid of you.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Wonder, and its expression in poetry and the arts, are among the most important things which seem to distinguish men from other animals, and intelligent and sensitive people from morons.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Human beings appear to be happy just so long as they have a future to which they can look forward—whether it be a “good time” tomorrow or an everlasting life beyond the grave.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “We have untold stacks of recorded music from every age and culture, and the most superb means of playing it. But who actually listens? Maybe a few pot-smokers.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The knowledge of the past stays with us. To let go is simply to release any images and emotions.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “And if I forget how many times I have been here, and in how many shapes, this forgetting is the necessary interval of darkness between every pulsation of light. I return in every baby born.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Discord on one level is harmony on another”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “The only way to make sense of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “If happiness always depends on something expected in the future, we are chasing a will-o’-the-wisp that ever eludes our grasp, until the future, and ourselves, vanish into the abyss of death. As”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “A successful college president once complained to me, I'm so busy that I'm going to have to get a helicopter! Well, I answered, you'll be ahead so long as you're the only president who has one. But don't get it. Everyone will expect more out of you.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The person who is constantly anxious is the person who is resisting the flip-flopability of things.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Struggle as we may, “fixing” will never make sense out of change. The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “If we are to have intense pleasures, we must also be liable to intense pains.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Because all is lost, there is nothing to lose”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Consciousness seems to be nature's ingenious mode of self-torture.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “All too easily, we confuse the world as we symbolize it with the world as it is. As semanticist Alfred Korzybski used to say, it is an urgent necessity to distinguish between the map and the territory and, he might have added, between the flag and the country.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “read omnivorously”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “we are convinced that sleep is a waste of valuable time and continue to chase these fantasies far into the night.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Time itself is a creation of the restless mind; space has been created by the same mind to give itself room to wander when in fact there is no space beyond a mental construct that, like all constructs, eventually turns into a prison.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Most of us believe in order to feel secure, in order to make our individual lives seem valuable and meaningful.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “For the trouble with our rich and powerful people is not so much that they are wicked, but that they do not enjoy themselves.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “It is obvious that the only interesting people are interested people, and to be completely interested is to have forgotten about “I.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “All belief is fervent hope, and thus a cover-up for doubt and uncertainty.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Without birth and death, and without the perpetual transmutation of all the forms of life, the world would be static, rhythm-less, undancing, mummified.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Death seems simply to be a return to that unknown inwardness out of which we were born...the truly inward source of one's life was never born...Outwardly I am one apple among many. Inwardly I am the tree.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Actually, the world is not complex. It is the task of trying to figure it out with words or numbers that is complex.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “But the attitude of faith is to let go, and become open to truth, whatever it might turn out to be.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “We fall in love with people and possessions only to be tortured by anxiety for them.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “it just happens, and all happenings are mutually interdependent in a way that seems unbelievably harmonious.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Money alone cannot buy pleasure, though it can help. For enjoyment is an art and a skill for which we have little talent or energy.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “[T]he art of life is more like navigation than warfare, for what is important is to understand the winds, the tides, the currents, the seasons, and the principles of growth and decay, so that one's actions may use them and not fight them.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Logic, intelligence, and reason are satisfied, but the heart goes hungry.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “what will happen to me when I die is, after all, like asking what happens to my fist when I open my hand”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “[T]he anxiety-laden problem of what will happen to me when I die is, after all, like asking what happens to my fist when I open my hand, or where my lap goes when I stand up.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “I have always thought that all philosophical debates are ultimately between the partisans of structure and the partisans of "goo.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Every one of us is an aperture through which the whole cosmos looks out.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “We suffer from the delusion that the entire universe is held in order by the categories of human thought, fearing that if we do not hold to them with the utmost tenacity, everything will vanish into chaos. We”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “A myth is an image in terms of which we try to make sense of the world.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “You may think there’s no point in singing unless you are good at it, but that is like saying there is no point in doing anything at all unless you are particularly gifted at it, which is ridiculous.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “The possession of a strong will and a clever head makes some things very difficult to see”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Indeed, the power of words has gone to man’s head in more than one way. To define has come to mean almost the same thing as to understand.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Eskimos have five words for different kinds of snow, because they live with it and it is important to them. But the Aztec language has but one word for snow, rain, and hail.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Egg is ego, and bird is the liberated Self.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Life is a series of urgent choices demanding firm commitment to this or to that.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “For eternally and always there is only now, one and the same now; the present is the only thing that has no end.4”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “In the Gestalt theory of perception this is known as the figure/groundrelationship. This theory asserts, in brief, that no figure is ever perceivedexcept in relation to a background.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Like words, memories never really succeed in “catching” reality.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “But if you do not know, your desires are limitless and no one can tell how to deal with you. Nothing satisfies an individual incapable of enjoyment.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Life seems to be a system that eats itself to death, and in which victory equals defeat.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “[T]o be forever looking beyond is to remain blind to what is here.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “But peace can be made only by those who are peaceful, and love can be shown only by those who love. No work of love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “What do you desire? What makes you itch? What sort of a situation would you like?”
author: alan watts

quote: “The sense of wrong is simply failure to see where something fits into a pattern[.]”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “When each moment becomes an expectation life is deprived of fulfillment, and death is dreaded for it seems that here expectation must come to an end.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “For if we do not know even how we manage to be conscious and intelligent, it is most rash to assume that we know what the role of conscious intelligence will be, and still more that it is competent to order the world.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “As muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone, it could be argued that those who sit quietly and do nothing are making one of the best possible contributions to a world in turmoil.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “… tomorrow and plans for tomorrow can have no significance at all unless you are in full contact with the reality of the present, since it is in the present and only in the present that you live.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “It is simply being aware of this present experience, and realizing that you can neither define it nor divide yourself from it. There is no rule but “Look!”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “[T]he natural universe is not a linear system. It involves an infinitude of variables interacting simultaneously, so that it would take incalculable aeons to translate even one moment of its operation into linear, alphabetic language.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Life, like getting an erection, is a spontaneous process which collapses when one tries to force it to happen.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “But dispelling this dread isn’t a matter of trying to forget about washing dishes, it is realizing that in actual fact you only have one dish to wash, ever: this one; only one step to take, ever: this one. And that is Zen.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “In the Garden of Eden Adam saw the animals before he named them: in the traditional system, children named the animals before they saw them.1”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “hurry, and all that it involves, is fatal.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Sorrow can only be compared with the memory of joy, which is not at all the same thing as joy itself. Like words, memories never really succeed in "catching" reality.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Trying not to grasp is the same thing as to grasp since it's motivation is the same, my urgent desire to save my self from a difficulty. I can not get rid of this desire since it is one and the same desire as the desire to get rid of it.”
author: Alan watts

quote: “There is no other reality than present reality, so that, even if one were to live for endless ages, to live for the future would be to miss the point everlastingly.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “is in vain that doctors prolong life if we spend the extra time being anxious to live still longer.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Part of man's frustration is that he has become accustomed to expect language and thought to offer explanations which they cannot give. To want life to be intelligible in this sense is to want it to be something other than life.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “To practice with an end in view is to have one eye on the practice and the other on the end, which is lack of concentration, lack of sincerity.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “In a civilization devoted to the strictly abstract and mathematical ideal of making the most money in the least time, the only sure method of success is to cheat the customer, to sell various kinds of nothingness in pretentious packages.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “There was a young man who said, “Though It seems that I know that I know, What I would like to see Is the ‘I’ that knows ‘me’ When I know that I know that I know.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “as masters of technical weapons we are fighting the environment as if we still believed ourselves to be strangers on the earth, sent down into this world from a purely abstract, ideational, and spiritual heaven.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “We do not “come into” this world; we come out of it, as leaves from a tree. As the ocean “waves,” the universe “peoples." Every individual is an expression of the whole realm of nature, a unique action of the total universe.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “To define means to fix, and, when you get down to it, real life isn’t fixed.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “Know yourself as Nothing. Feel yourself as Everything.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “The death of the individual is not disconnection but simply withdrawal. The corpse is like a footprint or an echo—the dissolving trace of something which the Self has ceased to do.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “It is a special kind of enlightenment to have this feeling that the usual, the way things normally are, is odd—uncanny and highly improbable.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “To "know" reality you cannot stand outside it and define it; you must enter into it, be it, and feel it.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “The common mistake of the religious celibate has been to suppose that the highest spiritual life absolutely demands the renunciation of sexuality, as if the knowledge of God were an alternative to the knowledge of woman, or to any other form of experience.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The organism of man does not confront the world but is in the world.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Sexuality is not a separate compartment of human life; it is a radiance pervading every human relationship, but assuming a particular intensity at certain points.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “We have arbitrarily agreed to define the sun by the limit of its visible fire.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Thus not to see the unity of self and other is the fear of life, and not to see the unity of being and nonbeing is the fear of death.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “The rift between God and nature would vanish if we knew how to experience nature, because what keeps them apart is not a difference of substance but a split in the mind.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Every explicit duality is an implicit unity.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “You don’t understand the basic assumptions of your own culture if your own culture is the only culture you know.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “a bird is one egg’s way of becoming other eggs.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Death is the unknown in which all of us lived before birth.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Such questions as "Why this universe?" are a kind of intellectual neurosis, amisuse of words in that the question sounds sensible but is actually asmeaningless as asking "Where is this universe?”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “There is no greater freedom than the freedom to be what you are now.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Those who speak, do not know; those who know, do not speak.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “you don’t die because you were never born. You had just forgotten who you are.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “man seems to be unable to live without myth, without the belief that the routine and drudgery, the pain and fear of this life have some meaning and goal in the future.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “You don't have to let go, because there's nothing to hold onto. --Alan Watts”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “A great Zen master said just before he died, "From the bathtub, to the bathtub, I have uttered stuff and nonsense." The bathtub in which the baby is washed at birth, the bathtub in which the corpse is washed before burial, all this time I have said much nonsense.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “We cannot be more sensitive to pleasure without being more sensitive to pain.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “I assume that maybe you are not serious, but sincere.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “When you no longer make the distinction between the universe and how you are acting upon it, you are really on your own and so acquire a sense of responsibility.”
author: Alan Wilson Watts

quote: “To “have” running water you must let go of it and let it run. The same is true of life and of God.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “If it is true that “when the wrong man uses the right means, the right means work in the wrong way,” it is often also true that when the right man uses the wrong means, the wrong means work in the right way.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “My conscious mind must have its roots and origins in the most unfathomable depths of being, yet it feels as if it lived all by itself in this tight little skull.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “For most of us, the other half of sanity lies simply in seeing and enjoying the unknown, just as we can enjoy music without knowing either how it is written or how the body hears it.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “fear is born of duality—”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “It is not well known that all the best angels wear their haloes jauntily, over one ear.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “By itself, a tree is meaningless, but it is the meaning of the word “tree.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “the greatest illusion of the abstract ego is that it can do anything to bring about radical improvement either in itself or in the world.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “This is not a philosophy of not looking where one is going; it is a philosophy of not making where one is going so much more important than where one is that there will be no point in going.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “[...]all saints need sinners.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “When you get the message, it's time to hang up the phone.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “Tools such as these, as well as the tools of language and thought, are of real use to men only if they are awake -- not lost in the dreamland of past and future, but in the closest touch with that point of experience where reality can alone be discovered: this moment.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “The power of memories and expectations is such that for most human beings the past and the future are not as real, but more real than the present. The present cannot be lived happily unless the past has been “cleared up” and the future is bright with promise.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Is a long life such a good thing if it is lived in daily dread of death or in constant search for satisfaction in a tomorrow which never comes?”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “All too easily, we confuse the world as we symbolize it with the world as it is.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “If living is to end in pain, incompleteness, and nothingness, it seems a cruel and futile experience for beings who are born to reason, hope, create, and love.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “[A]ny system which leaves the individual upon one horn of the dualistic dilemma is at best the achievement of courageous despair.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Doctors try to get rid of their patients - clergymen try to get them hooked on the medicine so that they will become addicts to the church.”
author: Alan Watts

quote: “What we know by memory, we know only at secondhand.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Problems that remain persistently insoluble should always be suspected as questions asked in the wrong way,”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “salvation and sanity consist in the most radical recognition that we have no way of saving ourselves. This”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “As poets value the sounds of words above their meanings, and images above arguments, I am trying to get thinking people to be aware of the actual vibrations of life as they would listen to music.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “You want to escape from pain, but the more you struggle to escape, the more you inflame the agony. You are afraid and want to be brave, but the effort to be brave is fear trying to run away from itself.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “If there was a big bang at the beginning of time, you are not something that is the result of that explosion at the end of the process. You are the process.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “For the task of the psychotherapist is to bring about a reconciliation between individual feeling and social norms without, however, sacrificing the integrity of the individual.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “The human organism has the same kind of innate intelligence as the ecosystems of nature, and the wisdom of the nerves and senses must be watched with patience and respect.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “Aesthetics is really a much better approach to ethics than theology is.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “we can only believe in what we have already known, preconceived, and imagined. But this is beyond any imagination.”
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: “In knowing the world we humanize it, and if, as we discover it, we are astonished at its dimensions and its complexity, we should be just as astonished that we have the brains to perceive it.”

quote: “We do not really want continuity, but rather a present experience of total happiness.”
