quote: “We labour at our daily work more ardently and thoughtlessly than is necessary to sustain our life because it is even more necessary not to have leisure to stop and think. Haste is universal because everyone is in flight from himself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In reality, hope is the worst of all evils, because it prolongs man’s torments.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Words are but symbols for the relations of things to one another and to us; nowhere do they touch upon absolute truth.... Through words and concepts we shall never reach beyond the wall off relations, to some sort of fabulous primal ground of things.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Anyone who has declared someone else to be an idiot, a bad apple, is annoyed when it turns out in the end that he isn't. ”
author: Friedrich Neitzsche

quote: “The noble soul reveres itself”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “there they laugh: they do not understand me; I am not the mouth for these ears.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Even the most beautiful scenery is no longer assured of our love after we have lived in it for three months, and some distant coast attracts our avarice: possessions are generally diminished by possession.”
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: “When one has not had a good father, one must create one.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I want to learn more and more to see as beautiful what is necessary in things:—then I shall be one of those who make things beautiful. Amor fati: let that be my love from henceforth!”
author: NIETZSCHE FREDERICH

quote: “To see others suffer does one good, to make others suffer even more: this is a hard saying but an ancient, mighty, human, all-too-human principle [....] Without cruelty there is no festival.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You tell me: 'Life is hard to bear.' But if it were otherwise why should you have your pride in the morning and your resignation in the evening?Life is hard to bear: but do not pretend to be so tender! We are all of us pretty fine asses and asseses of burden!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Here the ways of men divide. If you wish to strive for peace of soul and happiness, then believe; if you wish to be a disciple of truth, then inquire.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “As soon as a religion comes to dominate it has as its opponents all those who would have been its first disciples. ”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The desire for a strong faith is not the proof of a strong faith, rather the opposite. If one has it one may permit oneself the beautiful luxury of skepticism: one is secure enough, fixed enough for it.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “No one dies of fatal truths nowadays: there are too many antidotes.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Every profound spirit needs a mask: even more, around every profound spirit a mask is continually growing.”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “So long as men praise you, you can only be sure that you are not yet on your own true path but on someone else's.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “if we possess a why of life we can put up with almost any how.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The mother of excess is not joy but joylessness.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Whatever is done for love always occurs beyond good and evil.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Christianity was from the beginning, essentially and fundamentally, life's nausea and disgust with life, merely concealed behind, masked by, dressed up as, faith in "another" or "better" life.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Oh great star! What would your happiness be if you did not have us to shine for?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Love of one is a piece of barbarism: for it is practised at the expense of all others. Love of God likewise.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I love the great despisers because they are the great adorers...”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche "Thus Spoke Zarathustra"

quote: “no one talks more passionately about his rights than he who in the depths of his soul doubts whether he has any”
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: “The more abstract the truth you wish to teach, the more you need to seduce the senses to it.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “My humanity is a constant self-overcoming.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The secret of reaping the greatest fruitfulness and the greatest enjoyment from life is to live dangerously.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “That for which we find words is something already dead in our hearts”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is not conflict of opinions that has made history so violent but conflict of belief in opinions, that is to say conflict of convictions.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Let old ones go. Dont be a memory-monger!Once you were young──now you are even younger.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The greatest cure for love is still that time honoured medicine - love returned.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Our faith in others betrays that we would rather have faith in ourselves. Our longing for a friend is our betrayer. And often with our love we want merely to overcome envy. And often we attack and make ourselves enemies, to conceal that we are vulnerable.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “He who speaks a bit of a foreign language has more delight in it than he who speaks it well; pleasure goes along with superficial knowledge.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Swallow your poison, for you need it badly.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Art is essentially the affirmation, the blessing, and the deification of existence.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What is good? All that heightens the feeling of power, the will to power, power itself. What is bad? All that is born of weakness. What is happiness? The feeling that power is growing, that resistance is overcome.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Character is determined more by the lack of certain experiences than by those one has had.”
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: “He who fights with monsters should be careful lest he thereby become a monster.And if thou gaze long into an abyss, the abyss will also gaze into thee.”
author: Nietzche

quote: “Those who hear not the music think the dancers mad.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The wreckage of stars - I built a world from this wreckage.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “At times one remains faithful to a cause only because its opponents do not cease to be insipid.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “If you wish to strive for peace of soul and pleasure, then believe; if you wish to be a devotee of truth, then inquire.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The most common sort of lie is that by which a man deceives himself: the deception of others is a relatively rare offense.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “He who delights in solitude is either a wild beast or a god.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A man far oftener appears to have a decided character from persistently following his temperament than from persistently following his principles.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The best of all things is something entirely outside your grasp: not to be born, not to be, to be nothing. But the second best thing for you is to die soon.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I overcame myself, the sufferer; I carried my own ashes to the mountains; I invented a brighter flame for myself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “...all that is rare is for the rare.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “My formula for happiness: a Yes, a No, a straight line, a goal.”
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: “We ought to face our destiny with courage.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Your educators can only be your liberators.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Christianity remains to this day the greatest misfortune of humanity.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When you look into an abyss, the abyss also looks into you.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “But in the loneliest desert happens the second metamorphosis: here the spirit becomes a lion; he will seize his freedom and be master in his own wilderness.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “That for which we find words is something already dead in our hearts. There is always a kind of contempt in the act of speaking.”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “Are you a slave? Then you cannot be a friend. Are you a tyrant? Then you cannot have friends.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Well-meaning, helpful, good-natured attitudes of mind have not come to be honored on account of their usefulness, but because they are states of richer souls that are capable of bestowing and have their value in the feeling of the plenitude of life.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Though I may seem at times somewhat distant from you, through the gray mist of philology, I am never far, my thoughts always circle around you.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The great periods of our life occur when we gain the courage to rechristen what is bad about us as what is best.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Man does not strive for happiness; only the Englishman does that.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Being human is a complicated gig. So give that ol' dark night of the soul a hug. Howl the eternal yes![N.B. this is obviously a humorous paraphrase]”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I and me are always too deeply in conversation: how could I endure it,if there were not a friend?The friend of the hermit is always the third one: the third one is the float which prevents the conversation of the two from sinking into the depth.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Every talent must unfold itself in fighting.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “God is dead, but considering the state the species man is in, there will perhaps be caves, for ages yet, in which his shadow will be shown.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Is man one of God’s blunders, or is God one of man’s blunders?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I consist of body and soul - in the worlds of a child. And why shouldn't we speak like children? But the enlightened, the knowledgealbe would say: I am body through and through, nothing more; and the soul is just a word for something on the body.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “How much truth does a spirit endure, how much truth does it dare?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Digressions, objections, delight in mockery, carefree mistrust are signs of health...”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Under peaceful conditions a warlike man sets upon himself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Which is it? Is man only a blunder of God? Or is God only a blunder of man?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “it is only as an aesthetic phenomenon that existence and the world are eternally justified.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Worldly WisdomDo not stay in the field!Nor climb out of sight.The best view of the worldIs from a medium height.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Ten truths must you find during the day; otherwise will you seek truth during the night, and your soul will have been hungry.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “For truth to tell, dancing in all its forms cannot be excluded from the curriculum of all noble education: dancing with the feet, with ideas, with words, and, need I add that one must also be able to dance with pen- that one must learn how to write”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Morality is just a fiction used by the herd of inferior human beings to hold back the few superior men.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Good writers have two things in common: they prefer to be understood rather than admired; and they do not write for knowing and over-acute readers.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And to me also, who appreciate life, the butterflies, and soap-bubbles, and whatever is like them amongst us, seem most to enjoy happiness.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “All truth is simple ... is that not doubly a lie?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Pity is the most agreeable feeling among those who have little pride and no prospects of great conquests.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Either one does not dream, or one does so interestingly. One should learn to spend one's waking life in the same way: not at all, or interestingly.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Every profound spirit needs a mask”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I go into solitude so as not to drink out of everybody's cistern. When I am among the many I live as the many do, and I do not think I really think. After a time it always seems as if they want to banish my self from myself and rob me of my soul.”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm

quote: “The complete irresponsibility of man for his actions and his nature is the bitterest drop which he who understands must swallow.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You say that a good cause will even sanctify war! I tell you, it is the good war that sanctifies every cause!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Behold! I am weary of my wisdom, like the bee that has gathered too much honey; I need hands outstretched to take it from me. I wish to spread it and bestow it, until the wise have once more become joyous in their folly, and the poor happy in their riches.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To live is to suffer; to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Let us beware of saying that death is the opposite of life. The living being is only a species of the dead, and a very rare species.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In some remote corner of the universe, poured out and glittering among innumerable solar systems, there once was a star on which clever animals invented knowledge.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In truth, man is a polluted river. One must be a sea to receive a polluted river without becoming defiled. I bring you the Superman! He is that sea; in him your great contempt can be submerged.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To him who feels himself preordained to contemplation and not to belief, all believers are too noisy and obtrusive; he guards against them.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And if you are not a bird, then beware of coming to rest above an abyss.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Thus I spoke, more and more softly; for I was afraid of my own thoughts and the thoughts behind my thoughts.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “How can those who live in the light of the day possibly comprehend the depths of the night?”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “He who fights with monsters should be careful lest he thereby become a monster. And if thou gaze long into an abyss, the abyss will also gaze into thee.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A nation is a detour of nature to arrive at five or six great men- yes, and then to get around them.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Without myth, however, every culture loses its healthy creative natural power: it is only a horizon encompassed with myth that rounds off to unity a social movement.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Resentment, born of weakness, harms no one more than the weak person himself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Of what is great one must either be silent or speak with greatness. With greatness--that means cynically and with innocence.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “How lovely it is that there are words and sounds. Are not words and sounds rainbows and illusive bridges between things which are eternally apart?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Not that you lied to me but that I no longer believe you has shaken me.”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “Ultimately no one can hear in things
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Merchant and pirate were for a long period one and the same person. Even today mercantile morality is really nothing but a refinement of piratical morality.”
author: Frederich Nietzsche

quote: “Life is that which must overcome itself again and again”
author: NIETZSCHE FREDERICH

quote: “We would not let ourselves be burned to death for our opinions: we are not sure enough of them for that.”
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: “In revenge and in love woman is more barbaric than man is.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Digressions, objections, delight in mockery, carefree mistrust are signs of health; everything unconditional belongs in pathology. ”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “This book belongs to the most rare of men. Perhaps not one of them is yet alive. First the day after tomorrow must come for me. Some men are born posthumously.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We talk so abstractly about poetry because all of us are usually bad poets.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “How does one become stronger? By deciding slowly; and by holding firmly to the decision once it is made. Everything else follows of itself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The consequences of our actions take hold of us, quite indifferent to our claim that meanwhile we have 'improved.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Human history would be nothing but a record of stupidity save for the cunning contributions of the weak”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There is a point in every philosophy at which the "conviction" of the philosopher appears on the scene; or, to put it in the words of an ancient mystery: adventavit asinus, / pulcher et fortissimus. (Translation: The ass arrives, beautiful and most brave.)”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And we should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once. And we should call every truth false which was not accompanied by at least one laugh”
author: Friederich Nietzsche

quote: “Whoever knows he is deep, strives for clarity; whoever would like to appear deep to the crowd, strives for obscurity. For the crowd considers anything deep if only it cannot see to the bottom: the crowd is so timid and afraid of going into the water.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Companions the creator seeks, not corpses, not herds and believers. Fellow creators the creator seeks -- those who write new values on new tablets. Companions the creator seeks, and fellow harvesters; for everything about him is ripe for the harvest.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Women are considered deep - why? Because one can never discover any bottom to them. Women are not even shallow. ”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And as long as you are in any way ashamed before yourself, you do not yet belong with us.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “All credibility, all good conscience, all evidence of truth come only from the senses.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Do you want to go along with others? or go on ahead? or go off on your own?...you must know what  you want and that you want. Fourth question for the conscience.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Creating—that is the great salvation from suffering, and life's alleviation. But for the creator to appear, suffering itself is needed, and much transformation.”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm

quote: “Try for once to justify the meaning of your existence as it were a posteriori by setting yourself an aim, a goal... an exalted and noble 'to this end.' Perish in pursuit of this and only this”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One has to know the size of one's stomach.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When man does not have firm, calm lines on the horizon of his life- mountain and forest lines, as it were- then a man's innermost will becomes agitated, preoccupied, and wistful.”
author: Friedrich Nietzche

quote: “Almost everything we call "higher culture" is based on the spiritualization of cruelty.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I would believe only in a god who could dance. And when I saw my devil I found him serious, thorough, profound, and solemn: it was the spirit of gravity - through him all things fall.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Go up close to your friend but do not go over to him! We should respect the enemy that is in our friend”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Something unappeased, unappeasable, is within me.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Behind a remarkable scholar we not infrequently find an average human being, and behind an average artist we often find a very remarkable human being.”
author: Friedrich Neitzsche

quote: “He is called a free spirit who thinks differently from what, on the basis of his origin, environment, his class and profession, or on the basis of the dominant views of the age, would have been expected of him”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I am alone again and I want to be so; alone with the pure sky and open sea.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In letting God sit in judgment they judge themselves; in glorifying God they glorify themselves.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I fear that, with our current veneration for the natural and the real, we have arrived at the opposite pole to all idealism, and have landed in the region of the waxworks.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The wisest man would be the one richest in contradictions, who has, as it were, antennae for all types of men---as well as his great moments of grand harmony---a rare accident even in us! A sort of planetary motion---”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Reason" in language - oh, what an old deceptive female she is! I am afraid we are not rid of God because we still have faith in grammar.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Do you deserve truth? You sure seek it, but do you deserve it? If you want to see real things burning you first have to reach up to the height of the fire.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To get up in the morning, in the fullness of youth, and open a book--now that’s what I call vicious!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Not he is great who can alter matter, but he who can alter my state of mind.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What does our great historical hunger signify, our clutching about us of countless cultures, our consuming desire for knowledge, if not the loss of myth, of a mythic home, the mythic womb?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Weariness that wants to reach the ultimate with one leap, with one fatal leap, a poor ignorant weariness that does not want to want any more: this created all gods and afterworlds.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We set no special value on the possession of a virtue until we percieve that it is entirely lacking in our adversary.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Disobedience- that is the nobility of slaves.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One is punished most for one’s virtues.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There is not enough religion in the world to destroy the world’s religions.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “No one can draw more out of things, books included, than he already knows. A man has no ears for that to which experience has given him no access.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What do you consider the most humane? - To spare someone shame. What is the seal of liberation? - To no longer be ashamed in front of oneself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Everything in the world displeases me: but, above all, my displeasure in everything displeases me.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The majority of men prefer delusion to truth. It soothes. It is easy to grasp.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is a terrible thought, to contemplate that an immense number of mediocre thinkers are occupied with really influential matters.”
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: “What really raises one's indignation against suffering is not suffering intrinsically, but the senselessness of suffering”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In conversation we are sometimes confused by the tone of our own voice, and mislead to make assertions that do not at all correspond to our opinions.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Solitude is a virtue for us, since it is a sublime inclination and impulse to cleanliness which shows that contact between people, “society”, inevitably makes things unclean. Somewhere, sometime, every community makes people—“base.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is not the strength, but the duration, of great sentiments that makes great men.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Not every end is the goal. The end of a melody is not its goal,  and yet if  a melody has not  reached its end, it has not reached its goal.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Our crime against criminals lies in the fact that we treat them like rascals.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The person who fights monsters should make sure that in the process, he does not become a monster himself. Because when you stare down at an abyss, the abyss stares back at you.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Only ideas won by walking have any value.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Dostoevsky,the only psychologist from whom I've anything to learn.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Human life is inexplicable, and still without meaning: a fool may decide its fate.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Poets treat their experiences shamelessly: they exploit them”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “State is the name of the coldest of all cold monsters. Coldly it lies; and this lie slips from its mouth: 'I, the state, am the people.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Lightning and thunder require time, the light of the stars requires time, deeds require time even after they are done, before they can be seen and heard.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You should seek your enemy, you should wage your war - a war for your opinions. And when your opinion is defeated, our honesty should still cry triumph over that!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What? A great man? I only ever see the ape of his own ideal.”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich

quote: “Deeds need time, even after they are done, in order to be seen or heard.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It may be that until now there has been no more potent means for beautifying man himself than piety: it can turn man into so much art, surface, play of colors, graciousness that his sight no longer makes one suffer.---”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is the evening that questions thus from within me.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “‎The struggle of maturity is to recover the seriousness of a child at play.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “On the mountains of truth you can never climb in vain: either you will reach a point higher up today, or you will be training your powers so that you will be able to climb higher tomorrow. -”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Reality is a flux, an endless becoming that is beyond words and language - all language is metaphor, useful to us but ultimately detached from reality.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Under peaceful conditions, the warlike man attacks himself.”
author: Freidrich Nietzsche

quote: “One thing a man must have: either a naturally light disposition or a disposition lightened by art and knowledge.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You have evolved from worm to man, but much within you is still worm. Once you were apes, yet even now man is more of an ape than any of the apes.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Water is sufficient...the spirit moves over water.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A man who wills commands something within himself that renders obedience, or that he believes renders obedience.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Was aus Liebe getan wird, geschieht immer jenseits von Gut und Böse. (What is done out of love always takes place beyond good and evil.)”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Never trust a thought that occurs to you indoors.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is invisible hands that torment and bend us the worst”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “God is dead, God remains dead, and we have killed him.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Man is the most bungled of all the animals, the sickliest, and not one has strayed more dangerously from its instincts. But for all that, of course, he is the most interesting.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The value of a thing sometimes lies not in what one attains with it, but in what one pays for it - what it costs us.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Those moralists, on the other hand, who, following in the footsteps of Socrates, offer the individual a morality of self-control and temperance as a means to his own advantage, as his personal key to happiness, are the exceptions.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You may lie with your mouth, but with the mouth you make as you do so you none the less tell the truth.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And when he invented his hell, that was his heaven on earth.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Even the most courageous among us only rarely has the courage to face what he already knows.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Existence really is an imperfect tense that never becomes a present.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Art is not merely an imitation of the reality of nature, but in truth a metaphysical supplement to the reality of nature, placed alongside thereof for its conquest. ”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Are you one who looks on? or lends a hand? - or who looks away, sidles off?...Third question for the conscience.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What is good? - All that heightens the feelings of power, the will to power, power itself in man. What is bad? - All that proceeds from weakness. What is happiness? - The feeling that power increases - that a resistance is overcome.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “the lie is a condition of life.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Mystical explanations are considered deep. The truth is that they are not even superficial.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Healthy introspection, without undermining oneself; it is a rare gift to venture into the unexplored depths of the self, without delusions or fictions, but with an uncorrupted gaze.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The images of myth must be the daemonic guardians, omnipresent and unnoticed, which protect the growth of the young mind, and guide man's interpretation of his life and struggles.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “if you kill a cockroach you are a hero, if you kill a butterfly, you are evil. morals have aesthetic criteria.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Fanatics are picturesque, mankind would rather see gestures than listen to reasons.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The word "Christianity" is already a misunderstanding; in reality there has been only one Christian, and he died on the cross.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “. . . there is no being behind doing, effecting, becoming; "the doer" is merely a fiction added to the deed—the deed is everything.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There are days when I am haunted by a feeling that is blacker than the blackest melancholy. I have a contempt for humanity. I despise the people I have been fated to call my contemporaries. I feel suffocated by their filthy breath.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Dead are all gods: now we want the overman to live.”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm

quote: “Every achievement, every step forward in knowledge, is the consequence of courage, of toughness towards oneself, of sincerity to oneself”
author: Freidrich Neitzsche

quote: “You say you're a pessimist, but I happen to know that you're in the habit of practicing your flute for two hours every evening.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Men of profound sadness betray themselves when they are happy: they have a mode of seizing upon happiness as though they would choke and strangle it, out of jealousy--ah, they know only too well that it will flee from them!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The existence of forgetting has never been proved: we only know that some things do not come to our mind when we want them to.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And life confided the secret to me: behold, it said, l am that which must always overcome itself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Courage, however, is the best slayer—courage which attacks: which slays even death itself, for it says, 'Was that life? Well then! Once more!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “if a person wishes to achieve peace of mind and happiness then they should acquire faith, but if they want to be a disciple of truth, which can be "frightening and ugly,” then they need tosearch.”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich

quote: “The melancholy of everything completed!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Here the spirit becomes a lion who would conquer his freedom and be master…Who is the great dragon whom the spirit will no longer call lord and go? ‘Thou shalt’ is the name of the great dragon.But the spirit of the lion says, ‘I will.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Sometimes it is harder to accede to a thing than it is to see its truth.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “For nothing is more democratic than logic; it is no respecter of persons and makes no distinction between crooked and straight noses.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It takes chaos to give birth to a dancing star”
author: Frederick Nietzsche

quote: “Supposing truth is a woman -- what then?”

quote: “God is a thought who makes crooked all that is straight. ”

quote: “As an artist, a man has no home in Europe save in Paris.”

quote: “I am a disciple of the philosopher Dionysus, and I would prefer to be even a satyr than a saint.”

quote: “The demand to be loved is the greatest of all arrogant presumptions.”

quote: “Saying yes to life, even in its strangest and hardest problems.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When a woman has scholarly inclinations there is usually something wrong with her sexuality.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Without music, life would be a mistake.. I would only believe in a God who knew how to dance.”

quote: “I do not refute ideals, I merely put on gloves when I deal with them...”

quote: “It is not doubt but certainty that drives you mad...”

quote: “... all life rests on appearance, art, illusion, optics, the need for perspective and for error...”

quote: “Every acquisition, every step forward in knowledge is the result of courage, of severity toward oneself, of cleanliness with respect to oneself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Energy wasted on negative ends.”

quote: “None of the people have any real interest in a science, who only begin to be enthusiastic about it when they themselves have made discoveries in it.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is intoxicating joy for the sufferer to look away from his suffering and to forget himself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Joyous distrust is a sign of health. Everything absolute belongs to pathology.”

quote: “It is a pity that there was no Dostoevsky living near this most interesting decadent [Jesus], I mean someone with an eye for the distinctive charm that this sort of mixture of sublimity, sickness, and childishness has to offer.”

quote: “...inability to lie is still far from being love to truth. Be on your guard! ... He who cannot lie, doth not know what truth is.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A man recovers best from his exceptional nature - his intellectuality - by giving his animal instincts a chance.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In every real man, a child is hidden that wants to play.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What have we in common with the rosebud, which trembles because a drop of dew is lying upon it?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In the end one experiences only oneself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To be sure, I am a forest, and a night of dark trees: but (s)he who is not afraid of my darkness, will find banks full of roses under my cypresses.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Every word is a prejudice.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Where one can no longer love, there one should pass by.”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm

quote: “But like infection is the petty thought: it creeps and hides, and wants to be nowhere--until the whole body is decayed and withered by the petty infection... Thus spoke Zarathustra.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There is a false saying, ‘Whoever cannot save himself - how can he save others?’ But if I have the key to your chains, why should your and my lock be the same.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “He who has a Why can endure any How.”
author: Frederick Nietzsche

quote: “The Christian faith from the beginning, is sacrifice the sacrifice of all freedom, all pride, all self-confidence of spirit, it is at the same time subjection, self-derision, and self-mutilation.”

quote: “I have done that', says my memory. I cannot have done that—says my pride and remains unshakeable. Finally—memory yields.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The best friend will probably acquire the best wife, because a good marriage is founded on the talent for friendship.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There have been two great narcotics in European civilisation: Christianity and alcohol.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The misunderstanding of passion and reason, as if the latter were an independent entity and not rather a system of relations between various passions and desires; and as if every passion did not possess its quantum of reason”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When we have to change an opinion about any one, we charge heavily to his account the inconvenience he thereby causes us.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Perhaps I am even envious of Stendhal? He robbed me of the best atheist joke which precisely I could have made: 'God's only excuse is that he does not exist'...I myself have said somewhere: what hitherto been the greatest objection to existence? God...”
author: Fredrich Nietzsche

quote: “[T]he mob is the most ruthless of tyrants;”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I deny morality as I deny alchemy.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I and me are always too deeply in conversation.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Man will desire oblivion rather than not desire at all.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Altered opinions do not alter a man’s character (or do so very little); but they do illuminate individual aspects of the constellation of his personality which with a different constellation of opinions had hitherto remained dark and unrecognizable.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I attack only things that are triumphant — if necessary, I wait until they become triumphant.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “My melancholy wants to rest in the hiding places and abysses of perfection: that is why I need music.”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich

quote: “And if you gaze for long into an abyss, the abyss gazes also into you.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Out of life's school of war: What does not destroy me, makes me stronger.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When a hundred men stand together, each of them loses his mind and gets another one.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Democracy represents the disbelief in all great men and in all elite societies: everybody is everybody else's equal, 'At bottom we are all herd and mob.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “This woman is beautiful and clever: but how much cleverer she would have become if she were not beautiful!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “But the thought is one thing, the deed is another, and another yet is the image of the deed. The wheel of causality does not roll between them.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “With hard men intimacy is a thing of shame- and something precious.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You shall love beyond yourselves some day! So first, learn to love. And for that you have to drink the bitter cup of your love.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “throw roses into the abyss and say: ‘here is my thanks to the monster who didn't succeed in swallowing me alive.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Every habit makes our hand more witty, and out wit more handy.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is disgraceful for a philosopher to say: the good and the beautiful are one; if he adds 'also the true', one ought to beat him. Truth is ugly. We possess art lest we perish of the truth.”

quote: “He who does not lie does not know what truth is.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Do you love tragedies and everything that breaks the heart?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There is one path in the world that none can walk but you. Where does it lead? Don’t ask, walk!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I would not know what the spirit of a philosopher might wish more to be than a good dancer.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The spirit now wills his own will, and he who had been lost to the world now conquers the world.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What has shaken me is not that you lied to me, but that I no longer believe you.”

quote: “the process of evolution does not necessarily mean elevation, enhancement, strengthening.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “All modern philosophizing is political, policed by governments, churches, academics, custom, fashion, and human cowardice, all of which limit it to a fake learnedness.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Foolish is my happiness, and foolish things will it speak: it is still too young—so have patience with it!”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm

quote: “The believer in magic and miracles reflects on how to impose a law on nature--: and, in brief, the religious cult is the outcome of this reflection.”

quote: “Great intellects are skeptical.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “...'I suffer: someone or other must be guilty' – and every sick sheep thinks the same.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Man is no longer an artist, he has become a work of art.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “People have always wanted to 'improve' human beings; for the most part, this has been called morality.”

quote: “I would only believe in a God that wold know how to dance.”
author: Fredrich Nietzsche

quote: “The good men of every age are those who go to the roots of the old thoughts and bear fruit with them.”

quote: “There's no defense against stupidity.”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm

quote: “One should not go into churches if one wishes to breathe pure air.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Truth as Circe. - Error has transformed animals into men; is truth perhaps capable of changing man back into an animal?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “That is an artist as I love artists, modest in his needs: he really wants only two things, his bread and his art - panem et Circen.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Life is hard to bear: but do not pretend to be so delicate!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Nobody is more inferior than those who insist on being equal .”

quote: “He whom the flame of jealousy encompasses, will at last, like the scorpion, turn the poisoned sting against himself.”

quote: “as though "the Truth" were such an innocent and incompetent creature as to require protectors!”

quote: “The strongest intimidation, by the way, is the invention of a hereafter with a hell everlasting.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Women can form a friendship with a man very well; but to preserve it, a slight physical antipathy most probably helps.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I might believe in the Redeemer if his followers looked more redeemed.”

quote: “For man to be redeemed from revenge, that is for me the bridge to the highest hope, and a rainbow after long storms.Distrust all in whom the impulse to punish is powerful!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We do not belong to those who have ideas only among books, when stimulated by books. It is our habit to think outdoors - walking, leaping, climbing, dancing, preferably on lonely mountains or near the sea where even the trails become thoughtful.”

quote: “Life is at an end where the kingdom of God begins”

quote: “Loneliness is one thing, solitude another: you have learned that - now!”

quote: “philosophy is not suited for the masses, what they need is holiness.”

quote: “Visiting the sick' is an orgasm of superiority in the contemplation of our neighbor's helplessness”

quote: “The wittiest authors raise the very slightest of smiles.”

quote: “They devour each other and cannot even digest themselves.”

quote: “They would have to sing better songs for me to learn to have faith in their Redeemer; and his disciples would have to look more redeemed!”

quote: “Some cannot loosen their own chains and can nonetheless redeem their friends.”

quote: “When one has much to put in them, a day has a thousand pockets.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What? A great man? I always see merely the play-actor of his own ideal.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche

author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “They fear their higher self, because when it speaks, it speaks demandingly.”

quote: “The perfect woman indulges in literature just as she indulges in a small sin: as an experiment, in passing, looking around to see if anybody notices it — and to make sure that somebody does.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A little wisdom is indeed possible; but this blessed security have I found in all things, that they prefer--to DANCE on the feet of chance.”

quote: “we often refuse to accept an idea merely because the way in which it has been expressed is unsympathetic to us.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We are noble, good, beautiful, and happy!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “For others do I wait...for higher ones, stronger ones, more triumphant ones, merrier ones, for such as are built squarely in body and soul: laughing lions must come.”

quote: “The bite of conscience is indecent.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In solitude the solitary man consumes himself, in the crowd the crowd consumes him.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “All great artists and thinkers are great workers.”

quote: “The most basic form of human stupidity is forgetting what we are trying to accomplish.”

quote: “My wisdom has accumulated long like a cloud, it becomes stiller and darker. So does all wisdom which shall one day bear lightnings.-”

quote: “I would prefer to be a satyr rather than a saint.”

quote: “Morality negates life.”

quote: “Your bad love of yourselves makes solitude a prison to you.”

quote: “To live is to suffer,to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering”

quote: “Slow is the experience of all deep fountains: long have they to wait until they know what has fallen into their depths.”

quote: “Human existence basically is──a never to be completed imperfect tense.”

quote: “We like to be out in nature so much because it has no opinion about us.”

quote: “When thou goest to woman, take thy whip.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When virtue has slept, it will arise again all the fresher.”

quote: “He who fights with monsters should look to it that he himself does not become a monster. And when you gaze long into an abyss the abyss also gazes into you.”

quote: “Happiness: being able to forget or, to express in a more learned fashion.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “He who knows the reader, does nothing for the reader.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Only great pain is the ultimate liberator of the spirit….I doubt that such pain makes us ‘better’; but I know that it makes us more profound.”

quote: “Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster.”

quote: “All good things are powerful stimulants to life, even a good book written against life.”

quote: “Aristotle says that in order to live alone one must either be an animal or a god. The third alternative is lacking. A man must be both; a philosopher.”

quote: “For fanaticism is the only form of willpower that even the weak and insecure can be brought to attain.”

quote: “There is no pre-established harmony between the furtherance of truth and the well-being of mankind.”

quote: “The majority of men prefer delusion to truth. It soothes. It is easy to grasp. Above all, it fits more snugly than the truth into a universe of false appearances—of complex and irrational phenomena, defectively grasped.”

quote: “How good music and bad reasons sound when one marches against an enemy.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “If thinking is your fate, revere this fate with divine honour and sacrifice to it the best, the most beloved”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Man is a rope stretched between the animal and the Superman—a rope over an abyss. A dangerous crossing, a dangerous wayfaring, a dangerous looking-back, a dangerous trembling and halting.”

quote: “Ye shall only have foes to be hated; but not foes to be despised: ye must be proud of your foes.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Tethered heart, free spirit.--If one tethers one's heart severely and imprisons it, one can give one's spirit many liberties.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A. Was I ill? Have I got well? Who was my doctor? Can you tell? Oh, my memory is rotten!B. Only now you're truly well. Those are well who have forgotten.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A degree of culture, and assuredly a very high one, is attained when man rises above superstitions and religious notions and fears, and, for instance, no longer believes in guardian angels or in original sin, and has also ceased to talk of the salvation of his soul.”

quote: “Always look on the bright side of the abyss”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is not their love for men, rather it is the impotence of their love that hinders Christians of today from burning us.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Three metamorphoses of the spirit have I designated to you: how thespirit became a camel, the camel a lion, and the lion at last a child.”

quote: “Pitch-black winter nights live in my bones.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Every kind of contempt for sex, every impurification of it by means of the concept "impure", is the crime par excellence against life--is the real sin against the holy spirit of life”

quote: “Another Christian concept, no less crazy, has passed even more deeply into the tissue of modernity: the concept of the 'equality of souls before God.' This concept furnishes the prototype of all theories of equal rights...”

quote: “Books for the masses are always bad-smelling books: the odour of little people cling to them.”

quote: “The belly is the reason why man does not mistake himself for a god.”

quote: “We have to cease to think, if we refuse to do it in the prison house of language; for we cannot reach further than the doubt which asks whether the limit we see is really a limit.”

quote: “We can destroy only as creators”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is a curious thing that God learned Greek when he wished to turn author--and that he did not learn it better.”

quote: “Write with blood, and you will find that blood is spirit.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “ridendo dicere severum. (tr. Through what is laughable say what is somber.)”
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: “A friend should be a master at guessing and keeping still: you must not want to see everything.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The certain prospect of death could sweeten every life with a precious and fragrant drop of levity; and now you strange apothecary souls have turned it into an ill-tasting drop of poison that makes the whole of life repulsive.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Moderation sees itself as beautiful; it is unaware that in the eye of the immoderate it appears black and sober and consequently ugly-looking”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “All that exists is just and unjust and is equally justified in both respects.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Alas, where is there still a sea in which one could drown: thus our lament resounds – across shallow swamps. ”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “thou great star! what would be thy happiness if thou hadst not those for whom thou shinest!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “If a man has a great deal to put in them, a day will have a hundred pockets.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Life consists of rare, isolated moments of the greatest significance, and of innumerable many intervals, during which at best the silhouettes of those moments hover about us.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I love all those who are heavy drops falling from the dark cloud that hangs over men: they herald the advent of lightning, and, as heralds, they perish.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Smooth iceis paradisefor those who dance with expertise.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Terribleness is part of greatness: let us not deceive ourselves.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Whence come the highest mountains? I once asked. Then I learned that they came out of the sea. The evidence is written in their rocks and in the walls of their peaks. It is out of the deepest depth that the highest must come to its height.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To make an individual uncomfortable, that is my task.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “That which intoxicates, the sensually ecstatic, the sudden surprise, the urge to be profoundly stirred at any price -- dreadful tendencies!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We possess art lest we perish of the truth.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The noble man wants to create something new and a new virtue. The good want the old, and that old should be preserved.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To leave is to suffer,to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We are, all of us, growing volcanoes that approach the hour of their eruption, but how near or distant that is, nobody knows- not even God.”
author: Fredrich Nietzsche

quote: “love as a passion—it is our European specialty—must absolutely be of noble origin; as is well known, its invention is due to the Provencal poet-cavaliers, those brilliant, ingenious men of the "gai saber," to whom Europe owes so much, and almost owes itself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Sharp and mild, dull and keen,well known and strange, dirty and clean,where both the fool and wise are seen:All this am I, have ever been, -in me dove, snake and swine convene!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “How could you rise anew if you have not first become ashes?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “If you would go up high, then use your own legs! Do not get yourselves carried aloft; do not seat yourselves on other people's backs and heads!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I love him whose soul is so overfull that he forgets himself, and all things are in him: thus all things become his going under.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Any human being who does not wish to be part of the masses need only stop making things easy for himself. Let him follow his conscience, which calls out to him: “Be yourself! All that you are now doing, thinking, desiring, all that is not you.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Mankind ought constantly to be striving to produce Great Men --this and nothing else is its duty”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The sick are the greatest danger for the healthy; it is not from the strongest that harm comes to the strong, but from the weakest.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A time came when one rubbed one's eyes; one is still rubbing them today.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is not the victory of science that distinguishes our nineteenth century, but the victory of scientific method over science.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The domestication (the culture) of man does not go deep--where it does go deep it at once becomes degeneration (type: the Christian). The 'savage' (or, in moral terms, the evil man) is a return to nature--and in a certain sense his recovery, his cure from 'culture'.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I do not know how to make a distinction between tears and music﻿”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Popular medicine and popular morality belong together and ought not to be evaluated so differently as they still are: both are the most dangerous pseudo-sciences.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Not one shred of evidence supports the notion that life is serious.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “People who have given us their complete confidence believe that they have a right to ours. The inference is false, a gift confers no rights.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “So I ask my pride that it always go along with my wisdom. And when my wisdom leaves me one day alas - it loves to flyway - let my pride then fly with my folly.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “My thoughts’, said the wanderer to his shadow, ‘should show me where I stand, but they should not betray to me where I am going. I love ignorance of the future and do not want to perish of impatience and premature tasting of things promised.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “very popular error: having the courage of one's convictions—? Rather it is a matter of having the courage for an attack on one's convictions”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “...good men never tell the truth. The good taught you false shores and false securities: you were born and kept in the lies of the good. Everything has been distorted and twisted down to its very bottom through the good”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A day when you haven't danced, you haven't lived.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Every moment of life wants to tell us something, but we do not want to hear what it has to say: when we are alone and quiet we are afraid that something will be whispered into our ear and hence we despise quiet and drug ourselves with sociability.”
