quote: “Every Profound thinker is more afraid of being understood than of being misunderstood”
author: Fredrich Nietzsche

quote: “There are no egoistic or unegoistic actions: both concepts are psychological absurdities.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Fear is the mother of morality.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “On a political sickbed a people is usually rejuvenated and rediscovers its spirit, after having gradually lost it in seeking and preserving power. Culture owes its peaks to politically weak ages.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Life without music is a mistake.”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “The fleetest beast to bear you to perfection is suffering.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “If you still experience the stars as something "over you," you still don't have the eyes of a knower.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is unworthy of great spirits to spread abroad the agitation they feel”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What makes Heroic? — To face simultaneously one’s greatest suffering and one’s highest hope.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I am the leading strings of the ego and the prompter of its concepts.”
author: Friedrich Neitzsche

quote: “Like tourists huffing and puffing to reach the peak we forget the view on the way up.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Valuing is creating: hear it, you creators! Valuing itself is the treasure and jewel of all valued things.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “what was silent in the father speaks in the son”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Still am I the richest and most to be envied - I, the lonesomest one!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Among the things that can drive a thinker to despair is the knowledge that the illogical is necessary for man and that much good comes from it.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Man vergibt seinem Lehrer schlecht, wenn man immer nur der Schüler bleibt. (One repays a teacher badly if one always remains nothing but a pupil.)”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Ah, give me madness, you heavenly powers! Madness, that I may at last believe in myself!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Our age knows better.... What was formerly merely sickly now becomes indecent—it is indecent to be a Christian today.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The secret for harvesting from existence the greatest fruitfulness and greatest enjoyment is - to live dangerously.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Something might be true, even if it is also harmful and dangerous in the highest degree; indeed, it might be part of the essential nature of existence that to understand it completely would lead to our own destruction.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Dangerous Helpfulness. There are people who want to make men's lives more difficult for no other reason than afterwards to offer them their prescriptions for making life easier -- their Christianity, for example.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When a human being resists his whole age and stops it at the gate to demand an accounting, this must have influence.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The sublime man has the highest value, even when he is most delicate and fragile, because an abundance of very difficult and rare things have been bred and united in him.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The criminal type is the type of the strong human being under unfavorable circumstances: a strong human being made sick.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Each individual represents the whole course of Evolution and he is not, as morals teach, something that begins at his birth.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “God is a conjecture; but I desire that your conjectures should be limited by what is thinkable. Can you think a god? [...] You should think through your own senses to their consequences.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “...the Germans love frankness and honesty. It is so convenient to be frank and honest. This confidingness, this complacence, this showing the cards of German honesty, is probably the most dangerous and most successful disguise which the German is up to nowadays.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What is it that I especially find utterly unendurable? That I cannot cope with, that makes me choke and faint? Bad air! Bad air! The approach of some ill-constituted thing; that I have to smell the entrails of some ill-constituted soul!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One must learn to love oneself- thus do I teach- with a wholesome and healthy love: that one may endure to be with oneself, and not go roving about.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We have already gone beyond whatever we have words for.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One puts to one’s lips what drives one faster into the abyss”.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “All my human relationships have to do with a mask of me, and I must perpetually be the victim of living a completely hidden life.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And if your friend does evil to you, say to him, ''I forgive you for what you did to me, but how can I forgive you for what you did to yourself?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “history would be nothing but a record of stupidity save for the cunning”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We are unknown to ourselves, we knowers, and with good reason. We have never looked at ourselves.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What does nihilism mean? That the highest values devaluate themselves. The aim is lacking; 'why?' finds no answer.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Hypocrisy has its place in the ages of strong belief: in which even when one is compelled to exhibit a different belief one does not abandon the belief on already has.”
author: Frederich Nietzsche

quote: “What matters is not eternal life but eternal vivacity.”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “... first learn to construct the parts properly before it ventures to fashion a great whole; ...”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Why," said the saint, "did I go into the forest and the desert? Was it not because I loved mankind far too well? Now I love God! Mankind I do not love; mankind is a thing too imperfect for me. Love of mankind would be fatal to me.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “From the beginning, nothing has been more alien, repugnant, and hostile to woman than truth -- her great art is the lie, her highest concern is mere appearance of beauty.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “let man fear woman when she loves. then she bears every sacrifice and every other thing she accounts valueless.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Extreme positions are not relieved by more moderate ones, but by extreme opposite positions.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Where solitude endeth, there beginneth the market-place; and where the market-place beginneth, there beginneth also the noise of the great actors, and the buzzing of the poison-flies.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “But let me reveal my heart to you entirely, my friends: if there were gods, how could I endure not to be a god! Hence there are no gods.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I have been casting shadows all my life without caring about how deeply they stain my soul.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Oh, my friends, that your self be in your deed as the mother is in her child - let that be your word concerning virtue!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Of all that is written, I love only that which a man has written with his blood. Write with blood, and you will find that blood is spirit.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When I am all alone, I often, very often, say your name aloud…”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “All history is the experimental refutation of the theory of the so-called moral order of things.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You force all things to flow towards you and into you, so that they shall flow back again out of your fountain as the gifts of your love.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “the existence of the world is justified only as an aesthetic phenomenon.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “For your Bildung you should choose the most difficult and splendid problem, but as subject for a dissertation choose no more than a very limited and remote corner.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What does Nihilism mean?—That the highest values are losing their value.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “For the male sickness of self-contempt, the surest cure is to be loved by a clever woman”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Egoism is the law of perspective applied to feelings: what is closest appears large and weighty, and as one moves farther away size and weight decrease.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Art as the single superior counter-force against all will to negation of life, art as the anti-Christian, anti-Buddhist, anti-Nihilist par excellence.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Every means hitherto employed with the intention of making mankind moral has been thoroughly immoral.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “By saying 'God sees into the heart' it denies the deepest and the highest desires of life and takes God for the enemy of life. The saint in whom God takes pleasure is the ideal castrate. Life is at an end where the kingdom of God begins.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To impose the character of being upon becoming is the supreme test of power.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I mistrust all Systematisers and I avoid them — the will to a System is a lack of integrity.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One does not hate as long as one disesteems, but only when one esteems equal or superior”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I learned to walk; since then I have let myself run. I learned to fly; since then I do not need pushing in order to move from a spot.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Don't ask, How will I climb the mountain, just climb the mountain.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is the business of the very few to be independent; it is a privilege of the strong. And whoever attempts it, even with the best right, but without being OBLIGED to do so, proves that he is probably not only strong, but also daring beyond measure.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One person is always too many around me.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There is one thing one has to have: either a soul that is cheerful by nature, or a soul made cheerful by work, love, art, and knowledge.”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “You have been a poor observer of life if you have not also seen the handthat, ever so gently – kills.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When the centre of gravity of life is placed, not in life itself, but in “the beyond”—in nothingness—then one has taken away its centre of gravity altogether.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “If you crush a cockroach, you're a hero. If you crush a beautiful butterfly, you're a villain. Morals have aesthetic criteria.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You revere me: but what if your reverence should some day collapse? Be careful lest a statue fall and kill you!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “More honestly and purely speaks the healthy body, perfect and square-built; and it speaks of the meaning of the earth.-”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In many people, incidentally, the gift of having good friends is much greater than the gift of being a good friend.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I live in my own place. I never copied anybody, not even half. And at any master who lacks the grace to laugh at himself, I laugh.”
author: Frederich Nietzsche

quote: “I wish men would begin by respecting themselves: everything else follows from that. To be sure, as soon as one does this one is finished for others: for this is what they forgive last: 'What? A man who respects himself?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To live is to suffer, to survive is to find something worth suffering for.”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “Equality before the enemy -that is the main condition to fight a fair duel. Where you have contempt, you cannot wage war; where you are in command, where you can see someone beneath you, you should not wage war.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A great truth wants to be criticized not idolized”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “Solitude has seven skins; nothing gets through any more.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We are so fond of being out in Nature because it has no opinions of us.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You have made danger your vocation; there is nothing contemptible in that. Now you perish of your vocation: for that I will bury you with my own hands”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A dangerous crossing, a dangerous wayfaring, a dangerous looking-back, a dangerous trembling and halting.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The ancestors of the mightiest tribes must have grown to prodigious proportions . . . in the end the ancestor is necessarily transfigured into a god.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Men after death are understood worse than men of the moment, but heard better.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The knight of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies, but also to hate his friends.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Even now it is ceasing to be art of the nobleman, and it is quite possible that some day one may find it so common and even vulgar that, along with all party literature and journalism, one would classify it as "prostitution of the spirit.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Re-create yourselves: and let this be your best creation.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The man who fights too long against dragons becomes a dragon himself.”
author: Frederick Nietzsche

quote: “It is so little true that martyrs offer any support to the truth of a cause thatI am inclined to deny that any martyr has ever had anything to do with thetruth at all.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “24. O sancta simplicitas! In what strange simplification and falsification man lives! One can never cease wondering when once one has got eyes for beholding this marvel! How we have made everything around us clear and free and easy and simple!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “we must now and then be joyful in our folly, that we may continue to be joyful in our wisdom!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The body is a big sagacity, a plurality with one sense, a war and a peace, a flock and a shepherd.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One does not hate as long as one has a low esteem of someone, but only when one esteems him as an equal or a superior.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “He who strays from tradition becomes asacrifice to the extraordinary; he who remains in tradition is itsslave. Destruction follows in any case.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The men of the period of corruption are witty and calumnious; they know that there are yet other ways of murdering than by the dagger and ambush--they know also that all that is well said is believed in.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Since I grew weary of the searchI taught myself to find insteadSince cross winds caused my ship to lurchI sail with all winds straight ahead.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “If someone wants to seem to be something, stubbornly and for a long time, he eventually finds it hard to be anything else. The profession of almost every man, even the artist, begins with hypocrisy, as he imitates from the outside, copies what is effective.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A man's stomach is the reason he does not easily take himself for a God.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Women are still cats and birds. Or at the best, cows.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Mathematics would certainly have not come into existence if one had known from the beginning that there was in nature no exactly straight line, no actual circle, no absolute magnitude.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “An instinct is weakened when it rationalises itself: for by rationalising itself it weakens itself.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Why?" said Zarathustra. "Thou askest why? I do not belong to those who may be asked after their Why.”
author: NIETZSCHE FRIEDRICH WILHELM

quote: “In all speaking there is a grain of contempt. Language, so it seems, was invented only for what is mediocre, common, communicable. In language, speakers vulgarize themselves right away.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One does not attack a person merely to hurt and conquer him, but perhaps merely to become conscious of one's own strength.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Ten truths must you find during the day; otherwise you will seek truth during the night, and your soul will stay hungry. Ten times must you laugh during the day, and be cheerful; otherwise your stomach, the father of affliction and gloom, will disturb you in the night.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One should adopt only those situations in which is in no need of sham virtues, but rather, like the tight-rope dancer on his tight rope, in which one must either fall or stand - or escape”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There are feelings which want to kill the lonely; and if they do not succeed, well, then they themselves must die. But are you capable of this—to be a murderer?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Books for the general reader are always ill-smelling books, the odour of paltry people clings to them. Where the populace eat and drink, and even where they reverence, it is accustomed to stink. One should not go into churches if one wishes to breathe pure air.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “But strangers and the poor may pluck for themselves the fruit from my tree: that causes less shame. But beggars should be entirely done away with! Truly, it annoys one to give to them and it annoys one not to give to them.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Deutschland über alles - I fear that was the end of German Philosophy.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Whoever reaches his ideal transcends it eo ipso.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One always has exaggerated ideas about what one doesn't know.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “For a tree to become tall it must grow tough roots among the rocks.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We are always only in our own company.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is an eternal phenomenon: the insatiable will always finds a way to detain its creatures in life and compel them to live on, by means of an illusion spread over things.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I see you exhausted by poisonous flies; I see you bleeding and torn at a hundred spots; and your pride refuses even to be angry. They would have blood from you in all innocence; blood is what bloodless souls crave - and therefore they sting in all innocence.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There are heights of the soul from which even tragedy ceases to look tragic; and rolling together all the woe of the world -- who could dare to decide whether its sight would necessarily seduce us and compel us to feel pity and thus double this woe?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Books for general reading always smell badly. The odor of common people hangs about them.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “He who considers more deeply knows that, whatever his acts and judgements may be, he is always wrong.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The night is also a sun.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “if you wish to strive for peace of soul and pleasure, then believe; if you wish to be a devotee of truth, then inquire. .”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I fear that the animals regard man as a creature of their own kind which has in a highly dangerous fashion lost its healthy animal reason – as the mad animal, as the laughing animal, as the weeping animal, as the unhappy animal.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Go your ways! and let the people and peoples go theirs!- gloomy ways, verily, on which not a single hope glints any more!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “While every aristocratic morality springs from a triumphant affirmation of its own demands, the slave morality says "no" from the very outset to what is "outside itself," "different from itself," and "not itself: and this "no" is its creative deed.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “This is what is hardest: to close the open hand because one loves.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I transform myself to fast: my today refutes my yesterday.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What then in the last resort are the truths of mankind?--They are the irrefutable errors of mankind.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The great problems are to be encountered in the street.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Should not the giver be thankful that the receiver received? Is not giving a need? Is not receiving mercy?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Forgetfulness is a property of all action. The man of action is also without knowledge: he forgets most things in order to do one, he is unjust to what is behind him, and only recognizes one law - the law of that which is to be.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “spirit and his solitude, and for ten years did not weary of it. But finally he had a change of heart”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Now and again an echo of Chopin’s music rings in my ears, and this much you absorb me that, at such moments I always think of you and lose myself in meditating about possibilities.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What makes heroic? – To go to meet simultaneously one’s greatest sorrow and one’s greatest hope.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “nihilism represents the ultimate logical conclusion of our great values and ideals—because we must experience nihilism before we can find out what value these "values" really had.'— We require, sometime, new values.”
author: Fredrich Nietzsche

quote: “Genius too does nothing but learn first how to lay bricks then how to build, and continually seek for material and continually form itself around it.Every activity of man is amazingly complicated, not only that of the genius: but none is a ‘miracle.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “...love of truth is something fearsome and mighty.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “If the poet is not a real genius, I do not know what a genius is.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Sometimes, you have to love beyond yourself! And that's how you learn to love! That's why you had to drink the bitter glass of your love.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What is familiar is what we are used to; and what we are used to is most difficult to 'Know' - that is, to see as a problem; that is, to see as strange, as distant, as 'outside us'.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Injury makes one prudent,' says the proverb; insofar as it makes one prudent it also makes one bad. Fortunately, it frequently makes people stupid.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The more thoroughly a person understands life, the less he will mock, though in the end he might still mock the "thoroughness of his understanding.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Only when he has attained a final knowledge of all things will man have come to know himself. For things are only the boundaries of man.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The minds of others I know well;But who I am I cannot tell”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To chew and digest everything, however—that is thegenuine swine-nature! Ever to say ye-a—that hath onlythe ass learnt, and those like it!”
author: Frederic Nietzsche

quote: “Did I seek where the wind bites keenest, learn to live where no one lives, in the desert where only the polar bear lives, unlearn to pray and curse, unlearn man and god, become a ghost flitting across the glaciers?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When some men fail to accomplish what they desire to do they exclaim angrily, “May the whole world perish!” This repulsive emotion is the pinnacle of envy, whose implication is “If I cannot have something, no one can have anything, no one is to be anything!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The child is innocence and forgetting, a new beginning, a game, a self-rolling wheel, a first movement, a sacred Yes.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “He tolerates no other enemy than one in whom nothing is to be despised and a great deal is worthy of respect!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “An artist chooses his subjects.. that is the way he praises.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Knowest thou not who is most needed by all? He who commandeth great things. To execute great things is difficult: but the more difficult task is to command great things.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “I was in darkness, but I took three steps and found myself in paradise. The first step was a good thought, the second, a good word; and the third, a good deed.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “All too violently my heart still flows toward you—my heart, upon which my summer burns, short, hot, melancholy, overblissful; how my summer heart craves your coolness.”
author: Freidrich Nietzsche

quote: “A light has dawned for me: I need companions, living ones, not dead companions and corpses which I carry with me wherever I wish. But I need living companions who follow me because they want to follow themselves— and who want to go where I want to go.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Neither can such a doctrine argue: it simply does not understand that other doctrines exist, can exist, it simply does not know how to imagine an opinion contrary to its own”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There is nothing more terrible than a barbaric slave class, who have learned to regard their existence as an injustice, and now prepare to take vengeance, not only for themselves, but for all generations.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Corruption is just a rude word for the autumn of a people.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “But a spirit who is sure of himself speaks softly; he seeks secrecy, he lets himself be awaited.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The surest aid in combating the male's disease of self-contempt is to be loved by a clever woman.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “This workshop where ideals are manufactured--it seems to me it stinks of so many lies”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Zarathustra saw many lands and many peoples: thus he discovered the good and evil of many peoples. No greater power did Zarathustra find on earth than good and evil.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “We must know how to preserve ourselves: the greatest test of independence.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “(Broad daylight; breakfast; return of cheerfulness and bons sens; Plato blushes for shame; all free spirits run riot.)”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There is a point in the history of society when it becomes so pathologically soft and tender that among other things it sides with those who harm it, criminals, and does this quite seriously and honestly.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is true we love life; not because we are wont to live, but because we are wont to love.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Compassion and love for mankind is a development of the sexual instinct, justice a development of the passion for revenge. Virtue is the pleasure in resistance, the will to power; honour is the recognition of one’s peers and equals in power.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And finally, to call to mind the enormous influence which "German philosophy"--I hope you understand its right to inverted commas-”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And now we celebrate, in victory bound, The feast of feasts:Friend Zarathustra came, the guest of guests!Now laughs the world, the ancient curtain's torn,And light and darkness wedded are as one...”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When your heart overfloweth broad and full like the river, a blessing and a danger to the lowlanders: there is the origin of your virtue.”
author: Nietzsche Friedrich Wilhelm

quote: “An incalculable number of higher individuals now perish: but he who escapes their fate is as strong as the devil.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “... for the objective of all human arrangements is through distracting one's thoughts to cease to be aware of life.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “No victor believes in chance.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Live so that thou mayest desire to live again - that is thy duty - for in any case thou wilt live again!”
author: Freidrich Nietzsche

quote: “One person seeks a midwife for his thoughts; the other, someone he can assist. Here is the origin of a good conversation.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The word of the past is an oracle uttered. Only as builders of the future, as knowing the present, will you understand it.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What is great in man is that he is a bridge and not a goal: what is lovable in man is that he is an over-going and a down-going.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The Good Person of today is incapable of approaching anything except in a dishonest way–but with innocence, a true blue-eyed virtuously mendacious way. These Good People are ruined: they cannot stand a single truth about Man.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The revolution made Napoleon possible: that is its justification. For the sake of a similar prize one would have to desire the anarchical collapse of our entire civilisation.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What? You seek something? You wish to multiply yourself tenfold, a hundredfold? You seek followers? Seek zeros!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Wherever life and knowledge seemed to contradict each other, there was never any serious struggle: in such cases, denial and doubt amounted to madness.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Woman wants to be taken and accepted as a possession, she wishes to be merged in the conceptions of "possession" and "possessed"; consequently she wants one who takes, who does not offer and give himself away”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The labyrinthine man never seeks the truth but always and only his Ariadne.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What a school of politeness is such a contemplation of the past! To take everything objectively, to be angry at nothing, to love nothing, to understand everything-- makes one gentle and pliable.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “What could destroy us more quickly than working, thinking, and feeling without any inner necessity, without any deeply personal choice, without pleasure - as an automaton of "duty"? This is the very recipe for decadence, even for idiocy.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The false contrasts which the people, and consequently the language, believes in, are always dangerous fetters which impede the march of truth.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Whoever extolleth him as a God of love, doth not think highly enough of love itself. Did not that God want also to be judge? But the loving one loveth irrespective of reward and requital.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “To fight upward out of that chaos to this form requires a compulsion: one must be faced with the choice of perishing or prevailing. A dominating race can grow up only out of terrible and violent beginnings.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There is not enough love and kindness in the world to permit us to give any of it away to imaginary beings.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A sedentary life is the real sin against the Holy Spirit. Only those thoughts that come by walking have any value.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Atheism and a kind of _second innocence_ belong together.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Have you understood me? Dionysus versus Christ.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The 'Kingdom of Heaven' is a condition of the heart — not something that comes 'upon the earth' or 'after death'.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A man who loves like a woman becomes thereby a slave; a woman, however, who loves like a woman becomes thereby a more perfect woman.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Nothing succeeds if prankishness has no part in it.”
author: Nietzsche

quote: “O Voltaire! O humanity! O idiocy! There is something ticklish in "the truth," and in the SEARCH for the truth; and if man goes about it too humanely—"il ne cherche le vrai que pour faire le bien"—I wager he finds nothing!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A Path to Equality. — A few hours' mountain climbing make of a rogue and a saint two fairly equal creatures. Tiredness is the shortest path to equality and fraternity — and sleep finally adds to them liberty.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “dearest—every person is a prison and also a recess.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “there may even be puritanical fanatics of conscience, who prefer to put their last trust in a sure nothing, rather than in an uncertain something.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Ultimately, nobody can get more out of things, including books, than he already knows.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You implanted your highest goal into the heart of those passions: then they became your virtues and joys.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is not enough to prove something, one has also to seduce or elevate people to it. That is why the man of knowledge should learn how to speak his wisdom: and often in such a way that it sounds like folly!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “CALM is the bottom of my sea: who would guess that it hides droll monsters!Unmoved is my depth: but it sparkles with swimming enigmas and laughters.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Prejudice of the learned. – The learned judge correctly that people of all ages have believed they know what is good and evil, praise- and blameworthy. But it is a prejudice of the learned that we now know better than any other age.”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Nihilism, then, is the recognition of the long waste of strength, the agony of the "in vain," insecurity, the lack of any opportunity to recover and to regain composure-—being ashamed in front of oneself, as if one had deceived oneself all too long.—”
author: Fredrich Nietzsche

quote: “We are conducting an experiment with truth! Perhaps mankind will perish because of it! Fine!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Though the favourites of the gods die young, they also live eternally in the company of gods." - Friedrich Nietzsche”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “These trumpeters of reality are bad musicians.”

quote: “Out of your poisons you brewed your balsam. You milked your cow, melancholy; now you drink the sweet milk of her udder.”

quote: “That the other suffers must be learned; and it can never be learned completely.”

quote: “One knows a little too much about everybody. And we can even see through some men, and yet we can by no means pass through them.”

quote: “Hence the ways of men part: if you wish to strive for peace of soul and pleasure, then believe; if you wish to be a devotee of truth, then inquire...”

quote: “The Greeks are interesting and extremely important because they reared such a vast number of great individuals. How was this possible? This question is one which ought to be studied”

quote: “When death brings at last the desired forgetfulness, it abolishes life and being together, and sets the seal on the knowledge that "being" is merely a continual "has been," a thing that lives by denying and destroying and contradicting itself.”

quote: “Even the worst thing has two good verso-sides.”

quote: “We think too fast, even while walking or on the way, or while engaged in other things, no matter how serious the subject.”

quote: “I don't want to be a saint, and would rather be a buffoon...”

quote: “Where is the lightning to lick you with its tongue? Where is the madness with which you should be cleansed”

quote: “Those who know that they are profound strive for clarity. Those who would like to seem profound to the crowd strive for obscurity.”

quote: “it is not only he who speaks contrary to what he knows who lies, but even more he who speaks contrary to what he does not know”

quote: “Consciousness is the last and latest development of the organic and hence also what is most unfinished and unstrong.”

quote: “You go above and beyond them: but the higher you climb, the smaller you appear to the eye of envy. And he who flies is hated most of all.”

quote: “Let us face ourselves. We are Hyperboreans!”

quote: “Everyone who enjoys supposes that the tree was concerned with the fruit, but it was really concerned with the seed.

quote: “The deepest and most sublime hatred is a hatred which creates ideals and transforms values—something whose like has never been seen on earth”

quote: “Aren’t we straying as though through an infinite nothing? Isn’t empty space breathing at us?”

quote: “Thus says the fool: "Association with men spoils the character, especially when one has none.”

quote: “When he judged himself, that was his supreme moment.”

quote: “Behold, I teach you the Overman! He is that lightning, he is that madness!”

quote: “With thunder and heavenly fireworks must one speak to indolent and somnolent senses. But beauty's voice speaketh gently: it appealeth only to the most awakened souls”

quote: “In revenge and in love woman is more barbarous than man.”

quote: “The philosopher is lacking who interprets the deed and does not merely transpose it.”

quote: “I love those that know not how to live except as down-goers, for they are the over-goers.”

quote: “Only the boldest Utopians would dream of the economy of kindness.”

quote: “Having a talent is not enough; one also requires your permission for it--right, my friends?”

quote: “Every past is worth condemning.”

quote: “He who does not find greatness in God finds it nowhere. He must either deny it or create it.”

quote: “Moral contempt is a far greater indignity and insult than any kind of crime.”

quote: “It is not your sin - it is your moderation that cries to heaven; your very sparingness in sin cries to heaven!”

quote: “If everything we project onto reality to make it intelligible were eliminated,
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “A free life is still free for great souls. Verily, whoever possesses little is possessed that much less: praised be a little poverty!”

quote: “The forumula of my happiness: a Yes, a No, a straight line, a goal.”

quote: “Every kind of perfection is purchased at a high price on earth, where everything is perhaps purchased too dear; one is an expert in one's department at the price of being also a victim of one's department.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “as though the Universe itself were under an obligation to bother itself about them, for it never gets tired of wrapping up God Himself in the petty misery in which its troubles are involved. And”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is true: we love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving.There is always a certain madness in love. But also there is always a certain method in madness.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Brave people are persuaded to an action when it is represented as more dangerous than it is.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “That Luther's Reformation succeeded in the North suggests that the north of Europe was retarded compared to the south...”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The sea storms: all is in the sea.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “there is nothing of all that whereof thou speakest: there is no devil and no hell. Thy soul will be dead even sooner than thy body: fear, therefore, nothing any more!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Great poets create only from their own reality
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “but the higher you climb, the smaller you appear to the eye of envy. And he who flies is hated most of all.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “the overall aspect of life is not a state of need and hunger, but instead, wealth, bounty, even absurd squandering—where there is struggle, it is a struggle for power… One should not confuse Malthus with nature.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Believe me, friend Hellishnoise: the greatest events—they are not our loudest but our stillest hours.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “For in one’s heart one loveth only one’s child and one’s work; and where there is great love to oneself, then is it the sign of pregnancy: so have I found it.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Weariness, which seeketh to get to the ultimate with one leap, with a death-leap; a poor ignorant weariness, unwilling even to will any longer: that created all Gods and backworlds.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “This cup wants to become empty again, and Zarathustra wants to become human again.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Nihilism stands at the door: whence comes this uncanniest of all guests?”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “There exists in the worlda single path along whichno one can go except you:whither does it lead?Do not ask, go along it.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The fact that education, that development–and not ‘the Reich’–is itself a goal, the fact that you need educators–and not schoolteachers or university scholars–to reach this goal, people have forgotten this”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “The infuriating thing about an individual way of living. People are always angry at anyone who chooses very individual standards for his life; because of the extraordinary treatment which that man grants to himself, they feel degraded, like ordinary beings.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Ah, ye brethren, that God whom I created was human work and human madness, like all the Gods! A man was he, and only a poor fragment of a man and ego. Out of mine own ashes and glow it came unto me, that phantom.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In all truly productive men instinct is the strong, affirmative force and reason the dissuader and critic.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And just look at these men: their eye saith it - they know nothing better on earth than to be with a woman.Filth is at the bottom of their souls; and alas! If their filth hath spirit in it!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “For only he who is man enough will release the woman in woman.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And often with our love we want merely to overleap envy. And often we attack and make ourselves enemies, to conceal that we are vulnerable.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “In all ages one has wanted to ‘improve’ men: this above all is what morality has meant. But one word can conceal the most divergent tendencies. Both the taming of the beast man and the breeding of a certain species of man has been called ‘improvement’:”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “if you therefore want to depress and minimise man's capacity for pain, well, you must also depress and minimise his capacity for enjoyment.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “When we look out for the Barbarian, we look in the depths. But there is another type of Barbarian, who comes from the heights.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Reason in language- oh what an old deceptive female she is! I am afraid we are not rid of God because we still have faith in grammar.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One must be prepared to sacrifice all desirability to truth, every truth, even plain, harsh, ugly, repellent, unchristian, immoral truth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “undaunted men of the blackest midnight? — This world is the Will to Power — and nothing else! And even ye yourselves are this will to power — and nothing besides!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “adventurers and circumnavigators of that inner world which is called “human being,”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Truth is the kind of error without which a certain species of life could not live. The value for life is ultimately decisive.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “And if something great fails you, does that mean you yourselves are—failures? And if you yourselves are failures, does that mean—the human being is a failure? But if the human being is a failure: well then! come now!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “[On Marriage and Children] You shall build over and beyond yourself, but first you must be built yourself, perpendicular in body and soul.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Towards the throne they all strive: it is their madness—as if happiness sat on the throne! Ofttimes sitteth filth on the throne.—and ofttimes also the throne on filth.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “One has watched life badly if one has not also seen the hand that considerately--kills.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Every series of evolutions, according to them, was presided over by a prophet; and every prophet had his 'Hazar,'—his dynasty of a thousand years." All”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “It is a myth to believe that we will find our authentic self after we have left behind or forgotten one thing or another . . . To make our selves, to shape a form from various elements – that is the task! The task of a sculptor! Of a productive human being!”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “Those who inflate themselves are cursedWhen pricked by a small pin to burst.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: “You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,That we may record our emptiness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “One day you will ask me which is more important? My life or yours? I will say mine and you will walk away not knowing that you are my life.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I have found both freedom and safety in my madness; the freedom of loneliness and the safety from being understood, for those who understand us enslave something in us.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The timeless in you is aware of life's timelessness. And knows that yesterday is but today's memory and tomorrow is today's dream.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet strange, I am ungrateful to these teachers.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Tenderness and kindness are not signs of weakness and despair, but manifestations of strength and resolution.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Some of you say, “Joy is greater than sorrow,” and others say, “Nay, sorrow is the greater.”But I say unto you, they are inseparable.Together they come, and when one sits alone with you at your board, remember that the other is asleep upon your bed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We are all like the bright moon, we still have our darker side.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You give but little when you give of your possessions.It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It takes a minute to have a crush on someone, an hour to like someone, and a day to love someone... but it takes a lifetime to forget someone.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “No human relation gives one possession in another—every two souls are absolutely different. In friendship or in love, the two side by side raise hands together to find what one cannot reach alone.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Hearts united in pain and sorrowwill not be separated by joy and happiness.Bonds that are woven in sadnessare stronger than the ties of joy and pleasure.Love that is washed by tearswill remain eternally pure and faithful.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “To belittle, you have to be little.”
author: Kahill Gibran

quote: “For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun? And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love one another, but make not a bond of love:Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I AM IGNORANT of absolute truth. But I am humble before my ignorance and therein lies my honor and my reward.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.But you are eternity and you are the mirror.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You pray in your distress and in your need; would that you might pray also in the fullness of your joy and in your days of abundance.”
author: Kahill Gibran

quote: “We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding... And could you keep your heart in wonder at the daily miracles of your life, your pain would not seem less wondrous than your joy”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The smallest act of kindness is worth more than the greatest intention.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you part from your friend, you grieve not;For that which you love most in him may be clearer in his absence, asthe mountain to the climber is clearer from the plain.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The Reality of The Other Person Lies Not In What He Reveals To You, But What He Cannot Reveal To You.Therefore, If You Would Understand Him, Listen Not To What He Says, But Rather To What He Does Not Say.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Music is the language of the spirit. It opens the secret of life bringing peace, abolishing strife.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is wrong to think that love comes from long companionship and persevering courtship. Love is the offspring of spiritual affinity and unless that affinity is created in a moment, it will not be created for years or even generations.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I love you when you bow in your mosque, kneel in your temple, pray in your church. For you and I are sons of one religion, and it is the spirit.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Solitude has soft, silky hands, but with strong fingers it grasps the heart and makes it ache with sorrow.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The appearance of things changes according to the emotions; and thus we see magic and beauty in them, while the magic and beauty are really in ourselves.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If you reveal your secrets to the wind,you should not blame the wind forrevealing them to the trees.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “They deem me mad because I will not sell my days for gold; and I deem them mad because they think my days have a price.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things, does the heart find its morning and is refreshed.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Trees are poems that the earth writes upon the sky.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “When you reach the end of what you should know, you will be at the beginning of what you should sense.”
author: Kahlil Gibrán

quote: “Travel and tell no one, live a true love story and tell no one, live happily and tell no one, people ruin beautiful things.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “My loneliness was born when men praised my talkative faults and blamed my silent virtues.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And when you crush an apple with your teeth, say to it in your heart:Your seeds shall live in my body,And the buds of your tomorrow shall blossom in my heart,And your fragrance shall be my breath,And together we shall rejoice through all the seasons.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Trust in dreams, for in them is the hidden gate to eternity.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “One's own religion is after all a matter between oneself and one's Maker and no one else's.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Half of what I say is meaningless; but I say it so that the other half may reach you.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “An eye for an eye, and the whole world would be blind.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The real test of good manners is to be able to put up with bad manners pleasantly.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The optimist sees the rose and not its thorns; the pessimist stares at the thorns, oblivious to the rose.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “They say: 'If a man knew himself,he would know all mankind.'I say: 'If a man loved mankind,he would know something of himself.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Between what is said and not meant, and what is meant and not said, most of love is lost.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And God said “Love Your Enemy,” and I obeyed him and loved myself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For what is evil but good tortured by its own hunger and thirst?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Forgetfulness is a form of freedom.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And think not you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “When you love you should not think you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “A friend who is far away is sometimes much nearer than one who is at hand. Is not the mountain far more awe-inspiring and more clearly visible to one passing through the valley than to those who inhabit the mountain?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In one drop of water are found all the secrets of all the oceans; in one aspect of You are found all the aspects of existence.”
author: Kahlil Gibran Jr.

quote: “Your joy is your sorrow unmasked.And the selfsame well from which your laughter rises was oftentimes filled with your tears.And how else can it be?The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding. It is the bitter potion by which the physician within you heals your sick self. Therefore, trust the physician and drink his remedy in silence and tranquility.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Work is love made visible. And if you can't work with love, but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of the people who work with joy”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Many of us spend our whole lives running from feeling with the mistaken belief that you can not bear the pain. But you have already borne the pain. What you have not done is feel all you are beyond that pain.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself... You may house their bodies but not their souls, for their souls dwell in the house of tomorrow, which you cannot visit, not even in your dreams.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Much of your pain is self-chosen.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts;And when you can no longer dwell in the solitude of your heart you live in your lips, and sound is a diversion and a pastime.And in much of your talking, thinking is half murdered.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your daily life is your temple and your religion.”
author: Kahill Gibran

quote: “The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “We are all prisoners but some of us are in cells with windows and some without.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “There is a space between man's imagination and man's attainment that may only be traversed by his longing.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Verily the lust for comfort murders the passion of the soul, and then walks grinning in the funeral.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Safeguarding the rights of others is the most noble and beautiful end of a human being.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Faith is an oasis in the heart which will never be reached by the caravan of thinking.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Darkness may hide the treesand the flowers from the eyesbut it cannot hidelove from the soul.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Words are timeless. You should utter them or write them with a knowledge of their timelessness.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Of life's two chief prizes, beauty and truth, I found the first in a loving heart and the second in a laborer's hand.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Love gives naught but itself and takes naught but from itself, Love possesses not nor would it be possessed: For love is sufficient unto love.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I wash my hands of those who imagine chattering to be knowledge, silence to be ignorance, and affection to be art.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.”“Love has no other desire but to fulfill itself. To melt and be like a running brook that sings its melody to the night. To wake at dawn with a winged heart and give thanks for another day of loving”
author: Kahill Gibran

quote: “When life does not find a singer to sing her heart she produces a philosopher to speak her mind.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Desire is half of life; indifference is half of death.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “There must be something strangely sacred in salt. It is in our tears and in the sea.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Tell your secret to the wind, but don't blame it for telling the trees.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Is not the beautiful moon, that inspires poets, the same moon which angers the silence of the sea with a terrible roar?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your soul is oftentimes a battlefield, upon your reason and your judgment wage war against your passion and your appetite.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “He who seeks ecstasy in love should not complain of suffering.”
author: Kahlil Gibrán

quote: “Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Life without liberty is like a body without spirit.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The most pitiful among men is he who turns his dreams into silver and gold.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you are joyous, look deep into your heart and you shall find it is only that which has given you sorrow that is giving you joy. When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Of the good in you I can speak, but not of the evil.For what is evil but good tortured by its own hunger and thirst?Verily when good is hungry it seeks food even in dark caves, and when it thirsts it drinks even of dead waters.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Our anxiety does not come from thinking about the future, but from wanting to control it.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Let me, O let me bathe my soul in colours; let me swallow the sunset and drink the rainbow.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Do not fear the thorns in your path, for they draw only corrupt blood.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your joy is your sorrow unmasked.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “When you love you should not say, “God is in my heart,” but rather, “I am in the heart of God.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Strange, the desire for certain pleasures is a part of my pain.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love descends upon our souls by the will of God and not by the demand or the plea of the individual.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “To measure you by your smallest deed is to reckon the ocean by the frailty of its foam.To judge you by your failures is to cast blame upon the seasons for their inconsistencies.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love is the only freedom in the world because it so elevates the spirit that the laws of humanity and the phenomena of nature do not alter its course.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love and Doubt are not on speaking terms”
author: Kahil Gibran

quote: “Observe the wonders as they occur around you.Don't claim them. Feel the artistry moving through and be silent.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your clothes conceal much of your beauty, yet they hide not the unbeautiful.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your hearts know in silence the secrets of the days and the nights.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Generosity is not in giving me that which I need more than you do, but it is in giving me that which you need more than I do.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You shall be free indeed when your days are not without a care, nor your nights without a want and a grief, but rather when these things girdle your life and yet you rise above them naked and unbound.”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “The feelings we live throughin love and in lonelinessare simply, for us,what high tideand low tide are to the sea.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “All that spirits desire, spirits attain.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For thought is a bird of space, that in a cage of words may indeed unfold its wings but cannot fly.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself. They come through you but not from you. You may give them your love but not your thoughts. For they have their own thoughts.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A friend who is far away is sometimes much nearer than one who is at hand”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I would not exchange the laughter of my heart for the fortunes of the multitudes.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We wanderers, ever seeking the lonelier way, begin no day where we have ended another day; and no sunrise finds us where sunset left us.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You cannot laugh and be unkind at the same time”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I am the lover's gift; I am the wedding wreath;I am the memory of a moment of happiness;I am the last gift of the living to the dead;I am a part of joy and a part of sorrow.”
author: Gibran Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We live only to discover beauty. All else is a form of waiting”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “When you were a wandering desire in the mist, I too was there, a wandering desire. Then we sought one another, and out of our eagerness dreams were born. And dreams were time limitless, and dreams were space without measure.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love provided me with a tongue and tears.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Men who do not forgive women their little faults will never enjoy their great virtues.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It is well to give when asked, but it is better to give unasked, through understanding; and to the open-handed the search for one who shall receive is joy greater than giving.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “True beauty is a rayThat springs from the sacred depths of the soul,and illuminates the body, just as lifesprings from the kernel of a stone andgives colour and scent to a flower.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Let there be spaces in your togetherness”
author: kahlil gibran

quote: “Beauty is life when life unveils her holy face. But you are life and you are the veil. Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror. But you are eternity and you are the mirror.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And your fragrance shall be my breath,And together we shall rejoice through all the seasons.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For life and death are one, even as the river and the sea are one.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Only when you drink from the river of silence shall you indeed sing.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit. ”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Faith is a knowledge within the heart, beyond the reach of proof.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You may chain my hands, you may shackle my feet; you may even throw me into a dark prison; but you shall not enslave my thinking, because it is free!”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “If the other person injures you, you may forget the injury; but if you injure him you will always remember”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The philosopher's soul dwells in his head, the poet's soul is in his heart; the singer's soul lingers about his throat, but the soul of the dancer abides in all her body.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “He who is more mindful of one, loses the love and the faith of both.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Love is quivering happiness.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Where are you now, my beloved? Do you hear my weepingFrom beyond the ocean? Do you understand my need? Do you know the greatness of my patience?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Let your home be you mast and not your anchor.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I have never agreed with my other self wholly. The truth of the matter seems to lie between us.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The lust for comfort kills the passions of the soul.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “But let there be spaces in your togetherness.And let the winds of the heavens dance between you.Love one another but make not a bond of love:Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Truth is a deep kindness that teaches us to be content in our everyday life and share with the people the same happiness.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “If your heart is a volcano, how shall you expect flowers to bloom?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And in much of your talking, thinking is half murdered. For thought is a bird of space, that in a cage of words may indeed unfold its wings but cannot fly.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Defeat, my defeat, my deathless courage, You and I shall laugh together with the storm, And together we shall dig graves for all that die in us, and we shall stand in the sun with a will, And we shall be dangerous”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A little while, a moment of rest upon the wind, and another woman shall bear me.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A voice cannot carry the tongue and the lips that gave it wings. Alone must it seek the ether. And alone and without his nest shall the eagle fly across the sun.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.”
author: kahlil gibran

quote: “I am forever walking upon these shores,Betwixt the sand and the foam,The high tide will erase my foot prints,And the wind will blow away the foam,But the sea and the shore will remain forever.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Self is a sea boundless and measureless.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I would not exchange the sorrows of my heart for the joys of the multitude. And I would not have the tears that sadness makes to flow from my every part turn into laughter. I would that my life remain a tear and a smile.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You see but your shadow when you turn your back to the sun.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “When you are joyous, look deep into your heart and you shall find it is only that which has given you sorrow that is giving you joy.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And all knowledge is vain save when there is work, and all work is empty save when there is love; and when you work with love you bind yourself to yourself, and to one another, and to God.”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “Pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding. ”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.”
author: Khalil Gilbran

quote: “How beautiful to find a heart that loves you, without asking you for anything, but to be okay.”
author: khalil gibran

quote: “Accept the seasons of your heart, even as you have always accepted the seasons that pass over your fields.And you would watch with serenity through the winters of your grief.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Because the soul is like a flower that folds its petals when dark comes, and breathes not its fragrance into the phantoms of the night.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Yes, there is a Nirvanah; it is leading your sheep to a green pasture, and in putting your child to sleep, and in writing the last line of your poem”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “God listens not to your words save when He Himself utters them through your lips.”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “How can I lose faith in the justice of life, when the dreams of those who sleep upon feathers are not more beautiful than the dreams of those who sleep upon the earth?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It was but yesterday I thought myself a fragment quivering without rhythm in the sphere of life. Now I know that I am the sphere, and all life in rhythmic fragments moves within me.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Remembrance is a form of meeting.”
author: Kahlil Gibrán

quote: “All our words are but crumbs that fall down from the feast of the mind.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The person you consider ignorant and insignificant is the one who came from God, that he might learn bliss from grief and knowledge from gloom”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Thus with my lips have I denounced you, while my heart, bleeding within me, called you tender names.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “No man can reveal to you aught but that which already lies half asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Is not dread of thirst when your well is full, the thirst that is unquenchable?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Only when you drink from the river of silence shall you indeed sing.And when you have reached the mountain top, then you shall begin to climb.And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “As the strings of a lute are apart though they quiver the same music.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Exaggeration is truth that has lost its temper.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your daily life is your temple and your religion. When you enter into it take with you your all.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And then to sleep with a prayer for the beloved in your heart and a song of praise upon your lips.”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “But memory is an autumn leaf that murmurs a while in the wind and then is heard no more.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The soul unfolds itself, like a lotus of countless petals.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your friend is your needs answered.He is your field which you sow with love and reap with thanksgiving.And he is your board and your fireside.For you come to him with your hunger, and you seek him for peace.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Poetry is a deal of joy and pain and wonder, with a dash of the dictionary.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You are good when you walk to your goal firmly and with bold steps.Yet you are not evil when you go thither limping.For those who limp go not backwards.But you who are strong and swift, see that you do not limp before the lame, deeming it kindness.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “life unfolds itself in mysteries ways.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Much of your pain is the bitter potion by which the physician within you heals your sick self.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “God has created several doors which open onto truth. He opens them to all those who knock on them with the hand of faith. ”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Behind the veil of each night, there is a smiling dawn.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Jesus was not sent here to teach the people to build magnificent churches and temples amidst the cold wretched huts and dismal hovels. He came to make the human heart a temple, and the soul an altar, and the mind a priest.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But you, children of space, you restless in rest, you shall not be trapped nor tamed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The true wealth of a nation lies not in it's gold or silver but in it's learning, wisdom and in the uprightness of its sons.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A fox looked at his shadow at sunrise and said, “I will have a camel for lunch today.” And all morning he went about looking for camels. But at noon he saw his shadow again-and he said, “A mouse will do.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If he is indeed wise he does not bid you enter the house of his wisdom, but rather leads you to the threshold of your own mind.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “He who wears his morality but as his best garment were better naked.The wind and the sun will tear no holes in his skin.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your joy can fill you only as deeply as your sorrow has carved you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For Reason, ruling alone, is a force confining; and Passion, unattended,is a flame that burns to its own destruction.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Seven times have I despised my soul: The sixth time when she despised the ugliness of a face, and knew not that it was one of her own masks.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Listen to the women when she looks at you, not when she talks to you.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Perhaps time’s definition of coal is the diamond.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are far, far greater than you know - and all is well.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And could you keep your heart in wonder at the daily miracles of your life, your pain would not seem less wondrous than your joy;And you would accept the seasons of your heart, even as you have always accepted the seasons that pass over your fields.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your body is the harp of your soul and it is yours to bring forth sweet music from it or confused sounds.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Extreme torture is mute, and so we sat silent, petrified, like columns of marble buried under the sand of an earthquake. Neither wished to listen to the other because our heart-threads had become weak and even breathing would have broken them.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Beauty is that which attracts your soul, and that which loves to give and not to receive.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And in the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Happiness is a vine that takes root and grows within the heart, never outside it.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love is all I can possess and no one can deprive me of it.Kahlil Gibran (Visions of the Prophet)”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If in the twilight of memory we should meet once more, we shall speak again together and you shall sing to me a deeper song.And if our hands should meet in another dream, we shall build another tower in the sky.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When love beckons to you, follow him,”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And one of the elders of the city, said, speak to us of good and evil.And he answered:You are good in countless ways, and you are not evil when you are not good.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You may forget the one with whom you have laughed, but never the one with whom you have wept.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And as a single leaf turns not yellow but with the silent knowledge of the whole tree.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “How often have you sailed in my dreams. And now you come in my awakening, which is my deeper dream.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If I extend an empty hand and in retrieving it and finding it still empty, I feel disappointment, that is foolishness; yet if I extend a hand which is full and yet find no one to receive it, then that is hopelessness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Art arises when the secret vision of the artist and the manifestation of nature agree to find new shapes.”
author: Kahill Gibran

quote: “A man's true wealth is the good he does in the world.”
author: Kahlil Gibrán

quote: “And that which sings and contemplates in you is still dwelling within the bounds of that first moment which scattered the stars into space.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “What is fear of need but need itself?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “A traveller I am, and a navigator, and everyday I discover a new region within my soul.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Advance, and never halt, for advancing is perfection. Advance and do not fear the thorns in the path, for they draw only corrupt blood.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Yea, I shall return with the tide.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Give your hearts, but not into each other's keeping. For only the hand of Life can contain your hearts. And stand together, yet not too near together: For the pillars of the temple stand apart, And the oak tree and the cypress grow not in each other's shadow.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “There are those who give with joy, and that joy is their reward.”
author: Kahlil Gibran
