quote: “if you cannot but weep when your soul summons you to prayer, she should spur you again and yet again, though weeping, until you shall come laughing”
author: جبران خليل جبران

quote: “He who loses his mother loses a pure soul who blesses and guards him constantly.”
author: Kahlil Gabran

quote: “Love is the only flower that grows and blossoms without the aid of the seasons”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Rest in reason. Move in Passion.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “These things he said in words. But much in his heart remained unsaid.For he himself could not speak his deeper secret.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I am a stranger in this world, and there is a severe solitude and painful lonesomeness in my exile.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For if you bake bread with indifference, you bake a bitter bread that feeds but half man's hunger.”
author: Gibran Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your house is your larger body.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The breath of life is in the sunlight and the hand of life is in the wind.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “you can muffle the drum, and you can loosen the strings of the lyre, but who shall command the skylark not to sing?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Saying this, he turned his head toward the window as if he were trying to solve the problems of human existence by concentrating on the beauty of the universe.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And is not the lute that soothes your spirit the very wood that was hollowed with knives?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Work is love made visible.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Look at the Darkness, giving birth to the Sun”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you work you are a flute through whose heart the whispering of the hours turns to music.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “That which seems most feeble and bewildered in you is the strongest and most determined.Is it not your breath that has erected and hardened the structure of your bones?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And some of your elders remember pleasures with regret like wrongs committed in drunkenness.But regret is the beclouding of the mind and not its chastisement. They should remember their pleasures with gratitude, as they would the harvest of a summer.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In the summer heat the reapers say, “We have seen her dancing with the autumn leaves, and we saw a drift of snow in her hair.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your house shall be not an anchor but a mastIt shall not be a glistening film that covers a wound, but an eyelid that guards the eye.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “My life is quiet. There is little beside working and walking. I have no desire to see people, and I feel as though I am waiting for something new and strange which will burn the unburnt side of my soul.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For that which is boundless in you abides in the mansion of the sky, whose door is the morning mist, and whose windows are the songs and the silences of night.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “What is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your joy is your sorrow unmasked...The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain...I say unto you, they are inseparable.Together they come, and when one sits alone with you at your board, remember that the other is asleep upon your bed.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “A God who is good knows no segregation amongst words or names. And were a God to deny his blessing to those who pursue a different path to eternity, there would be no human who should offer worship.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Long were the days of pain I have spent within its walls, and long were the nights of aloneness; and who can depart from his pain and his aloneness without regret?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In the depths of your hopes and desires lies your silent knowledge of the beyond;And like seeds dreaming beneath the snow your heart dreams of spring.Trust the dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Joy and sorrow are inseparable, together they came and where one sits alone with you at the board remember that the other is asleep upon your bed”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You cannot judge any man beyond your knowledge of him, and how small is your knowledge.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For the breath of life is in the sunlight and the hand of life is in the wind.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Love has no other desire but to fulfill itself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For love is sufficient unto love.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Tolerance is love sick with the sickness of haughtiness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For to be idle is to become a stranger unto the seasons, and to step out of life’s procession that marches in majesty and proud submission towards the infinite.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Long ago you were a dream in your mother's sleep, and then she awoke to give you birth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And then a scholar said, "Speak of talking." And he answered, saying: "And when you can no longer dwell in the solitude of your heart you live in your lips, and sound is a diversion and a pastime.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your friend is your needs answered.When you part from your friend, you grieve not;For that which you love most in him may be clearer in his absence, as the mountain to the climber is clearer from the plain.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “What shall i say of these save that they too stand in the sunlight, but with their backs to the sun?They see only their shadows, and their shadows are their laws.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Then a lawyer said, But what of our laws, master? And he answered: 'You delight in laying down laws. Yet you delight more in breaking them.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For in truth it is life that gives unto life-while you, who deem yourself a giver, are but a witness.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain.Is not the cup that holds your wine the very cup that was burned in the potters oven?And is not the lute that soothes your spirits the very wood that was hollowed with knives?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “No matter how busy a man is, he is never too busy to stop and talk about how busy he is.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The veil that clouds your eyes shall be lifted by the hands that wove it,”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And if our hands should meet in another dream, we shall build another tower in the sky.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It was in my heart to help a little because I was helped much.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Only those beneath me can envy or hate me. I have never been envied nor hated; I am above no one. Only those above me can praise or belittle me. I have never been praised nor belittled; I am below no one.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You who travel with the wind, what weather vane shall direct your course?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The most wonderful thing, Mary, is that you and I are always walking together, hand in hand, in a strangely beautiful world, unknown to other people. We both stretch one hand to receive from Life - and Life is generous indeed.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “What is word knowledge but a shadow of wordless knowledge?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Many a doctrine is like a window pane. We see truth through it but it divides us from truth.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It is well to give when asked, but it is better to give unasked through understanding.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “A truly religious man does not embrace a religion; and he who embraces one has no religion.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your fear of death is but the trembling of the shepherd when he stands before the king whose hand is to be laid upon him in honour.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Yesterday was a beautiful tune on the lips of life and today is a silent secret.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Much have we loved you. But speechless was our love, and with veils has it been veiled,Yet now it cries aloud unto you, and would stand revealed before you.And ever has it been that love knows not it's depth until the hour of separation”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is not a garment I cast off this day, but a skin that I tear with my own hands.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Let not the waves of the sea separate us now, and the years you have spent in our midst become a memory.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “When you see a man led to prison say in your heart, "Mayhap he is escaping from a narrower prison." And when you see a man drunken say in your heart, "Mayhap he sought escape from something still more unbeautiful.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Yesterday is but today's memory, and tomorrow is today's dream.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Man struggles to find life outside himself, unaware that the life he is seeking is within him.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And I have found both freedom and safety in my madness; the freedom of loneliness and the safety from being understood, for those who understand us enslave something in us.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The wolves prey upon the lambs in the darkness of the night, but the blood stains remain upon the stones in the valley until the dawn comes, and the sun reveals the crime to all.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Shall the day of parting be the day of gathering?And shall it be said that my eve was in truth my dawn?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Remembrance is a form of meeting.Forgetfulness is a form of freedom.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Life is not only merriment,It is desire and determination.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit. For love that seeks aught but the disclosure of its own mystery is not love but a net cast forth: and only the unprofitable is caught.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Art thou like me, child of my darkest heart? And dost thou think my untamed thoughts and speak my vast language?” “Yea, we are twin brothers, O, Night; for thou revealest space and I reveal my soul.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The sorrowful spirit finds relaxation in solitude.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “They dip their pens in our hearts and think they are inspired.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We are the seeds of the tenacious plant, and it is in our ripeness and our fullness of heart that we are given to the wind and are scattered.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Even as the strings of a lute are alone though they quiver with the same music.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I came here to be for all and with all,and what I do today in my solitudewill be echoed tomorrow by the multitude. What I say now with one heartwill be said tomorrow by thousands of hearts...”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For the vision of one man lends not its wings to another man.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “In your winter you deny your spring,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The resting place of my soul is a beautiful grove where my knowledge of you lives.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If we were all to sit in a circle and confess our sins, we would laugh at each other for lack of originality. —Kahlil Gibran”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Too many fragments of the spirit have I scattered in these streets, and too many are the children of my longing that walk naked among these hills, and I cannot withdraw from them without a burden and an ache.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Even as the stone of the fruit must break, that its heart may stand in the sun, so must you know pain.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For what is prayer but the expansion of your self into the living ether?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You are blind and I am deaf and dumb, so let us touch hands and understand.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “memory is an autumn leaf that murmurs a while in the wind and then is heard no more.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “One may not reach the dawn by the path of the night. ”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But you who walk facing the sun, what images drawn on the earth can hold you?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The wind speaks not more sweetly to the giant Oaks than to the least of all blades of grass, And he alone is great who turns the voice of the wind into a song made sweeter by his own loving”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Is not the cup that holds your wine the very cup that was burned in the potter’s oven?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone.Even as the strings of a lute are alone though they quiver with the same music.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And how shall you punish those whose remorse is already greater than their misdeeds?”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “He who has not been bitten by the serpents of light and snapped at by the wolves of darkness will always be deceived by the days and the nights.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “A seeker of silences am I, and what treasure have I found in silences that I may dispense with confidence?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The mountain veiled in mist is not a hill; an oak tree in the rain is not a weeping willow.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Some of our children are our justifications and some are but our regrets.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Yesterday is but to-day’s memory and to-morrow is to-day’s dream.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And there are those who have little and give it all.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For if you should enter the temple for no other purpose than asking you shall not receive:”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When love beckons to you follow him, though his ways are hard and steep. And when his wings enfold you yield to him thought the sword hidden among his pinions may wound you. And when he speaks to you believe in him, though his voice may shatter your dreams”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “He is your field which you sow with love and reap with thanksgiving.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Words are too poor and too scant to express the inmost feeling in the heart of man.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Life is but a sleep disturbed by dreaming, prompted by the will; the saddened soul with sadness hides it's secrets, and the gay, with thrill.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It takes two of us to discover truth: one to utter it and one to understand it.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And there are those who give and know not pain in giving, nor do they seek joy, nor give with mindfulness of virtue;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you love you should not say, "God is in my heart," but rather, "I am in the heart of God".”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Knowledge of the self is the mother of all knowledge. So it is incumbent on me to know my self, to know it completely, to know its minutiae, its characteristics, its subtleties, and its very atoms.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Am I a harp that the hand of the mighty may touch me, or a flute that his breath may pass through me?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I abstain from the people who consider insolence bravery and tenderness cowardice. And I abstain from those who consider chatter wisdom and silence ignorance.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Forget not that modesty is for a shield against the eye of the unclean.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “March on. Do not tarry. To go forward is to move toward perfection. March on, and fear not the thorns, or the sharp stones on life's path.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And the selfsame well from which your laughter rises was oftentimes filled with your tears.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “At ebb tide I wrote a line upon the sand, and gave it all my heart and all my soul. At flood tide I returned to read what I had inscribed and found my ignorance upon the shore.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And that the corner-stone of the temple is not higher than the lowest stone in its foundation.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Let us disperse from our aloofness and serve the weak who made us strong, and cleanse the country in which we live. Let us teach this miserable nation to smile and rejoice with heaven's bounty and glory of life and freedom. ”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Follow your heart. Your heart is the right guide in everything big”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “There is a desire deep within the soul which drives man from the seen to the unseen, to philosophy and to the divine.”
author: Kahil Gibran

quote: “You often say, ‘I would give, but only to the deserving.’ The trees in your orchard say not so, nor the flocks in your pasture. They give that they may live, for to withhold is to perish.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “To be able to look back upon ones life in satisfaction, is to live twice”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And there are those who have the truth within them, but they tell it not in words.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “ALMUSTAFA, the chosen and the beloved, who was a dawn unto his own day, had waited twelve years in the city of Orphalese for his ship that was to return and bear him back to the isle of his birth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If you sing of beauty though alone in the heart of the desert you will have an audience.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I deserted the world and sought solitude because I became tired of rendering courtesy to those multitudes who believe that humility is a sort of weakness, and mercy a kind of cowardice, and snobbery a form of strength.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Say not, “I have found the path of the soul.” Say rather, “I have met the soul walking upon my path.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “He who wears his morality but as his best garment were better naked.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Who are you that men should rend their bosom and unveil their pride, that you may see their worth naked and their pride unabashed?See first that you yourself deserve to be a giver, and an instrument of giving.”
author: Kahlie Gibran

quote: “You may give them your love but not your thoughts,”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your hearts know in silence the secrets of the days and the nights.But your ears thirst for the sound of your heart's knowledge.You would know in words that which you have always known in thought.You would touch with your fingers the naked body of your dreams.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “They give that they may live, for to withhold is to perish.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Let there be spaces in your togetherness...just as strings of a lute dance alone though they quiver with the same music.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And how shall you rise beyond your days and nights unless you break the chains which you at the dawn of your understanding have fastened around your noon hour?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Shall I come to you, a boundless drop to a boundless ocean.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “My God, my aim and my fulfillment; I am thy yesterday and thou are my tomorrow. I am they root in the earth and thou art my flower in the sky, and together we grow before the face of the sun.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You would know the secret of death.But how shall you find it unless you seek it in the heart of life?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Like a procession you walk together towards your god-self.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You have walked among us a spirit, and your shadow has been a light upon our faces.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Love gives naught but itself and takes naught but from itself.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For the sight of the angry weather saddens my soul and the sight of the town, sitting like a bereaved mother beneath layers of ice, oppresses my heart.”
author: Kahlil Gibrán

quote: “Build of your imaginings a bower in the wilderness ere you build a house within the city walls.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You are good when you are one with yourself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Every man loves two women;the one is the creation of his imagination and the other is not yet born”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The sun teaches to all things that grow their longing for the light. But it is night that raises them to the stars.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And my heart bled within me; for you can only be free when even the desire of seeking freedom becomes a harness to you, and when you cease to speak of freedom as a goal and a fulfillment.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The real in us is silent; the acquired is talkative.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Love possesses not nor would it be possessed;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love is a magic rayemitted from the burning coreof the souland illuminatingthe surrounding earth.It enables usto perceive lifeas a beautiful dreambetween one awakeningand another.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Have you remembrances, the glimmering arches that span the summits of the mind?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And let it direct your passion with reason, that your passion may livethrough its own daily resurrection, and like the phoenix rise above its own ashes.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You were born together, and together you shall be for evermore.You shall be together when the white wings of death scatter your days.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You work that you may keep pace with the earth and the soul of the earth.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And when one of you falls down he falls for those behind him, a caution against the stumbling stone.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Do not the spirits who dwell in the ether envy man his pain?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “They come through you but not from you,”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And if there come the singers and the dancers and the flute players, buy of their gifts also.For they too are gatherers of fruit and frankincense, and that which they bring, though fashioned of dreams, is raiment and food for your soul.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your children are not your children.They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself.They come through you but not from you,And though they are with you, yet they belong not to you.”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “When you love you should not say, "God is in my heart," but rather, "I am in the heart of God." And think not you can direct the course of love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “A bigot is a stone-deaf orator.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “They are the sons and daughters of Life’s longing for itself.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Work with love, it is to weave the cloth with threads drawn from your heart.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your children are not your children.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Reason, ruling alone, is a force confining; and passion, unattended, is a flame that burns to its own destruction.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you long for blessings that you may not name, and when you grieve knowing not the cause, then indeed you are growing with all things that grow, and rising toward your greater self.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Fear not the phantom of death, My Countrymen, for his greatnessAnd mercy will refuse to approachYour smallness; and dread not the Dagger, for it will decline to beLodged in your shallow hearts.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “A Great Man Has Two Hearts.One Bleeds And The Other Forbears.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For to be overmindful of your debt is to doubt his generosity who has the free-hearted earth for mother, and God for father.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It is in exchanging the gifts of the earth that you shall find abundance and be satisfied.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Oh, heart, if one should say to you that the soul perishes like the body, answer that the flower withers, but the seed remains.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Death changes nothing but the masks that cover our faces.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For to stay, though the hours burn in the night, is to freeze and crystallize and be bound in a mould.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You give but little when you give of your possessions.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Forget not that the earth likes to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.Khalil Gibran”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Learn the words of wisdom uttered by the wise and apply them in your own life. Live them - but do not a make a show of reciting them, for he who repeats what he does not understand is no better than an ass loaded with books.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding”
author: Khalil Jibran

quote: “Qualities of Good Citizens... is to admire what others have created in love and faith”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “To you the earth yields her fruit, and you shall not want if you but know how to fill your hands.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “But I say to you that when you work you fulfill a part of earth's furthest dream, assigned to you when that dream was born, And in keeping yourself with labour you are in truth loving life, And to love life through labour is to be intimate with life's inmost secret.”
author: Kahlil Gibrán

quote: “If you can see only what light reveals and hear only what sound announces, then in truth you do not see nor do you hear.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You have been told that, even like a chain, you are as weak as your weakest link. This is but half the truth. You are also as strong as your strongest link. To measure you by your smallest deed is to reckon the power of ocean by the frailty of its foam.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love passes by us, robed in meekness; but we flee from her in fear, or hide in the darkness; or else pursue her, to do evil in her name.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And verily he will find the roots of the good and the bad, the fruitful and the fruitless, all entwined together in the silent heart of the earth.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “If tragedy does not ensnare a man, if affliction does not agitate him, if love does not lay him down in the cradle of dreams, then his life is like a blank, white page in the book of existence. In that year I saw the”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For the soul walks upon all paths.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “He suffered much, but he understood the mystery of pain: he knew that tears make all things shine.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You need not fear, my love,for never have the stars on hightold what they know.”
author: Kahlil Gibrán

quote: “The musician may sing to you of the rhythm which is in all space, but he cannot give you the ear which arrests the rhythm, nor the voice that echoes it.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The veil that clouds your eyes shall be lifted by the hands that wove it, And the clay that fills your ears shall be pierced by those fingers that kneaded it. And you shall see.And you shall hear.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You are a slave to him whom you love because you love him. And a slave to him who loves you because he loves you.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “But let there be no scales to weigh your unknown treasure.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You are good in countless ways, and you are not evil when you are not good,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “They see only their shadows, and their shadows are their laws.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your house shall be not an anchor but a mast.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And to both, bee and flower, the giving and the receiving of pleasure is a need and an ecstasy.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You may judge others only according to your knowledge of yourself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Sorrow is just a wall between two gardens.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And even as each one of you stands alone in God's knowledge, so must each one of you be alone in his knowledge of God and in his understanding of the earth.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Therefore trust the physician, and drink his remedy in silence and tranquillity:”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And let to-day embrace the past with remembrance and the future with longing.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Her bones were of bronze and her sinews of the ancient elms, and her eyes were like the sky, wide and daring.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Speak not of peoples and laws andKingdoms, for the whole earth isMy birthplace and all humans areMy brothers.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And the cup he brings, though it burn your lips, has been fashioned of the clay which the Potter has moistened with His own sacred tears.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and melt into the sun?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And he to whom worshipping is a window, to open but also to shut, has not yet visited the house of his soul whose windows are from dawn to dawn.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The appearance of things change according to the emotions, and thus we see magic and beauty in them, while the magic and beauty are really in ourselves.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Therefore give now, that the season of giving may be yours and not your inheritors’.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You want to know the meaning of death. But how shall you find it unless you seek it in the heart of life?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “My first glimpse of you was not in truth the first. The hour in which our hearts met confirmed in me the belief in Eternity and in the immortality of the Soul.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And there are those who give with pain, and that pain is their baptism.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Do not blame a person for drinking lest he is trying to forget something more serious than drinking.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “If this is my day of harvest, in what fields have I sowed the seed, and in what unremembered seasons?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The selfsame well from which your laughter now rises was once filled with your tears... The deeper sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Wealth is as love in that it destroys him who withholds it but grants life to him who gives freely of it.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But let there be spaces in your togetherness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Once every hundred years Jesus of Nazareth meets Jesus of the Christian in a garden among the hills of Lebanon. And they talk long; and each time Jesus of Nazareth goes away saying to Jesus of the Christian, "My friend, I fear we shall never, never agree.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Then the gates of his heart were flung open, and his joy flew far over the sea. And he closed his eyes and prayed in the silences of his soul.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Into the seasonless world where you shall laugh, but not all of your laughter, and weep, but not all of your tears.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Though his voice may shatter your dreams as the north wind lays waste the garden.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I have no enemies...but if I am to have an enemy, Let his strength be equal to mine, That truth alone may be the victor.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It is the bitter potion by which the physician within you heals your sick self.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Know, therefore, that from the greater silence I shall return..... Forget not that I shall come back to you....A little while, a moment of rest upon the wind, and anohter woman shall bear me.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For his hand, though heavy and hard, is guided by the tender hand of the Unseen,”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Only love and death, are capable of changing everything.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Do not limp before the lame, deeming it a kindness.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Would that you could live on the fragrance of the earth, and like an air plant be sustained by the light.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Who can depart from his pain, and his aloneness without regret??”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And when you can no longer dwell in the solitude of your heart you live in your lips, and sound is a diversion and a pastime.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are the way and the wayfarers.And when one of you falls down he falls for those behind him, a caution against the stumbling stone.Aye, and he falls for those ahead of him, who, though faster and surer of foot, yet removed not the stumbling stone.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Art is a step from what is obvious and well-known toward what is arcane and concealed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “All these things shall love do unto you that you may know the secrets of your heart, and in that knowledge become a fragment of Life’s heart.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For God opens the doors of truth to him who knocks with the hand of faith”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Believing is a fine thing, but putting those beliefs into execution is a test of strength.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “People of Orphalese, beauty is life when life unveils her holy face.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A pearl is a temple built by pain around a grain of sand.What longing built our bodies and around what grains?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Come, let us drink the last raindrop tears from a narcissus cup and fill our souls with the songs of larks.”
author: Kahlil Gibrán

quote: “For the pillars of the temple stand apart,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I hope I will live long and be able to do some things worthy of giving to you who is giving so much to me.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “They give as in yonder valley the myrtle breathes its fragrance into space.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The truly great man is he who would master no one, and who would be mastered by none.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If you can see only what light reveals and hear only what sound announces,Then in truth you do not see nor do you hear.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And beauty is not a need but an ecstasy.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “you are good when you strive to give of yourself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The silence of aloneness reveals to their eyes their naked selves and they would escape.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A madman is not less a musician than you or myself; only the instrument on which he plays is a little out of tune.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Let there be no scales to weigh your un-known treasure;And seek not the depths of your knowledge with staff or sounding line.For self is a sea boundless and measureless.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And if you cannot work with love but only with distaste, it is better than you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of those who work with joy.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A sense of humour is a sense of proportion.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “One may not reach the dawn save by the path of the night.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The self same well from which your laughs rises was oftentimes filled with your tears.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Would the valleys were your streets, and the green paths your alleys, that you might seek one another through vineyards, and come with the fragrance of the earth in your garments.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I am not strong enough for life’s pleasure and sweetness, because a bird with broken wings cannot fly in the spacious sky. The eyes that are accustomed to the dim light of a candle are not strong enough to stare at the sun.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And thus your freedom when it loses its fetters becomes itself the fetter of a greater freedom.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are the way and the wayfarers.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I have come to learn about things that intrigue people through their strangeness. But barley did I find myself in you presence than I understood that life is none other than the different manifestations of the universal spirit.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I have loved humanity, I have loved it so much. For me, there are three kinds of men; he who curses life, he who blesses it and he who contemplates it. I loved the first for his wretchedness, the second for his indulgence and the third for his perception.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I use hate as a weapon to defend myself; had I been strong, I would never have needed that kind of a weapon.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The professors in the academy say, “Do not make the model more beautiful than she is,” and my soul whispers, “O if you could only paint the model as beautiful as she really is.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Could you keep your heart in wonder at the daily miracles of your life, your pain would not seem less wondrous than your joy;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love...it surrounds every being and extends slowly to embrace all that shall be.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And he said, “The joy of scaring is a deep and lasting one, and I never tire of it.” Said I, after a minute of thought, “It is true; for I too have known that joy.” Said he, “Only those who are stuffed with straw can know it.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Let there be spaces in your togetherness, And let the winds of the heavens dance between you. Love one another but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “An exaggeration is a truth that has lost it's temper.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And alone and without his nest shall the eagle fly across the sun.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Yet you shall not deplore having known blindness, nor regret having been deafFor in that day you shall know the hidden purposes in all things,And you shall bless darkness as you would bless light.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Solitude is a silent storm that breaks down all our dead branches. Yet it sends our living roots deeper into the living heart of the living earth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I said to Life, I would hear Death speak. And Life raised her voice a little higher and said, You hear him now.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love possesses not nor would it be possessed, for love is sufficient unto love. And think not you can direct the course of love; for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “So the wicked and the weak cannot fall lower than the lowest which is in you also.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The teacher who walks in the shadow of the temple, among his followers, gives not of his wisdom but rather of his faith and his lovingness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I have yet to meet an ignorant man whose roots are not embedded in my soul.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I only speak to you in words of that which you yourselves know in thought.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Love is the only freedom in this world, because it elevates the soul to a lofty station that cannot be attained by the laws and customs of human beings or conquered by the laws of nature.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Fill each other’s cup but drink not from one cup.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When the treasure-keeper lifts you to weigh his gold and his silver, needs must your joy or your sorrow rise or fall.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “But the hunter was also the hunted,For many of my arrows left my bow only to seek my own breast...”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Man’s needs change, but not his love, nor his desire that his love should satisfy his needs.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And when you work with love you bind your self to yourself, and to one another, and to God.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You are the bows from which your children as living arrows are sent forth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A voice cannot carry the tongue and the lips that gave it wings. Alone must it seek the ether.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And what is fear of need but need itself?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I existed from all eternity and, behold, I am here; and I shall exist till the end of time, for my being has no end.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Stand together yet not too near together:For the pillars of the temples stand apart,And the oak tree and the cypress grow not in each others shadow.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are good in countless ways, and you are not evil when you are not good, you are only loitering and sluggard.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “I cannot tarry longer.The sea that calls all things unto her calls me”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you work you fulfill a part of earth's furthest dream, assigned to you when your dream was born”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Half of what I say is meaningless, but I say it so that the other half may reach you.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain. Is not the cup that holds your wine the very cup that was burned in the potter’s oven? And is not the lute that soothes your spirit the very wood that was hollowed with knives?”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “We have heard her shouting among the mountains,"And with her cries came the sound of hoofs, and the beating of wings and the roaring of lions.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But you are life and you are the veil.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “We often sing lullabyes to our children that we ourselves may sleep.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Think about it. The selfsame well from which your laughter now rises was once filled with your tears. How else can it be? The deeper sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And When he speaks to you believe in him,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And look into space; you shall see Him walking in the cloud, outstretching His arms in the lightning and descending in rain.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The chemist who can extract from his heart’s elements compassion, respect, longing, patience, regret, surprise, and forgiveness and compound them into one can create that atom which is called love.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It is life in quest of life in bodies that fear the grave.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A truth is to be known always, to be uttered sometimes”
author: Gibran Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your reason and your passion are the rudder and the sails of your seafaring soul”
author: Kahil Gibran

quote: “I am the infinite sea, and all worlds are but grains of sand upon my shore.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Of the good in you I can speak, but not of the evil.For what is evil but good tortured by it’s own hunger and thirst?Verily when good is hungry it seeks food even in dark caves, and when it thirsts it drinks even of dead waters.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The difficulty we meet with in reaching our goal is the shortest path to it.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “My friend, I am not what I seem. Seeming is but a garment I wear - a care-woven garment that protects me from thy questionings and thee from my negligence”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And then I shall come to you, a boundless drop to a boundless ocean.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “But I say that even as the holy and the righteous cannot rise beyond the highest which is in each one of you,So the wicked and the weak cannot fall lower than the lowest which is in you also.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “how cruel is man’s ignorance!”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In the forests, there is no religion. No, not even ugly blasphemy there.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love that comes between the naivete and awakening of youth satisfies itself with possessing, and grows with embraces. But Love which is born in the firmament's lap and has descended with the night's secrets is not contented with anything but eternity and immortality.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A great singer is he who sings our silences”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But I say to you that when you work you fulfill a part of earth’s furthest dream, assigned to you when that dream was born,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You were born together, and together you shall be for evermore.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Yet in truth you spoke not of her but of needs unsatisfied,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A voice cannot carry the tongue and the lips that gave it wings.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For how can a tyrant rule the free and the proud, but for a tyranny in their own freedom and a shame in their own pride?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Chapter23On Prayer”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For without words, in friendship, all thoughts, all desires, all expectations are born and shared, with joy that is unclaimed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Haven't we heard that obvious beauty is the cause of many hidden distresses and deep suffering? Is not the beautiful moon, that inspires the poets, the same moon that angers the silence of the sea with a terrible roar?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Your hearts know in silence the secrets of the days and nights.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Would that I could gather your houses into my hand, and like a sower scatter them in forest and meadow.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Through the hands of such as these God speaks, and from behind their eyes He smiles upon the earth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Aye, and he falls for those ahead of him, who, though faster and surer of foot, yet removed not the stumbling stone.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And if it is for your comfort to pour your darkness into space, it is also for your delight to pour forth the dawning of your heart.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Paradise is there, behind that door, in the next room; but I have lost the key.Perhaps I have only mislaid it.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “There are those who give little of the much which they have – and they give it for recognition and their hidden desire makes their gifts unwholesome.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “IF any of you would bring to judgment the unfaithful wife, Let him also weigh the heart of her husband in scales, and measure his soul with measurements.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The eye of a human being is a microscope, which makes the world seem bigger than it really is.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The astronomer may speak to you of his understanding of space, but he cannot give you his understanding.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you work you are a flute through whose heart the whispering hours turns to music. Which of you would be a reed, dumb and silent, when all else sings together in unison?”
author: Kahlil Gibran E Francesco Sufrà (traduttore)

quote: “How narrow is the vision that exalts the busyness of the ant above the singing of the grasshopper.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Have you beauty, that leads the heart from things fashioned of wood and stone to the holy mountain?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Life kisses our faces every morning. Yet, between morning and evening, she laughs at our sorrows.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Should we all confess our sins to one another we would all laugh at one another for our lack of originality.Should we all reveal our virtues we would also laugh for the same cause.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your saying to me "I do not understand you", is praise beyond my worth, and an insult you do not deserve.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When a man destroys his fellow, people say that such a one is a murderer. When one set in authority destroys, it is said that this one is a faithful judge.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Smile, my beloved, like the gold smiles from my father's coffers.”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “He who has not looked on Sorrow will never see Joy”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Every thought I have imprisoned in expression I must free by my deeds.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself. They come through you but not from you, And though they are with you yet they belong not to you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A shy failure is nobler than an immodest success.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A poet is a dethroned king sitting among the ashes of his palace trying to fashion an image out of the ashes.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We measure time according to the movement of countless suns; and they measure time by little machines in their little pockets.Now tell me, how could we ever meet at the same place and the same time?”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “THEN Almitra spoke again and said, And what of Marriage, master?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Inspiration will always sing; inspiration will never explain. We often sing lullabies to our children that we ourselves may sleep. All our words are but crumbs that fall down from the feast of the mind.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But I look up high to see only the light, And never look down to see my shadow. This is wisdom which man must learn.- Song Of The Flower XXIII”
author: Khalil Gibran جبران خليل جبران

quote: “That which sings and contemplates in you is still dwelling within the bounds of that first moment which scattered the stars into space”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Is not the lute that soothes your spirit the very wood that was hollowed with knives.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For what is your friend that you should seek him with hours to kill? Seek him always with hours to live.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “... what are your possessions but things you keep and guard for fear you may need them tomorrow?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We are all prisoners, but some of us are in cells with windows and some without.”
author: Kahil Gibran

quote: “Perhaps the sea's definition of a shell is the pearl.Perhaps time's definition of coal is the diamond.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And he who has deserved to drink from the ocean of life deserves to fill his cup from your little stream.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Lovers embrace that which is between them rather than each other.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The lights of stars that were extinguished ages ago still reaches us. So it is with great men who died centuries ago, but still reach us with the radiations of their personalities.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Between what is said and not meant, and what is meant and not said, most of love is lost”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Not without a wound in the spirit shall I leave this city.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And when his wings enfold you yield to him,Though the sword hidden among his pinions may wound you.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Give your hearts, but not into each other’s keeping. For only the hand of Life can contain your hearts. And stand together yet not too near together: For the pillars of the temple stand apart, And the oak tree and the cypress grow not in each other’s shadow.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Bread baked without love is a bitter bread that feeds but half a man's hunger.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And though heavy-grounded ships await the tide upon your shores, yet, even like an ocean, you cannot hasten your tides.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love one another, but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls. Fill each other’s cup but drink not from one cup.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are good when you walk to your goal firmly and with bold steps. Yet you are not evil when you go thither limping. Even those who limp go not backward. But you who are strong and swift, see that you do not limp before the lame, deeming it kindness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “No lower can a man descend than to interpret his dreams into gold and silver”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And if you cannot work with love but only with distate, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of those who work with joy”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Now I know that here is something higher than heaven and deeper than ocean and stranger than life and death and time. I know now what I did not know before.”
author: Kahlil Gibran The Prophet by

quote: “And you would watch with serenity through the winters of your grief. Much of your pain is self-chosen. It is the bitter potion by which the physician within you heals your sick self.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The subtlest beauties in our life are unseen and unheard.”
author: Kahlil gibran

quote: “If the Milky Way were not within me how should I have seen it or known it?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And he who defines his conduct by ethics imprisons his song-bird in a cage. The freest song comes not through bars and wires.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Knowledge and understanding are life's faithful companions who will never prove untrue to you. For knowledge is your crown, and understanding your staff; and when they are with you, you can possess no greater treasures.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Only another breath will I breathe in this still air, only another loving look cast backward, And then I shall stand among you a seafarer among seafarers.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And what is fear of need but need itself? Is not dread of thirst when your well is full, the thirst that is unquenchable?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Friendship is not opportunity, its responsibility.”
author: Khalil Jabraan

quote: “To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what they have already achieved, but at what they aspire to achieve”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And knows that yesterday is but today’s memory and tomorrow is today’s dream.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts; And when you can no longer dwell in the solitude of your heart you live in your lips, and sound is a diversion and a pastime.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Kindness is like snow. It beautifies everything it covers.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And let your board stand an altar on which the pure and the innocent of forest and plain are sacrificed for that which is purer and still more innocent in man.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Art is a step from nature toward the Infinite.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is not a garment I cast off this day, but a skin that I tear with my own hands.Nor is it a thought I leave behind me, but a heart made sweet with hunger and with thirst.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are good when you are fully awake in your speech.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your hearts know in silence the secrets of the days and the nights. But your ears thirst for the sound of your heart's knowledge. You would know in words that which you have always known in thought. You would touch with your fingers the naked body of your dreams.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Work is love made visible. And if you cannot work with love but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of those who work with joy.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is to build a house with affection, even as if your beloved were to dwell in that house.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A voice cannot carry the tongue and the lips that give it wings. Alone must it seek the ether. And alone and without his nest shall the eagle fly across the sun.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your friend is your needs answered. He is your field which you sow with love and reap with thanksgiving. And he is your board and your fireside. For you come to him with your hunger, and you seek him for peace.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “They spread before us their riches of gold and silver, of ivory and ebony, and we spread before them our hearts and our spirits.;And yet they deem themselves the hosts and us the guests.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If it were not for our conception of weights and measures we would stand in awe of the firefly as we do before the sun.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Here love begins to render the prose of Life into hymns and canticles of praise”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But tell me, who is he that can offend the spirit? Shall the nightingale offend the stillness of the night, or the firefly the stars?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The Infinite keeps naught save Love, for it is in its own likeness.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And if there come the singers and the dancers and the flute-players, — buy of their gifts also. For they too are gatherers of fruit and frankincense, and that which they bring, though fashioned of dreams, is raiment and food for your soul.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For self is a sea boundless and measureless.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Forget not that modesty is for a shield against the eye of the unclean. And when the unclean shall be no more, what were modesty but a fetter and a fouling of the mind?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You shall not fold your wings that you may pass through doors, nor bend your heads that they strike not against a ceiling, nor fear to breathe lost walls should crack and fall down”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Work is love made visible. And if you cannot work with love but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of those who work with joy. For”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of life's longing for itself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And could you keep your heart in wonder at the daily miracles of your life, your pain would not seem less wondrous than your joy...”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I prefer to be a dreamer among the humblest, with visions to be realized, than lord among those without dreams and desires.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For even as love crowns you so shall he crucify you. Even as he is for your growth so is he for your pruning.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love is trembling happiness.”
author: Kahil Gibran

quote: “And if it is a fear you would dispel, the seat of that fear is in your heart and not in the hand of the feared.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And think not you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course. Love has no other desire but to fulfil itself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The sea that calls all things unto her calls me, and I must embark.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “He stood up and looked at me even as the seasons might look down upon the field, and He smiled. And He said again: "All men love you for themselves. I love you for yourself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is said that unsophistication makes a man empty and that emptiness makes him carefree.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Say not, “I have found the truth,” but rather, “I have found a truth.” Say not, “I have found the path of the soul.” Say rather, “I have met the soul walking upon my path.” For the soul walks upon all paths.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The soul walks not upon a line, neither does it grow like a reed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “People often say women want to be loved. But they really want much more. Many women want to bear children; and their very being wants to give children life. She often desires men just as a key to the child that is in her to give life to.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “He drank life from these breasts now dry, and he took his first steps in this garden, grasping these fingers that are now like trembling reeds.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And what is it to work with love? It is to weave the cloth with threads drawn from your heart, even as if your beloved were to wear that cloth. It is to build a house with affection, even as if your beloved were to dwell in that house.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The nearest to my heart are a king without a kingdom and a poor man who does not know how to beg.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “For the master spirit of the earth shall not sleep peacefully upon the wind till the needs of the least of you are satisfied”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you love you should not say, "God is in my heart," but rather, "I am in the heart of God." And think not you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Hurry, oh peaceful Death, and carry me from these multitudes who left me in the dark corner of oblivion because I do not bleed the weak as they do. Come, oh gentle Death, and enfold me under your white wings, for my fellowmen are not in want of me. Embrace”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And if it is a despot you would dethrone, see first that his throne erected within you is destroyed. For how can a tyrant rule the free and the proud, but for a tyranny in their own freedom and a shame in their own pride?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It shall not be a glistening film that covers a wound, but an eyelid that guards the eye.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The sorrowful spirit finds relaxation in solitude. It abhors people, as a wounded deer deserts the herd and lives in a cave until it is healed or dead.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Between us, Mary, there stands an unknown god”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “My soul counselled me and instructed me to see that the light which I carry is not my light, That my song was not created within me; For though I travel with the light, I am not the light.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “We cannot ask thee for aught, for thou knowest our needs before they are born in us:”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “The owl whose night-bound eyes are blind undo the day cannot unveil the mystery of light.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Should you care to write (and only the saints know why you should) you must needs have knowledge and art and magic - the knowledge of the music of words, the art of being artless, and the magic of loving your readers.”
author: Kahil Gibran

quote: “Yesterday is but today's memory, and tomorrow is but today's dream.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Many a woman borrows a man's heart; Very few could possess it.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Should you sit upon a cloud you would not see the boundary line between one country and another, nor the boundary stone between a farm and a farm.It is a pity you cannot sit upon a cloud.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And to the open-handed the search for one who shall receive is joy greater than giving.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are far greater than you know, and all is well.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Deep is your longing for the land of your memories and the dwelling-place of your greater desires; and our love would not bind you nor our needs hold you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Only an idiot and a genius break man-made laws; and they are the nearest to the heart of God.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Beauty is a thing of might and dread.Like the tempest she shakes the earth beneath us and the sky above us.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Much of your pain is self-chosen. It is the bitter potion by which the physician within you heals your sick self.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But I say that even as the holy and the righteous cannot rise beyond the highest which is in each one of you,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The flowers of spring are winter's dreams related at the breakfast table of the angels.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “All you have shall some day be given; Therefore, give now, that the season of giving may be yours and not your inheritors’.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The cup does not entice the lips unless the wine's colour is seen through the transparent crystal.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you see a man led to prison say in your heart, "Mayhap he is escaping from a narrower prison."And when you see a man drunken say in your heart, "Mayhap he sought escape from something still more unbeautiful.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For what are your possessions but things you keep and guard for fear you may need them to morrow?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Beauty is not a need but an ecstasy.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But if you in your pain call birth an affliction and the support of the flesh a curse written upon your brow, then I answer that naught but the sweat of your brow shall wash away that which is written.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You have walked among us a spirit, and your shadow has been a light upon our faces.Much have we loved you. But speechless was our love, and with veils has it been veiled.”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “You would adjust your conduct and even direct the course of your spirit according to hours and seasons.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “SPRING In every winter’s heart there is a quivering spring, and behind the veil of each night there is a smiling dawn. SP-ST-57”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you pray you rise to meet in the air those who are praying at that very hour, and whom save in prayer you may not meet.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And he who defines his conduct by ethics imprisons his song-bird”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “ACTION A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowled1ge that is idle. WM-ST-63”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone, even as the strings of a lute are alone though they quiver with the same music.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I want to write more but I cannot. I am a little weary and the silence in my soul is black. I wish I could rest my head on your shoulder.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A root is a flower that disdains fame.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A great singer is he who sings our silences.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.Even as the stone of the fruit must break, that its heart may stand in the sun, so must you know pain.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Hearts that are united through the medium of sorrow will not be separated by the glory of happiness. Love”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And my heart bled within me; for you can only be free when even the desire of seeking freedom becomes a harness to you, and when you cease to speak of freedom as a goal and a fulfilment.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is well to give when asked, but it is better to give unasked, through understanding; And to the open-handed the search for one who shall receive is joy greater than giving.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “My life was a coma, empty like that of Adam's in Paradise, when I saw Selma standing before me like a column of light. She was the Eve of my heart who filled it with secrets and wonders and made me understand the meaning of life...”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Drink not from this cup unless you forget the past and the future, for happiness is naught but the moment.” And”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Life is but a sleep disturbed By dreaming”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love one another, but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When love beckons to you, follow him, Though his ways are hard and steep. And when his wings enfold you yield to him, Though the sword hidden among his pinions may wound you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your soul is oftentimes a battlefield, upon which your reason and your judgment wage war against your passion and your appetite.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain. Is not the cup that holds your wine the very cup that was burned in the potter's oven?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In truth that which you call freedom is the strongest of these chains, though its links glitter in the sun and dazzle your eyes.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Oftentimes I have hated in self-defense; but if I were stronger I would not have used such a weapon.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You cannot laugh and be unkind at the same time.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And could you keep your heart in wonder at the daily miracles of your life, your pain would not seem less wondrous than your joy; And you would accept”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And if our hands should meet in another dream we shall build another tower in the sky.”
author: Kahil Gibran

quote: “If I were to choose between the power of writing a poem and the ecstasy of a poem unwritten, I would choose the ecstasy. It is better poetry.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Hearken to my story. Listen but do not pity me. For pity is intended for the weak and I am still strong in my affliction.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You may give them your love, but not your thoughts, for they have their own thoughts. You may house their bodies but not their souls, for their souls dwell in the house of tomorrow, which you cannot visit, not even in your dreams.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We live only to discover beauty. All else is a form of waiting.”
author: Kalil Gibran

quote: “The house that does not comfort the needy is worthy of naught but destruction.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “To follow Beauty even when she shall lead you to the verge of the precipice; and though she is winged and you are wingless, and though she shall pass beyond the verge, follow her, for where Beauty is not, there is nothing;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love gives naught but itself and takes naught but from itself. Love possesses not nor would it be possessed; For love is sufficient unto love.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “So too is love a sigh from the sea of emotions, a tear from the sky of love, and a smile from the field of the soul.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is to weave the cloth with threads drawn from your heart, even as if your beloved were to wear that cloth.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Thou art our need; and in giving us more of thyself thou givest us all.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “You have been told that, even like a chain, you are as weak as your weakest link. This is but half the truth.You are also as strong as your strongest link.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “When you are joyous, look deep into your heart and you shall find it is only that which has given you sorrow that is giving you joy. When you are sorrowful, look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “in much of your talking, thinking is half murdered.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Though his ways are hard and steep.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You delight in laying down laws, Yet you delight more in breaking them.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Who can separate his faith from his actions, or his belief from his occupations? Who can spread his hours before him, saying, 'This for God and this for myself; This for my soul, and this other for my body?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your pain is the breaking of the shell that endoses your understanding.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Only another breath will I breathe in this still air, only another look cast backward,Then I shall stand among you, a seafarer among seafarers.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You have been told also that life is darkness, and in your weariness you echo what was said by the weary.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And if any of you would punish in the name of righteousness and lay the ax unto the evil tree, let him see to its roots;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Much have we loved you. But speechless was our love, and with veils has it been veiled. Yet now it cries aloud unto you, and would stand revealed before you. And ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Shall the day of parting be the day of gathering? And shall it be said that my eve was in truth my dawn?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “All these things have you said of beauty, Yet in truth you spoke not of her but of needs unsatisfied,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is to charge all things you fashion with a breath of your own spirit, and to know that all blessed dead are standing about you and watching. Work is love made visible.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “DEVIL Remember, one just man causes the Devil greater affliction than a million blind believers. WM-ST-62”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If your heart is a volcano,how shall you expect flower to bloom?”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “Let there be spaces in your togetherness.And let the wind of the heavens dance between you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The image of the morning sun in a dewdrop is not less than the sun. The reflection of life in your soul is not less than life.The dewdrop mirrors the light because it is one with light, and you reflect life because you and life are one.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And you would accept the seasons of your heart, even as you have always accepted the seasons that pass over your fields.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Perhaps the dark can veil trees and flowers from the eye. But it can’t hide love from the soul.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Poetry is not an opinion expressed. It is a song that rises from a bleeding wound or a smiling mouth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your friend is your needs answered.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Oh human heart, woman is your own reflection, and whatever you are, she is; wherever you live, she lives; she is like religion if not interpreted by the ignorant, and like a moon, if not veiled with clouds, and like a breeze, if not poisoned with impurities.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “the very privilege of non-belief represents the victory of philosophy; otherwise the non-churchgoer would still face the lions or the stake. Gibran”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “People of Orphalese, beauty is life when life unveils her holy face. But you are life and you are the veil. Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror. But you are eternity and you are the mirror.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “NIGHTINGALE The nightingale does not make his nest in a cage lest slavery be the lot of its chicks. BW-ST-122”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But if in your fear you would seek only love's peace and pleasure, then it is better for you that you cover your nakedness and pass out of love's threshing-floor.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Every man is two men; One is awake in the darkness, the other asleep in the light.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The musician may sing to you of the rhythm which is in all space, but he cannot give you the ear which arrests the rhythm nor the voice that echoes it.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “...the timeless in you is aware of life's timelessness...”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Who can separate his faith from his actions, or his belief from his occupations? Who can spread his hours before him, saying, “This for God and this for myself; “This for my soul and this other for my body”?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Much in you is still man, and much in you is not yet man, But a shapeless pigmy that walks asleep in the mist searching for its own awakening.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “let there be spaces in your togetherness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Darkness may hide the trees and the flowers from the eyes but it cannot hide love from the soul. S”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But since you must kill to eat, and rob the newly born of its mother’s milk to quench your thirst, let it then be an act of worship,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “... who can depart from his pain and his aloneness without regret?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I would not listen to a conqueror preaching to the conquered.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “He who understands you is greater kin to you than your own brother. For even your own kindred may neither understand you nor know your true worth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The poet is a pure spring from which all thirsty souls may drink.”
author: Khalil Gibran جبران خليل جبران

quote: “Your children are not your children.They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself.They come through you but not from you,And though they are with you yet they belong not to you.”

quote: “I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet, strange, I am ungrateful to these teachers.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Pleasure is a freedom-song, But it is not freedom. It is the blossoming of your desires, But it is not their fruit. It is a depth calling unto a height, But it is not the deep nor the high.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You may give them your love but not your thougts, For they have their own thoughts. You may house their bodies but not their souls, For their souls dwell in the house of tomorrow, which you cannot visit, not even in your dreams.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Dig anywhere in the earth and you will find a treasure, only you must dig with the faith of a peasant.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The human heart cries out for help; the human soul implores us for deliverance; but we do not heed their cries, for we neither hear nor understand. But the man who hears and understands we call mad, and flee from him.”

quote: “The freest song comes not through bars and wires.”

quote: “You shall be free indeed when your days are not without a care nor your nights without a want and a grief, But rather when these things girdle your life and yet you rise above them naked and unbound.”

quote: “But it is also the pleasure of the flower to yield its honey to the bee. For to the bee a flower is a fountain of life, And to the flower a bee is a messenger of love, And to both, bee and flower, the giving and the receiving of pleasure is a need and an ecstasy.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Even those who limp go not backward.”

quote: “When you part from your friend, you grieve not;For that which you love in him most may be clearer in his absence, as the mountain to the climber is clearer from the plain.”

quote: “You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts;”

quote: “Frogs may bellow louder than bulls, but they cannot drag the plough in the field nor turn the wheel of the winepress, and of their skins you cannot make shoes.”

quote: “Words are timeless. You should utter them or write them with a knowledge of their timelessness.”

quote: “For to be overmindful of your debt, is to doubt his generosity who has the free-hearted earth for mother, and God for father.”

quote: “Suffer not yet our eyes to hunger for your face.”
