quote: “On Self-knowledge:You would know in words that which you have always known in thought.You would touch with your fingers the naked body of your dreams.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “That sorrow which obsessed me during my youth was not caused by lack of amusement, because I could have had it; neither from lack of friends, because I could have found them. That sorrow was caused by an inward ailment which made me love solitude.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If this indeed be the hour in which I lift up my lantern, it is not my flame that shall burn therein.Empty and dark shall I raise my lantern,And the guardian of the night shall fill it with oil and he shall light it also.”

quote: “See first that you yourself deserve to be a giver, and an instrument of giving. For in truth it is life that gives unto life-while you, who deem yourself a giver, are but a witness.”

quote: “For affliction has opened my eyes, and tears given me sight. Grief has taught me the language of hearts.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If winter should say, "Spring is in my heart," who would believe winter?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Yestereve, on the marble steps of the Temple, I saw a woman sitting between two men. One side of her face was pale, the other was blushing.”

quote: “And even as each one of you stands alone in God’s knowledge, so must each one of you be alone in his knowledge of God and in his understanding of the earth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We wanderers, ever seeking the lonelier way, begin no day where we have ended another day, and no sunrise finds us where sunset left us.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And when you crush an apple with your teeth, say to it in your heart: “Your seeds shall live in my body, And the buds of your to-morrow shall blossom in my heart, And your fragrance shall be my breath, And together we shall rejoice through all the seasons.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Shall there come a day when wise men are able to unite the dreams of youth and the delights of learning as reproach brings together hearts in conflict? Shall there come a day when man’s teacher is nature, and humanity is his book”

quote: “The archer sees the mark upon the path of the infinite, and He bends you with His might that His arrows may go swift and far.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Much in you is still man, and much in you is not yet man, But a shapeless pigmy”

quote: “Beauty is not in the face,beauty is a light in the heart.”

quote: “And you would accept the seasons of your heart, even as you have always accepted the seasons that pass over your fields. And you would watch with serenity through the winters of your grief.”

quote: “Some of you say, “Joy is greater than sorrow,” and others say, “Nay, sorrow is the greater.” But I say unto you, they are inseparable. Together they come, and when one sits alone with you at your board, remember that the other is asleep upon your bed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The Almitra spoke again an said , And what of Marriage, Master?and he answered saying:You were born together, and together you shall be forevermore. You shall be together when the white wings of death scatter you days.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are the way and the wayfarers. And when one of you falls down he falls for those behind him, a caution against the stumbling stone. Aye, and he falls for those ahead of him, who, though faster and surer of foot, yet removed not the stumbling stone.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your hearts know in silence the secrets of the days and the nights. But your ears thirst for the sound of your heart’s knowledge. You would know in words that which you have always known in thought.”

quote: “Remembrance is a form of meeting.Forgetfulness is a form of freedom.”

quote: “And I have found both freedom and safety in my madness; the freedom of loneliness and the safety from being understood, for those who understand us enslave something in us.But let me not be too proud of my safety. Even a Thief in a jail is safe from another thief.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “the mountain to the climber is clearer from the plain.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The owl whose night-bound eyes are blind unto the day cannot unveil the mystery of light. If you would indeed behold the spirit of death, open your heart wide unto the body of life. For life and death are one, even as the river and the sea are one.”

quote: “When you work you are a flute through whose heart the whispering of the hours turn to music.”

quote: “You shall be free indeed when your days are not without a care nor your nights without a want and a grief, But rather when these things girdle your life and yet you rise above them naked and unbound.”

quote: “FLOWERS The flowers of the field are the children of sun’s affection and nature’s love; and the children of men are the flowers of love and compassion. BW-ST-122”

quote: “A hermit is one who renounces the world of fragments that he may enjoy the world wholly and without interruption.”

quote: “In the morning, when I walked in the fields, I saw the token of Eternity in the awakening of nature, and when I sat by the seashore I heard the waves singing the song of Eternity.”

quote: “A woman may veil her face with a smile.”

quote: “I prefer to be a dreamer among the humblest, with visions to be realized, than lord among those without dreams or desires”

quote: “Is not the dread of thirst when your well is full, the thirst that is unquenchable?”

quote: “For what are your possessions but things you keep and guard for fear you may need them tomorrow?”

quote: “It were wiser to speak less of God, Whom we cannot understand, and more of each other, whom we may understand.”

quote: “When you reach the heart of life you shall find beauty in all things, even in the eyes that are blind to beauty.”

quote: “Yesterda is nothing but, Today's Memory and Tomorrow is Today's Dream”

quote: “I simply can’t relax. My mind is like a brook, always running, always seeking, always murmuring. I was born with an arrow in my heart, and it is painful to pull it and it is painful to leave it.”

quote: “Would that you could live on the fragrance of the earth, and like an air plant be sustained by light.Bu since you must kill to eat, and rob the newly born of its mother's milk to quench your thirst, let it then be an act of worship.”

quote: “But let there be spaces in your togetherness. And let the winds of the heavens dance between you.”

quote: “Surely there is no greater gift to a man than that which turns all his aims into parching lips and all life into a fountain.”

quote: “You often say, “I would give, but only to the deserving.” The trees in your orchard say not so, nor the flocks in your pasture. They give that they may live, for to withhold is to perish.”

quote: “When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight. Some of you say, 'Joy is greater than sorrow,' and others say, 'Nay, sorrow is the greater.' But I say unto you, they are inseparable.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “let your soul exalt your reason to the height ofpassion, that it may sing; And let it direct your passion with reason, that your passion may live through its own daily resurrection, and like the phoenix rise above its own ashes.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “But let there be spaces in your togetherness, And let the winds of the heavens dance between you. Love one another, but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Surely you would not honour one guest above the other; for he who is more mindful of one loses the love and the faith of both.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “To be able to look back upon one's life in satisfaction, is to live twice”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love has no other desire but to fulfill itself. To melt and be like a running brook that sings its melody to the night. To wake at dawn with a winged heart and give thanks for another day of loving..”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your reason and your passion are the rudder and sails of your seafaring soul”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your other self is always sorry for you. But your other self grows on sorrow, so all is well”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For what is your friend that you should seek him with hours to kill?Seek him always with hours to live.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And as a single leaf turns not yellow but with the silent knowledge of the whole tree,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Ready am I to go, and my eagerness with sails full set awaits the wind. Only another breath will I breathe in this still air, only another loving look cast backward, And then I shall stand among you, a seafarer among seafarers.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Hate is a dead thing. Who of you would be a tomb?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Waiting is the hoofs of time.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Let there be space in your togetherness, and let the winds of the heavens dance between you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding. Even as the stone of the fruit must break, that its heart may stand in the sun, so must you know pain.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Say not, “I have found the path of the soul.” Say rather, “I have met the soul walking upon my path.” For the soul walks upon all paths. The soul walks not upon a line, neither does it grow like a reed. The soul unfolds itself, like a lotus of countless petals.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And you, vast sea, sleeping mother, Who alone are peace and freedom to the river and the stream, Only another winding will this stream make, only another murmur in this glade, And then I shall come to you, a boundless drop to a boundless ocean.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Verily the kindness that gazes upon itself in a mirror turns to stone,And a good deed that calls itself by tender names becomes the parent to a curse”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “How mean am I when life gives me gold and I give you silver, and yet I deem myself generous.”

quote: “Then the Queen of Fantasy drew me toward her with a look of enchanting and kissed my burning lips, say: "Say that who passes not his days in the region of dreams is the slave of those days.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “He who listens to truth is not less than he who utters truth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “No man can reveal to you aught but that which already lies half-asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “the moments which united us are greater than centuries, and the light that illuminated our spirits is stronger than the dark; and if the tempest separates us on this rough ocean, the waves will unite us on the calm shore; and if this life kills us, death will unite us.”

quote: “in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You give much and know not that you give at all.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “attracted by the body and repelled by the spirit,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If the great-grandfather of Jesus had known what was hidden within him, would he not have stood in awe of himself?”

quote: “There are those who give with joy and that joy is their reward.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “...love is transformed in its servants into a consuming fire.”

quote: “Every man loves two women; the one is the creation of his imagination, and the other is not yet born.”

quote: “When you tell your trouble to your neighbour you present him with a part of your heart. If he possesses a great soul, he thanks you; if he possesses a small one, he belittles you.”

quote: “Love possesses not nor would it be possessed; For love is sufficient unto love.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Fill each other’s cup but drink not from one cup. Give one another of your bread but eat not from the same loaf. {20}Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone, Even as the strings of a lute are alone though they quiver with the same music.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.For love that seeks aught but the disclosure of its own mystery is not love but a net cast forth: and only the unprofitable is caught.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you have solved all the mysteries of life you long for death, for it is but another mystery of life.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But I say, not in sleep, but in the overwakefulness of noontide, that the wind speaks not more sweetly to the giant oaks than to the least of all the blades of grass;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For what is your friend that you should seek him with hours to kill?Seek him always with hours to live.For it is his to fill your need, but not your emptiness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “it is his to fill your need, but not your emptiness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The angels know that too many practical men eat their bread with the sweat of the dreamer's brow.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love gives naught but itself and takes naught but from itself. Love possesses not nor would it be possessed;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are good when you strive to give of yourself. Yet you are not evil when you seek gain for yourself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Only a slave restores a crown that has fallen.”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “Only when you are empty are you at standstill and balanced.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “even like an ocean, you cannot hasten your tides.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Let me take you,daughter of the fields,to the lovers' vineyard.The wine we press will quench the fires of longing.You need not fear, my love,for never have the stars on hightold what they know.Night's thick mists swirl in these vineyards;they will veil our secrets.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “think not you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Every great man I have known had something small in his make-up; and it was that small something which prevented inactivity or madness or suicide.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The archer sees the mark upon the path of the infinite, and He bends you with His might that His arrows may go swift and far. Let your bending in the archer’s hand be for gladness; For even as He loves the arrow that flies, so He loves also the bow that is stable.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “he who has deserved to drink from the ocean of life deserves to fill his cup from your little stream.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The truly just is he who feels half guilty of your misdeeds.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The Sphinx spoke only once, and the Sphinx said, 'A grain of sand is a desert, and a desert is a grain of sand; and now let us all be silent again.'I heard the Sphinx, but I did not understand.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Fame is the shadow of passion standing in the light.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “... who are you that men should rend their bosom and unveil their pride, that you may see their worth naked and their pride unabashed?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “...who can depart from his pain and his aloneness without regret?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In the depths of your hopes and desires lie your silent knowledge of the beyond.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Every man is the descendant of every king and every slave that ever lived.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But if in you thought you must measure time into seasons, let each season encircle all the other seasons, And let today embrace the past with remembrance and the future with longing.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And in the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is the honor of the murdered that he is not the murderer.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And from that day to this, the wise men of Ishana say one to another secretly, "Is it not known, and has it not been said from of old, that Ishana is ruled by an enemy?”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “It is when your spirit goes wandering upon the wind, That you, alone and unguarded, commit a wrong unto others and therefore unto yourself. And for that wrong committed must you knock and wait a while unheeded at the gate of the blessed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Of the good in you I can speak, but not of the evil. For what is evil but good tortured by its own hunger and thirst?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “COURSER My soul, living is like a courser of the night; the swifter its flight, the nearer the dawn. WM-ST-69”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Life without love is like a tree without blossom or fruit.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “All men love you for themselves. I love you for yourself”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Fortune craves not Contentment, for it is an earthly hope, and its desires are embraced by union with objects, while Contentment is naught but heartfelt. ”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You work that you may keep pace with the earth and the soul of the earth. For to be idle is to become a stranger unto the seasons, and to step out of life’s procession that marches in majesty and proud submission towards the infinite.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “thought is a bird of space, that in a cage of words may indeed unfold its wings but cannot fly.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Surely the fruit cannot say to the root, “Be like me, ripe and full and ever giving of your abundance.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Oftentimes in denying yourself pleasure you do but store the desire in the recesses of your being.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The silence of the envious is too noisy.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Often times in denying yourself pleasure, you do but store the desire in the recesses of your being.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When God threw me, a pebble, into this wondrous lake,I disturbed its surface with countless circles.But when I reached the depths,I became very still.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “let there be spaces in your togetherness, And let the winds of the heavens dance between you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We wanderers, ever seeking the lonelier way, begin no day where we have ended another day;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Death most resembles a prophet who is without honor in his own land or a poet who is a stranger among his people.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You make such a noise falling! You scatter all my winter dreams”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And let him who would lash the offender look unto the spirit of the offended.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you kill a beast say to him in your heart: “By the same power that slays you, I too am slain; and I too shall be consumed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky. We fell them down and turn them into paper that we may record our emptiness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “if it is a fear you would dispel, the seat of that fear is in your heart and not in the hand of the feared.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And the will to die, Stronger than all things strong, Is stayed by a will to live, Feebler than all things feeble.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “if you cannot work with love but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of those who work with joy.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Some of your youth seek pleasure as if it were all, and they are judged and rebuked. {80}I would not judge nor rebuke them. I would have them seek.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In the depth of your hopes and desires lies your silent knowledge of the beyond;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For often have I put my finger in my own wound that I might have the greater belief in you and the greater knowledge of you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “...I feel that there is a great power in the depth of my heart that wishes to come out, and it is going to come out some day with the help of God.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Have you peace, the quiet urge that reveals your power? Have you remembrances, the glimmering arches that span the summits of the mind?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Every seed is a longing.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Be mad and tell us what is behind the veil of "sanity". The purpose of life is to bring us closer to those secrets, and madness is the only means.”
author: Kahlil gibran

quote: “the condemned is the burden bearer for the guiltless and unblamed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Would that I could be the peacemaker in your soul, that I might turn the discord and rivalry of your Reason and Passion into oneness and melody. You yourselves be also the peacemakers, nay, the lovers of all your elements.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And you who would understand justice, how shall you unless you look upon all deeds in the fullness of light?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you are joyous, look deep into your heart and you shall find it is only that which has given you sorrow that is giving you joy. When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For in adoration you cannot fly higher than their hopes nor humble yourself lower than their despair.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “To wake at dawn with a winged heart and give thanks for another day of loving;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Wit is often a mask. If you could tear it you would find either a genius irritated or cleverness juggling.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “But let there be spaces in your togetherness, And let the winds of the heavens dance between you. ***** Love one another, but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The strangest things are the closest to the real truth. In the will of man there is a power of longing which turns the mist in ourselves into sun.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When I stood a clear mirror before you, you gazed into me and saw your image.Then you said, "I love you."But in truth you loved yourself in me.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your hearts know in silence the secrets of the days and the nights. But your ears thirst for the sound of your heart’s knowledge. You would know in words that which you have always known in thought. You would touch with your fingers the naked body of your dreams.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is wrong to think that love comes from long companionship and persevering courtship. Love is the offspring of spiritual affinity and unless that affinity is created in a moment, it will not be created in years or even generations.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “MUCH of your pain is self–chosen.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your joy is your sorrow unmasked. And the selfsame well from which your laughter rises was oftentimes filled with your tears. And how else can it be? The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you part from your friend, you grieve not; For that which you love most in him may be clearer in his absence,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “when you can no longer dwell in the solitude of your heart you live in your lips, and sound is a diversion and a pastime.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Women's influence is to be found somewhere behind all the creations of man throughout the centuries. I do not state this as a theory. For me it is a psychological fact, its manifestations being perfectly palpable throughout history.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And think not you can direct the course of love -for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The life that the rich man spends in heaping up gold is in truth like the life of the worms in the grave. It is a sign of fear.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Say not, 'I have found the truth', but rather, 'I have found a truth'.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If I were to choose between the power writing a poem and the ecstasy of a poem unwritten, I would choose the ecstasy. It is better poetry. But you and all my neighbors agree that I always choose badly.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love has no other desire but to fulfil itself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When secrets straiten the heart, when eyes are made raw by hot tears, and ribs nearly crack from the swelling of what is hidden in the breast, man can find no comfort but in words and complaint. Sorrow, my friend, is eased by complaint.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The heart`s affections are divided like the branches of the cedar tree; if the tree loses one strong branch, it will suffer but it does not die. It will pour all its vitality into the next branch so that it will grow and fill the empty place.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror. But you are eternity and you are the mirror.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Those who give you a serpent when you ask for a fish, may have nothing but serpents to give. It is then generosity on their part.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In the still night when all created things embrace the phantom of sleep, I alone am awake, now singing, now sighing. Alas, wakefulness has destroyed me, but I am a lover and the truth of Love is awakening. Behold my life; As I have lived, so shall I die.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “They say the nightingale pierces his bosom with a thorn when he sings his love song. So do we all. How else should we sing?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Then a lawyer said, But what of our Laws, master? And he answered: You delight in laying down laws, Yet you delight more in breaking them. Like children playing by the ocean who build sand-towers with constancy and then destroy them with laughter.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And you would accept the seasons of your heart just as you have always accepted that seasons pass over your fields and you would watch with serenity through the winter of your grief.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “In my need for your nearness I feign remoteness, and in fear of the ebb tide of your love I guard the floodgates of my love.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love is a gracious host to his guests though to the unbidden his house is a mirage and a mockery.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “An exaggeration is a truth that has lost its temper.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And when he is silent your heart ceases not to listen to his heart;For without words, in friendship, all thoughts, all desires, all expectations are born and shared, with joy that is unclaimed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “‎I am night - intimate, joyous, tranquil, troubled. My darkness has no beginning and my depths no end. When the spirits arise, splendid in the light of their joys, my spirit comes frozen in the shadows of its pain.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love one another but make not a bond of love: let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Only when a juggler misses catching his ball does he appeal to me.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “All you have shall some day be given; Therefore give now, that the season of giving may be yours and not your inheritors'.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Verily the lust for comfort murders the passion of the soul, and then walks grining in the funeral.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Only once have I been made mute. It was when a man asked me, "Who are you?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “ONLY when you drink from the river of silence shall you indeed sing. And when you have reached the mountain top, then you shall begin to climb. And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Mayhap a funeral among men is a wedding feast among the angels.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “love that seeks aught but the disclosure of its own mystery is not love but a net cast forth: and only the unprofitable is caught.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “If your heart is a volcano how shall you expect flowers to bloom in your hands?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you part from your friend, you grieve not; For that which you love most in him may be clearer in his absence, as the mountain to the climber is clearer from the plain.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is when your spirit goes wandering upon the wind, That you, alone and unguarded, commit a wrong unto others and therefore unto yourself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For what is evil but good tortured by its own hunger and thirst? Verily when good is hungry it seeks food even in dark caves, and when it thirsts it drinks even of dead waters.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “when one of you falls down he falls for those behind him, a caution against the stumbling stone.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is Love, purified with fire, that stops me from following you to the farthest land. Love kills my desires so that you may live freely and virtuously. Limited love asks for possession of the beloved, but the unlimited asks only for itself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I too am my own forerunner, though I sit in the shadows of my trees and seem motionless.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “There is something in our life which is nobler and more supreme than fame; and this something is the great deed that invokes fame.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You have many lovers, and yet I alone love you.Other man love themselves in your nearness.I love you in yourself”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is indeed misery if I stretch an empty hand to men and receive nothing; but it is hopelessness if I stretch a full hand and find none to receive.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The soul, May, does not see anything in life save that which is in the soul itself. It does not believe except in its own private event, and when it experiences something, the outcome becomes a part of it.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “the wind speaks not more sweetly to the giant oaks than to the least of all the blades of grass”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “life and death are one, even as the river and the sea are one.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “YOU shall be free indeed when your days are not without a care nor your nights without a want and a grief,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Solitude is a silent storm that breaks down all our dead branches; Yet it sends our living roots deeper into the living heart of the living earth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “if it is a care you would cast off, that care has been chosen by you rather than imposed upon you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And then shall I come to you, a boundless drop to a boundless ocean.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “They have exiled me now from their society and I am pleased, because humanity does not exile except the one whose noble spirit rebels against despotism and oppression. He who does not prefer exile to slavery is not free by any measure of freedom, truth and duty. ”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A Poet’s Death is His Life”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Substantial things deaden a man without suffering; love awakens him with enlivening pains. ”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Is not religion all deeds and all reflection”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your daily life is your temple and your religion. Whenever you enter into it take with you your all.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You fan but the fire that consumes you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “My work in these days is like a chain of many rings connected with one another. I have changed my way of living and I miss some of the joys of loneliness that embraced my soul before I dreamed about going to Paris.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Once a man sat at my board and ate my bread and drank my wine and went away laughing at me.Then he came again for bread and wine, and I spurned him;And the angels laughed at me.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “There is nothing more difficult than the existence of a strong spirit in a weak body.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Notice those gorgeous homes that represent happiness, glory and domination; they are naught but caverns of misery and distress.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You pray in your distress and in your need;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The Fox  A fox looked at his shadow at sunrise and said, “I will have a camel for lunch today.” And all morning he went about looking for camels. But at noon he saw his shadow again—and he said, “A mouse will do.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “beauty is life when life unveils her holy face.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “How shall I go in peace and without sorrow? Nay, not without a wound in the spirit shall I leave this city.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When love beckons to you, follow him,Though his ways are hard and steep.And when his wings enfold you yield to him,Though the sword hidden among his pinions may wound you.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Tell me, have you these in your houses? Or have you only comfort, and the lust for comfort, that stealthy thing that enters the house a guest, and then becomes a host, and then a master?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “My being away from the city, living a simple, quiet, and orderly life near the sea and the woods, has stilled the palpitations of my heart.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your pain is the breaking of the shell that enclosed your understanding.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “One hour devoted to mourning and lamenting theStolen equality of the weak is nobler than aCentury filled with greed and usurpation.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “have you only comfort, and the lust for comfort, that stealthy thing that enters the house a guest, and then becomes a host, and then a master?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Say not, ‘I have found the truth,’ but rather, ‘I have found a truth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And so is life. Played by the nights on the stage of destiny as a tragedy; sung by the days as a hymn. And in the end guarded by Eternity as a jewel.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A voice cannot carry the tongue and the lips that gave it wings. Alone must it seek the ether.And alone and without his nest shall the eagle fly across the sun.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your children are not your children. They are sons and daughters of the Life's longing for itself. They come through you but not from you. You may give them your love but not your thoughts. For they have their own thoughts.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “let today embrace the past with remembrance and the future with longing.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “should my voice fade in your ears, and my love vanish in your memory, then I will come again,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “is there aught you would withhold? All you have shall some day be given;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For what is your friend that you should seek him with hours to kill? Seek hime with hours to live!”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “alone and without his nest shall the eagle fly across the sun.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And shall it be said that my eve was in truth my dawn?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Man caught between his heart and soul is like a thin branch whipping between the north wind and the south.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When you reach the heart of life you will find yourself not higher than the felon, and not lower than the prophet.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For the master spirit of the earth shall not sleep peacefully upon the wind till the needs of the least of you are satisfied.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For life goes not backward, nor tarries with yesterday”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life’s longing for itself. They come through you but not from you, And though they are with you yet they belong not to you. *****”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “It is well to give when asked, but it is better to give unasked, through understanding;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain.Is not the cup that holds your wine the very cup that was burned in the potter's oven?And is not the lute that soothes your spirit the very wood that was hollowed with knives?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And to the open-handed the search for one who shall receive is joy greater than giving. And is there aught you would withhold? All you have shall someday be given; Therefore give now, that the season of giving may be yours and not your inheritors’.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And how prosecute you him who in action is a deceiver and an oppressor, Yet who also is aggrieved and outraged?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I love you, my brother, whoever you areWhether you worship in your church,Kneel in your temple, or pray in your mosque.You and I are all children of one faith,For the diverse paths of religion areFingers of the loving hand of one Supreme BeingA hand extended to all”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And if any of you would punish in the name of righteousness and lay the axe unto the evil tree, let him see to its roots;And verily he will find the roots of the good and the bad, the fruitful and the fruitless, all entwined together in the silent heart of the earth.”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “And you would watch with serenity through the winters of your grief.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Sadness is a well we dig inside of us only to fill with happiness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “We were fluttering, wandering, longing creaturesa thousand thousand years before the seaand the wind in the forest gave us words.Now,how can we express the ancient of days in uswith only the sounds of our yesterdays ?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “and I would not havepreferred a royal crown or a wreath of glory to that beautiful smoothhand whose fingers were twined in my hair.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky...”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love possessed not nor would it be possessed; for love is sufficient unto love. Love has no desire but to fulfill itself.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And who are you that men should rend their bosom and unveil their pride, that you may see their worth naked and their pride unabashed?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “when you are joyous, look deep into your heart and you shall find it's only that which has given you sorrow that that is giving you joy”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper, That we may record our emptiness.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Be patient. Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Travel and tell no one, live a true love and tell no one, live happily and tell no one. People ruin beautiful things.”
author: Gibran Khalil Gibran

quote: “For to the fruit giving is a need, as receiving is a need to the root.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And in much of your talking, thinking is half murdered.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I feel that life is a sort of debt and payment. It gives us again and takes from us anew until we get tired of the giving and receiving and surrender to the final sleep.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You delight in laying down laws, Yet you delight more in breaking them”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And from that day to this, the wise men of Ishana say one to another secretly, "Is it not known, and has it not been said from of old, that Ishana is ruled by an enemy?"-Khalil Gibran”
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: “Once I said to a poet "We shall not know your worth until you die." And he answered saying, "Yes, death is always the revealer. And if indeed you would know my worth it is that that I have more in my heart than upon my tongue, and more in my desire than in my hand.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And I say that life is indeed darkness ‘save when there is urge, And all urge is blind save when there is knowledge, And all knowledge is vain save when there is work, And all work is empty save when there is love;”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You give but little when you give of your possessions.  It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “After saying these things the Forerunner covered his face with his hands and wept bitterly. For he knew in his heart that love humiliated in its nakedness is greater than love that seeks triumph in disguise; and he was ashamed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “To be modest in speaking truth is hypocrisy. TM-ST-95”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “some of you have called me aloof, and drunk with my own aloneness,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Every great and beautiful thing in this world is generated by a single thought or feeling within a human being.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “the lust for comfort murders the passion of the soul, and then walks grinning in the funeral.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Some of you say, 'Joy is greater thar sorrow,' and others say, 'Nay, sorrow is the greater.'But I say unto you, they are inseparable.Together they come, and when one sits, alone with you at your board, remember that the other is asleep upon your bed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran The Prophet by

quote: “Or have you only comfort? And the lust for comfort? That stealthy thing that enters your house a guest, and then becomes a host, and then a master.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You would measure time the measureless and the immeasurable.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “What of the old serpent who cannot shed his skin, and calls all others naked and shameless?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You are good when you are one with yourself. Yet when you are not one with yourself you are not evil. For a divided house is not a den of thieves; it is only a divided house.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And a ship without rudder may wander aimlessly among perilous isles yet sink not to the bottom.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And when one of you falls down he falls for those behind him, a caution against the stumbling stone. Aye, and he falls for those ahead of him, who, though faster and surer of foot, yet removed not the stumbling stone.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Poetry is wisdom that enchants the heart.Wisdom is poetry that sings in the mind.If we could enchant man's heart and at the same time sing in his mind,Then in truth he would live in the shadow of God.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And let your best be for your friend. If he must know the ebb of your tide, let him know its flood also.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Much of your pain is self chosen.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For to be idle is to become a stranger unto the seasons, and to step out of life’s procession, that marches in majesty and proud submission towards the infinite.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “A noontide have you been in our twilight, and your youth has given us dreams to dream.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For life goes not backward nor tarries with yesterday. You are the bows from which your children as living arrows are sent forth.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your joy is your sorrow unmasked. The deeper that sorrow carves into your being, the more joy you can contain. Is not the cup that holds your wine the very cup that was burned in the potter’s oven?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The philosopher’s soul dwells in his head, the poet’s soul is in the heart; the singer’s soul lingers about his throat, but the soul of the dancer abides in all her body.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “These things he said in words. But much in his heart remained unsaid. For he himself could not speak his deeper secret.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “let there be spaces in your togetherness and let the winds of the heavens dance between you. Love one another but make not a bond of love: let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Your blood and my blood is naught but the sap that feeds the tree of heaven.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You may give them your love but not your thoughts, For they have their own thoughts. You may house their bodies but not their souls,”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Love humiliated in its nakedness is greater than love that seeks triumph in disguise.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I know faces, because I look through the fabric my own eye weaves, and behold the reality beneath.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “the vision of one man lends not its wings to another man.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “While the Western world has been seeking practical solutions to its problems through science, the various peoples comprising the Arabic-speaking world have preferred to look at life in poetic and philosophical terms.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Men, even if they are born free, will remain slaves of strict laws enacted by their forefathers...”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Would that you could meet teh sun and the wind with more of your skin and less of your raiment, for the breath of life is in the sunlight and the hand of life is in the wind.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The real in us is silent: the acquired is talkative.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “You have been told that, even like a chain, you are as weak as your weakest link. This is but half the truth. You are also as strong as your strongest link.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “and in your weariness you echo what was said by the weary.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “you would watch with serenity through the winters of your grief.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “And what is word knowledge but a shadow of wordless knowledge?”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The envious praises me unknowingly.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “My comrades and my beloved, be bold and not meek; be spacious and not confined; and until my final hour and yours be indeed your greater self.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “My friend, it was but a song of love out of a poet’s heart, sung by every man to every woman.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Trust the dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “The mission of art is to bring out the unfamiliar from the most familiar.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “For to be idle is to become a stranger unto the seasons, and to step out of life’s procession”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “When love becomes vast, love becomes wordless.And when memory is overladen, it seeks the silent deep.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “I had a second birth when my soul and my body loved one another and were married.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Sorrow is too great to exist in small hearts.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Some of you say 'Joy is greater than sorrow,' and others say, 'Nay, sorrow is the greater."But I say unto you, they are inseparable.Together they come, and when one sits alone with you at your board, remember that the other is asleep upon your bed.”
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: “Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.”
author: Seneca

quote: “We suffer more often in imagination than in reality”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Non est ad astra mollis e terris via" - "There is no easy way from the earth to the stars”
author: Seneca

quote: “All cruelty springs from weakness.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by rulers as useful.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “You act like mortals in all that you fear, and like immortals in all that you desire”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.”
author: Seneca

quote: “If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.”
author: Seneca the Younger

quote: “Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms -- you’ll be able to use them better when you’re older.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor. ”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is not that we have so little time but that we lose so much. ... The life we receive is not short but we make it so; we are not ill provided but use what we have wastefully.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “If you really want to escape the things that harass you, what you’re needing is not to be in a different place but to be a different person.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.”
author: Seneca

quote: “He who is brave is free”
author: Seneca

quote: “What need is there to weep over parts of life? The whole of it calls for tears.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “No man was ever wise by chance”
author: Seneca

quote: “They lose the day in expectation of the night, and the night in fear of the dawn.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Associate with people who are likely to improve you.”
author: Seneca

quote: “He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.”
author: Seneca

quote: “I shall never be ashamed of citing a bad author if the line is good.”
author: seneca

quote: “Only time can heal what reason cannot.”
author: Seneca

quote: “If you live in harmony with nature you will never be poor; if you live according what others think, you will never be rich.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Timendi causa est nescire - Ignorance is the cause of fear.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Enjoy present pleasures in such a way as not to injure future ones.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.”
author: Seneca

quote: “As long as you live, keep learning how to live.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Life is like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.”
author: Seneca

quote: “People are frugal in guarding their personal property; but as soon as it comes to squandering time they are most wasteful of the one thing in which it is right to be stingy.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Wealth is the slave of a wise man. The master of a fool ”
author: Seneca

quote: “The sun also shines on the wicked.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Often a very old man has no other proof of his long life than his age.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Leisure without books is death, and burial of a man alive.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “A sword never kills anybody; it is a tool in the killer's hand.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Life is long if you know how to use it.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Nothing is more honorable than a grateful heart.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “We learn not in the school, but in life.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “There is no genius without a touch of madness.”
author: Seneca

quote: “While we wait for life, life passes”
author: Seneca

quote: “A gift consists not in what is done or given, but in the intention of the giver or doer.”
author: Seneca

quote: “But life is very short and anxious for those who forget the past, neglect the present, and fear the future.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “To wish to be well is a part of becoming well.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Withdraw into yourself, as far as you can. Associate with those who will make a better man of you. Welcome those whom you yourself can improve. The process is mutual; for men learn while they teach.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Fire tests gold, suffering tests brave men.”
author: Seneca

quote: “errare humanum est, sed perseverare diabolicum: 'to err is human, but to persist (in the mistake) is diabolical.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “We should every night call ourselves to an account; What infirmity have I mastered today? What passions opposed? What temptation resisted? What virtue acquired? Our vices will abort of themselves if they be brought every day to the shrift.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “I am not born for one corner; the whole world is my native land.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “It does not matter how many books you have, but how good the books are which you have.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “It's not because things are difficult that we dare not venture. It's because we dare not venture that they are difficult.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “He who spares the wicked injures the good.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is difficult to bring people to goodness with lessons, but it is easy to do so by example.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is more civilized to make fun of life than to bewail it.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Whatever can happen at any time can happen today.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Of this one thing make sure against your dying day - that your faults die before you do.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “To win true freeedom you must be a slave to philosophy.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “He who has injured thee was either stronger or weaker than thee. If weaker, spare him; if stronger, spare thyself.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The part of life we really live is small.' For all the rest of existence is not life, but merely time.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “There is no enjoying the possession of anything valuable unless one has someone to share it with”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “No man is more unhappy than he who never faces adversity. For he is not permitted to prove himself”
author: Seneca

quote: “Auditur et altera pars. (The other side shall be heard as well.)”
author: Seneca

quote: “No man is crushed by misfortune unless he has first been deceived by prosperity”
author: Seneca

quote: “True happiness is to understand our duties toward God and man; to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence on the future; not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears, but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is abundantly sufficient.”
author: Seneca

quote: “To be always fortunate, and to pass through life with a soul that has never known sorrow, is to be ignorant of one half of nature.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Beyond all things is the sea”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is quality rather than quantity that matters.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The best ideas are common property”
author: Seneca

quote: “But when you are looking on anyone as a friend when you do not trust him as you trust yourself, you are making a grave mistake, and have failed to grasp sufficiently the full force of true friendship.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It takes the whole of life to learn how to live, and -what will perhaps make you wonder more - it takes the whole of life to learn how to die.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “For many men, the acquisition of wealth does not end their troubles, it only changes them”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Ignis aurum probat, miseria fortes viros.Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men.”
author: Seneca

quote: “we cease to be so angry once we cease to be so hopeful”
author: Seneca

quote: “What is harder than rock? What is softer than water? Yet hard rocks are hollowed out by soft water?”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “The willing, Destiny guides them. The unwilling, Destiny drags them.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The difficulty comes from our lack of confidence.”
author: Seneca

quote: “There are more things, Lucilius, likely to frighten us than there are to crush us; we suffer more often in imagination than in reality.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Everyone prefers belief to the exercise of judgement.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The final hour when we cease to exist does not itself bring death; it merely of itself completes the death-process. We reach death at that moment, but we have been a long time on the way.”
author: Seneca

quote: “If we could be satisfied with anything, we should have been satisfied long ago.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Light griefs are loquacious, but the great are dumb.”
author: Seneca

quote: “What really ruins our character is the fact that none of us looks back over his life.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Of all people only those are at leisure who make time for philosophy, only those are really alive. For they not only keep a good watch over their own lifetimes, but they annex every age to theirs.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for crisis.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Gold tests with fire, woman with gold, man with woman”
author: Seneca

quote: “It's not that we have little time, but more that we waste a good deal of it.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare, it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “I have learned to be a friend to myself Great improvement this indeed Such a one can never be said to be alone for know that he who is a friend to himself is a friend to all mankind”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “When a person spends all his time in foreign travel, he ends by having many acquaintances, but no friends.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “A woman is not beautiful when her ankle or arm wins compliments, but when her total appearance diverts admiration from the individual parts of her body.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “It is of course better to know useless things than to know nothing.”
author: Seneca the Elder

quote: “Let us say what we feel, and feel what we say; let speech harmonize with life.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Men do not care how nobly they live, but only for how long, although it is within the reach of every man to live nobly, but within no man’s power to live long.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Can you no longer see a road to freedom? It's right in front of you. You need only turn over your wrists.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Each day acquire something that will fortify you against poverty, against death, indeed against other misfortunes as well; and after you have run over many thoughts, select one to be thoroughly digested that day.”
author: Seneca

quote: “We are mad, not only individually but nationally. We check manslaughter and isolated murders, but what of war and the much-vaunted crime of slaughtering whole peoples?”
author: Seneca

quote: “Drunkenness is nothing but voluntary madness”
author: Seneca

quote: “Brave men rejoice in adversity, just as brave soldiers triumph in war.”
author: Seneca

quote: “For the only safe harbour in this life's tossing, troubled sea is to refuse to be bothered about what the future will bring and to stand ready and confident, squaring the breast to take without skulking or flinching whatever fortune hurls at us.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “People who know no self-restraint lead stormy and disordered lives, passing their time in a state of fear commensurate with the injuries they do to others, never able to relax.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Hold fast, then, to this sound and wholesome rule of life - that you indulge the body only so far as is needful for good health. The body should be treated more rigorously, that it may not be disobedient to the mind.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Fire tests gold and adversity tests the brave.”
author: Seneca

quote: “All this hurrying from place to place won’t bring you any relief, for you’re traveling in the company of your own emotions, followed by your troubles all the way.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “We are members of one great body, planted by nature…. We must consider that we were born for the good of the whole”
author: Seneca

quote: “Throw aside all hindrances and give up your time to attaining a sound mind”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is a great thing to know the season for speech and the season for silence”
author: Seneca

quote: “And what’s so bad about your being deprived of that?... All things seem unbearable to people who have become spoilt, who have become soft through a life of luxury, ailing more in the mind than they ever are in the body.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Fidelity purchased with money, money can destroy.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Expecting is the greatest impediment to living. In anticipation of tomorrow, it loses today.”
author: Seneca the Younger

quote: “While we are postponing, life speeds by”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “One hand washes the other.(Manus Manum Lavat)”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “I judge you unfortunate because you have never lived through misfortune. You have passed through life without an opponent—no one can ever know what you are capable of, not even you.”
author: Seneca

quote: “As it is with a play, so it is with life - what matters is not how long the acting lasts, but how good it is.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “So you must match time’s swiftness with your speed in using it, and you must drink quickly as though from a rapid stream that will not always flow.”
author: Seneca

quote: “We must indulge the mind and from time to time allow it the leisure which is its food and strength.”
author: Seneca

quote: “I know that these mental disturbances of mine are not dangerous and give no promise of a storm; to express what I complain of in apt metaphor, I am distressed, not by a tempest, but by sea-sickness. ”
author: Seneca

quote: “Because thou writest me often, I thank thee ... Never do I receive a letter from thee, but immediately we are together.”
author: Seneca

quote: “I will storm the gods, and shake the universe.”
author: Seneca

quote: “I am not a ‘wise man,’ nor . . . shall I ever be. And so require not from me that I should be equal to the best, but that I should be better than the wicked. It is enough for me if every day I reduce the number of my vices, and blame my mistakes.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Conversation has a kind of charm about it, an insinuating and insidious something that elicits secrets just like love or liquor.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “distringit librorum multitudo (the abundance of books is distraction)”
author: Seneca

quote: “Men do not care how nobly they live, but only how long, although it is within the reach of every man to live nobly, but within no man's power to live long.”
author: Seneca

quote: “the more a mind takes in the more it expands.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Lat, urbes constituit aetas: hora dissolvit: momento fit cinis: diu sylva. An age builds up cities: an hour destroys them. In a moment the ashes are made, but a forest is a long time growing.”
author: Seneca

quote: “When a mind is impressionable and has none too firm a hold on what is right, it must be rescued from the crowd: it is so easy for it to go over to the majority.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Hurry up and live.”
author: Seneca

quote: “You ask what is the proper limit to a person's wealth? First, having what is essential, and second, having what is enough.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “All things that are still to come lie in uncertainty; live straightway!”
author: Seneca

quote: “Just as with storytelling, so with life: it's important how well it is done, not how long.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Men whose spirit has grown arrogant from the great favor of fortune have this most serious fault—those whom they have injured they also hate.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “There are more things to alarm us than to harm us, and we suffer more often in apprehension than reality.”
author: Seneca

quote: “In the meantime, cling tooth and nail to the following rule: not to give in to adversity, not to trust prosperity, and always take full note of fortune’s habit of behaving just as she pleases.”
author: Seneca

quote: “O how many noble deeds of women are lost in obscurity!”
author: Seneca

quote: “Reason shows us there is nothing either good or bad but thinking makes it so.”
author: Seneca

quote: “While the fates permit, live happily; life speeds on with hurried step, and with winged days the wheel of the headlong year is turned.”
author: Seneca

quote: “There is no favorable wind for the sailor who doesn’t know where to go”
author: Seneca

quote: “Religion is regarded by the ignorant as true, by the wise as false, and by the rulers as useful.”
author: Seneca

quote: “No man’s good by accident. Virtue has to be learnt.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Ab honesto virum bonum nihil deterret. (Nothing deters a good man from doing what is honorable.)-A Wrinkle in Time”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “The fool, with all his other faults, has this also, he is always getting ready to live.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Words need to be sown like seeds. No matter how tiny a seed may be, when in lands in the right sort of ground it unfolds its strength and from being minute expands and grows to a massive size.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “You must set your hands to tasks which you can finish or at least hope to finish, and avoid those which get bigger as you proceed and do not cease where you had intended.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Believe me, it is the sign of a great man, and one who is above human error, not to allow his time to be frittered away: he has the longest possible life simply because whatever time was available he devoted entirely to himself.”
author: Seneca

quote: “To expect punishment is to suffer it; and to earn it is to expect it.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “So it is: we are not given a short life but we make it short, and we are not Ill-supplied but wasteful of it.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is in no man's power to have whatever he wants, but he has it in his power not to wish for what he hasn't got, and cheerfully make the most of the things that do come his way.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Life is slavery if the courage to die is absent.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “When a man does not know what harbor he is making for, no wind is the right wind.”
author: Seneca

quote: “A physician is not angry at the intemperance of a mad patient; nor does he take it ill to be railed at by a man in a fever. Just so should a wise man treat all mankind, as a physician does his patient; and looking upon them only as sick and extravagant.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “No matter how many men you kill, you can't kill your successor.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The bravest sight in the world is to see a great man struggling against adversity.”
author: Seneca

quote: “How many are quite unworthy to see the light, and yet the day dawns.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Set aside a certain number of days, during which you shall be content with the scantiest and cheapest fare, with course and rough dress, saying to yourself the while: 'Is this the condition that I feared?”
author: Seneca

quote: “Envy of other people shows how they are unhappy. Their continual attention to others behavior shows how they are boring.”
author: Seneca

quote: “vices have to be crushed rather than picked at.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Most men ebb and flow in wretchedness between the fear of death and the hardships of life; they are unwilling to live, and yet they do not know how to die. ”
author: Seneca

quote: “A guilty person sometimes has the luck to escape detection, but never to feel sure of it.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “It's not years nor days, but the mind, that determines that we've lived enough.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Nothing is ours, except time.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The geat blessing of mankind are within us and within our reach; but we shut our eyes, and like people in the dark, we fall foul upon the very thing we search for, without finding it.”
author: Seneca

quote: “If wisdom were offered me on the one condition that I should keep it shut away and not divulge it to anyone, I should reject it. There is no enjoying the possession of anything valuable unless one has someone to share it with.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Preserve a sense of proportion in your attitude to everything that pleases you, and make the most of them while they are at their best.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “There are more things likely to frighten us than there are to crush us; we suffer more in our imagination than in reality.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Every day as it comes should be welcomed and reduced forthwith into our own possession as if it were the finest day imaginable. What flies past has to be seized at.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Nothing, Lucilius, is ours, except time. We were entrusted by nature with the ownership of this single thing, so fleeting and slippery that anyone who will can oust us from possession.”
author: Seneca

quote: “If you live according to nature, you will never be poor; if you live according to opinion, you will never be rich.”
author: Seneca

quote: “For manliness gains much strength by being challenged”
author: Seneca

quote: “For Fate/ The willing leads, the unwilling drags along.”
author: Seneca

quote: “No man can be sane who searches for what will injure him in place of what is best.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “How can you wonder your travels do you no good, when you carry yourself around with you? You are saddled with the very thing that drove you away.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Nūllum magnum ingenium sine mixtūrā dēmentiae fuitNo great talent without an element of madness”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “It is not what you endure that matters, but how you endure it.”
author: Seneca

quote: “A wise man never asks what another man serves, for only his actions will speak the truth.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by the rulers as useful”
author: Seneca the Younger

quote: “Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by the rulers as useful”
author: Seneca the Younger

quote: “Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men.”
author: Seneca

quote: “But only philosophy will wake us; only philosophy will shake us out of that heavy sleep. Devote yourself entirely to her. You're worthy of her, she's worthy of you-fall into each other's arms. Say a firm, plain no to every other occupation.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “It is not that we have a short time to live but that we waste a lot of it.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Most powerful is he who has himself in his power.”
author: Lucius Amaeus Seneca

quote: “Only a mind that is deeply stirred can utter something noble and beyond the power of others.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Do not run hither and thither and distract yourself by changing your abode; for such restlessness is the sign of a disordered spirit.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “I never spend a day in idleness; I appropriate even a part of the night for study. I do not allow time for sleep but yield to it when I must, and when my eyes are wearied with waking and ready to fall shut, I keep them at their task.”
author: Seneca

quote: “the time of the actual enjoyment is short and swift, and made much shorter through their own fault. For they dash from one pleasure to another and cannot stay steady in one desire.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is a denial of justice not to stretch out a helping hand to the fallen; that is the common right of humanity.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The shortest route to wealth is the contempt of wealth.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Learning how to live takes a whole life, and, which may surprise you more, it takes a whole life to learn how to die.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Diligentia maximum etiam mediocris ingeni subsidium - Diligence is a very great help even to a mediocre intelligence.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The man who fears death will never do anything worthy of a man who is alive.”
author: Seneca

quote: “We are in the habit of saying that it was not in our power to choose the parents who were allotted to us, that they were given to us by chance. But we can choose whose children we would like to be.”
author: Seneca

quote: “For love of bustle is not industry, —it is only the restlessness of a hunted mind.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is the quality of a great soul to scorn great things and to prefer that which is ordinary rather than that which is too great.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “As often as I have been amongst men, I have returned less a man.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Why do I not rather seek some real good - one which I could feel, not one which I could display? These things that draw the eyes of men, before which they halt, which they show to one another in wonder, outwardly glitter, but are worthless within.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Non scholae sed vitae discimus.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is our conscience, not our pride, that has put doorkeepers at our doors.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Bonis nocet, qui malis parcit. He harms the good (people) who spares the evil.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Life is divided into three parts: what was, what is and what shall be. Of these three periods, the present is short, the future is doubtful and the past alone is certain.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Happy is the man who can make others better, not merely when he is in their company, but even when he is in their thoughts!”
author: Seneca

quote: “If you have nothing to stir you up and rouse you to action, nothing which will test your resolution by its threats and hostilities; if you recline in unshaken comfort, it is not tranquillity; it is merely a flat calm.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Soft living imposes on us the penalty of debility; we cease to be able to do the things we've long been grudging about doing.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “Desultory reading is delightful, but to be beneficial, our reading must be carefully directed.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “However much you possess there's someone else who has more, and you'll be fancying yourself to be short of things you need to exact extent to which you lag behind him.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “What difference does it make, after all, what your position in life is if you dislike it yourself?”
author: Seneca

quote: “True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The happy life is a life that is in harmony with its own nature.”
author: Seneca

quote: “...there is nothing the wise man does reluctantly. He escapes necessity because he wills what necessity is going to force on him.”
author: Seneca

quote: “All those who call you to themselves draw you away from yourself.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is uncertain where Death will await you;there expect it everywhere.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “the mind is never right but when it is at peace with itself”
author: lucius annaues seneca

quote: “If i had not been admitted to these studies it would not have been worth while to have been born.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “There will always be causes for anxiety, whether due to prosperity or to wretchedness. Life will be driven on through a succession of preoccupations: we shall always long for leisure, but never enjoy it.”
author: Seneca the Younger

quote: “Just as great and princely wealth is scattered in a moment when it comes into the hands of a bad owner, while wealth however limited, if it is entrusted to a good guardian, increases by use, so our life is amply long for him who orders it properly.”
author: Seneca the Younger

quote: “There is no great genius without some touch of madness.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Just as great and princely wealth is scattered in a moment when it comes into the hands of a bad owner, while wealth however limited, if it is entrusted to a good guardian, increases by use, so our life is amply long for him who orders it properly.”
author: Seneca the Younger

quote: “My anger is more likely to do me more harm than your wrong.”
author: Seneca

quote: “The primary indication, to my thinking, of a well-ordered mind is a man's ability to remain in one place and linger in his own company.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Still, you must especially avoid those who are gloomy and always lamenting, and who grasp at every pretext for complaint. Though a man's loyalty and kindness may not be in doubt, a companion who is agitated and groaning about everything is an enemy to peace of mind.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Everlasting misfortune does have one blessing, that it ends up by toughening those whom it constantly afflicts.”
author: Seneca

quote: “If you look on wealth as a thing to be valued your imaginary poverty will cause you torment.”
author: Seneca

quote: “philosophy teaches us to act, not to speak;”
author: Seneca

quote: “I shall never be ashamed to go to a bad author for a good quotation.”
author: Seneca

quote: “It is sweet to draw the world down with you when you are perishing.”
author: Seneca

quote: “No good thing renders its possessor happy, unless his mind is reconciled to the possibility of loss; nothing, however, is lost with less discomfort than that which, when lost, cannot be missed.”
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: “A family formed by crime must be broken by more crime.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Excellence withers without an adversary.”
author: Seneca

quote: “Your greatest difficulty is with yourself; for you are your own stumbling-block. You do not know what you want. You are better at approving the right course than at following it out. You see where the true happiness lies, but you have not the courage to attain it.”
author: Seneca

quote: “I imagine many people could have achieved wisdom if they had not imagined they had already achieved it, if they had not dissembled about some of their own characteristics and turned a blind eye to others.”
author: Seneca
