quote: “Don’t waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it.”
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: “Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something.”
author: William Goldman

quote: “It’s only after you’ve stepped outside your comfort zone that you begin to change, grow, and transform.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Even if you cannot change all the people around you, you can change the people you choose to be around. Life is too short to waste your time on people who don’t respect, appreciate, and value you. Spend your life with people who make you smile, laugh, and feel loved.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “More smiling, less worrying. More compassion, less judgment. More blessed, less stressed. More love, less hate.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!”
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: “Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect.”
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: “Nobody likes being alone that much. I don't go out of my way to make friends, that's all. It just leads to disappointment. ”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The truth is, unless you let go, unless you forgive yourself, unless you forgive the situation, unless you realize that the situation is over, you cannot move forward.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being.”
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: “How many slams in an old screen door? Depends how loud you shut it. How many slices in a bread? Depends how thin you cut it. How much good inside a day? Depends how good you live 'em. How much love inside a friend? Depends how much you give 'em.”
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: “Pursue what catches your heart, not what catches your eyes.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The things you do for yourself are gone when you are gone, but the things you do for others remain as your legacy.”
author: Kalu Ndukwe Kalu

quote: “Keep GoingYour hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “If cats looked like frogs we'd realize what nasty, cruel little bastards they are. Style. That's what people remember.”
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: “Life is for the living.Death is for the dead.Let life be like music. And death a note unsaid.”
author: Langston Hughes

quote: “Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you.”
author: Stephanie Klein

quote: “Some people have lives; some people have music.”
author: John Green

quote: “The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him.”
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: “People aren't born good or bad. Maybe they're born with tendencies either way, but its the way you live your life that matters.”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: “A woman has to live her life, or live to repent not having lived it.”
author: D.H. Lawrence

quote: “Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?”
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: “Make improvements, not excuses. Seek respect, not attention.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.”
author: Nicolas Chamfort

quote: “Learn to light a candle in the darkest moments of someone’s life. Be the light that helps others see; it is what gives life its deepest significance.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited.”
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: “If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain.”
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: “Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “If you want to forget something or someone, never hate it, or never hate him/her. Everything and everyone that you hate is engraved upon your heart; if you want to let go of something, if you want to forget, you cannot hate.”
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: “Treat everyone with politeness and kindness, not because they are nice, but because you are.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The more I see, the less I know for sure.”
author: John Lennon

quote: “Be grateful for what you already have while you pursue your goals. If you aren’t grateful for what you already have, what makes you think you would be happy with more.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “I go to seek a Great Perhaps.”
author: François Rabelais

quote: “Believe in Your HeartBelieve in your heart that you're meant to live a life full of passion, purpose, magic and miracles.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Why didn't I learn to treat everything like it was the last time. My greatest regret was how much I believed in the future.”
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: “No matter how much suffering you went through, you never wanted to let go of those memories.”
author: haruki murakami

quote: “Life is to be enjoyed, not endured”
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: “Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “This is your life and its ending one moment at a time.”
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: “No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein.”
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quote: “That was the thing. You never got used to it, the idea of someone being gone. Just when you think it's reconciled, accepted, someone points it out to you, and it just hits you all over again, that shocking.”
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: “Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Top 15 Things Money Can’t BuyTime. Happiness. Inner Peace. Integrity. Love. Character. Manners. Health. Respect. Morals. Trust. Patience. Class. Common sense. Dignity.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Don't take life too seriously. Punch it in the face when it needs a good hit. Laugh at it.”
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: “If I should ever die, God forbid, let this be my epitaph:THE ONLY PROOF HE NEEDEDFOR THE EXISTENCE OF GODWAS MUSIC”
author: kurt vonnegut

quote: “Acts of Kindness:A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Even death has a heart.”
author: Markus Zusak

quote: “Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.”
author: Anais Nin

quote: “Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be. I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape.”
author: Charles Dickens

quote: “Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live.”
author: Natalie Babbitt

quote: “Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.”
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: “Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.”
author: Mark Twain

quote: “Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?”
author: Audrey Niffenegger

quote: “The past has no power over the present moment.”
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: “Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.”
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: “To say goodbye is to die a little.”
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: “It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty.”
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: “The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.”
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: “That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet.”
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: “Life, he realize, was much like a song. In the beginning there is mystery, in the end there is confirmation, but it's in the middle where all the emotion resides to make the whole thing worthwhile.”
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: “Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.”
author: Sun Tzu

quote: “You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved.”
author: Stewart O'Nan

quote: “We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.”
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: “Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.”
author: Lao Tzu

quote: “If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud.”
author: Émile Zola

quote: “Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind.”
author: Jeffrey Eugenides

quote: “A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.”
author: Lao Tzu

quote: “I've got nothing to do today but smile.”
author: Simon and Garfunkel

quote: “Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books.”
author: Julian Barnes

quote: “Was it hard?" I ask.Letting go?"Not as hard as holding on to something that wasn't real.”
author: Lisa Schroeder

quote: “A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.”
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: “You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: “You will find that it is necessary to let things go; simply for the reason that they are heavy. So let them go, let go of them. I tie no weights to my ankles.”
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: “Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.”
author: Markus Zusak

quote: “A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that.”
author: Douglas Adams

quote: “You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past.”
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: “I meant," said Ipslore bitterly, "what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?"Death thought about it.CATS, he said eventually. CATS ARE NICE.”
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: “Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.”
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: “Once you had put the pieces back together, even though you may look intact, you were never quite the same as you'd been before the fall.”
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: “You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.”
author: Sharon Salzberg

quote: “No one knows for certain how much impact they have on the lives of other people. Oftentimes, we have no clue. Yet we push it just the same.”
author: Jay Asher

quote: “Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I’ve taken for granted.”
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: “We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “In a time of destruction, create something.”
author: Maxine Hong Kingston

quote: “You can have it all. Just not all at once.”
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: “There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.”
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: “The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.”
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: “If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.”
author: Frank Zappa

quote: “It's all in the view. That's what I mean about forever, too. For any one of us our forever could end in an hour, or a hundred years from now. You never know for sure, so you'd better make every second count.”
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: “When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.”
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: “Time doesn’t heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.”
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quote: “Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “The saddest people I've ever met in life are the ones who don't care deeply about anything at all. Passion and satisfaction go hand in hand, and without them, any happiness is only temporary, because there's nothing to make it last.”
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: “All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.”
author: Mitch Albom

quote: “Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky.”
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: “One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.”
author: A.A. Milne

quote: “Whenever you read a cancer booklet or website or whatever, they always list depression among the side effects of cancer. But, in fact, depression is not a side effect of cancer. Depression is a side effect of dying.”
author: John Green

quote: “The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.”
author: Stephanie Perkins

quote: “To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.”
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: “Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on. I hope you never have to think about anything as much as I think about you.”
author: jonathan safran foer

quote: “Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it’s all an experience.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.”
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: “There are two means of refuge from the misery of life — music and cats.”
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: “You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.”
author: Peter Shaffer

quote: “please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.”
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: “I like flaws. I think they make things interesting.”
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: “Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.”
author: Harvey Fierstein

quote: “If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.”
author: Charles Darwin

quote: “Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.”
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: “I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.”
author: Ayn Rand

quote: “Better to die fighting for freedom then be a prisoner all the days of your life.”
author: Bob Marley

quote: “You are not rich until you have a rich heart.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.”
author: Yann Martel

quote: “I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them. ”
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: “A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.”
author: Charles Darwin

quote: “There's nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be...”
author: John Lennon

quote: “They say I'm old-fashioned, and live in the past, but sometimes I think progress progresses too fast!”
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: “Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.”
author: Marie Curie

quote: “Even After All this timeThe Sun never says to the Earth,"You owe me."LookWhat happensWith a love like that,It lights the whole sky.”
author: Hafiz

quote: “Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.”
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: “I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.”
author: Bill Watterson

quote: “If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: “If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution.”
author: Jasper Fforde

quote: “Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.”
author: Helen Keller

quote: “But how could you live and have no story to tell?”
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: “Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?”
author: John Keats

quote: “When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?”
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: “I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.”
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: “Tiger got to hunt, bird got to fly;Man got to sit and wonder 'why, why, why?'Tiger got to sleep, bird got to land;Man got to tell himself he understand.”
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: “Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.”
author: Anais Nin

quote: “He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.”
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: “Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “It is not the length of life, but the depth.”
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: “Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.”
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: “You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.”
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: “Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity. The greatest problem with communication is we don’t listen to understand. We listen to reply. When we listen with curiosity, we don’t listen with the intent to reply. We listen for what’s behind the words.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster.”
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: “Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.”
author: Anais Nin

quote: “Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!”
author: Mark A. Cooper

quote: “When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.”
author: John Green

quote: “Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.”
author: Woody Allen

quote: “Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand”
author: Hayley Williams

quote: “So it’s true, when all is said and done, grief is the price we pay for love.”
author: E.A. Bucchianeri

quote: “The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.”
author: Ben Okri

quote: “I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....”
author: Erica Jong

quote: “Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: “Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.”
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: “What a strange thing!to be alivebeneath cherry blossoms.”
author: Kobayashi Issa

quote: “If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts; but if he will be content to begin with doubts, he shall end in certainties.”
author: Francis Bacon

quote: “It was only a sunny smile, and little it cost in the giving, but like morning light it scattered the night and made the day worth living.”
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: “Despite your best efforts, people are going to be hurt when it's time for them to be hurt.”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “The Bhagavad Gita--that ancient Indian Yogic text--says that it is better to live your own destiny imperfectly than to live an imitation of somebody else's life with perfection.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: “sometimes you don't need a goal in life, you don't need to know the big picture. you just need to know what you're going to do next!”
author: Sophie Kinsella

quote: “I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure.”
author: Mae West

quote: “Death is Peaceful, Life is Harder”
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: “It’s your life; you don’t need someone’s permission to live the life you want. Be brave to live from your heart.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life.”
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: “There are times to stay put, and what you want will come to you, and there are times to go out into the world and find such a thing for yourself.”
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: “I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day, and I believe in miracles”
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: “Sometimes I lie awake at night, and I ask, 'Where have I gone wrong'.Then a voice says to me, 'This is going to take more than one night.”
author: Charlie Schultz

quote: “Life is to be lived, not controlled; and humanity is won by continuing to play in face of certain defeat.”
author: Ralph Ellison

quote: “Ordinary life is pretty complex stuff.”
author: Harvey Pekar

quote: “Face your life, its pain, its pleasure, leave no path untaken.”
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: “Life has become immeasurably better since I have been forced to stop taking it seriously.”
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: “The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you've got it made.”
author: Groucho Marx

quote: “I felt once more how simple and frugal a thing is happiness: a glass of wine, a roast chestnut, a wretched little brazier, the sound of the sea. Nothing else.”
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quote: “The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “After all, tomorrow is another day!”
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: “I’ve known people that the world has thrown everything at to discourage them...to break their spirit. And yet something about them retains a dignity. They face life and don’t ask quarters.”
author: Horton Foote

quote: “The real things haven't changed. It is still best to be honest and truthful; to make the most of what we have; to be happy with simple pleasures; and have courage when things go wrong.”
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

quote: “My only advice is to stay aware, listen carefully, and yell for help if you need it.”
author: Judy Blume

quote: “When I look in the mirror, I know I’m looking at someone who isn’t sure she deserves to be loved at all.”
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: “I just need to know that someone out there listens and understands and doesn't try to sleep with someone even if they could have. I need to know these people exist.”
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: “Be Brave and Take Risks: You need to have faith in yourself. Be brave and take risks. You don't have to have it all figured out to move forward.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Life isn't fair, it's just fairer than death, that's all.”
author: William Goldman

quote: “Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Do Not Lie to Yourself We have to be honest about what we want and take risks rather than lie to ourselves and make excuses to stay in our comfort zone.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “No sympathy for the devil; keep that in mind. Buy the ticket, take the ride...and if it occasionally gets a little heavier than what you had in mind, well...maybe chalk it up to forced consciousness expansion: Tune in, freak out, get beaten.”
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: “She burned too bright for this world.”
author: Emily Bronte

quote: “Surround Yourself with People Who Believe in Your Dreams:Surround yourself with people who believe in your dreams, encourage your ideas, support your ambitions, and bring out the best in you.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Sometimes the right thing feels all wrong until it is over and done with.”
author: Alice Hoffman

quote: “Unexpected intrusions of beauty. This is what life is.”
author: Saul Bellow

quote: “We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change.”
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: “I live in my own little world. But its ok, they know me here.”
author: Lauren Myracle

quote: “Death is not the opposite of life, but a part of it.”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “I am incapable of conceiving infinity, and yet I do not accept finity. I want this adventure that is the context of my life to go on without end.”
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: “Every one of us is losing something precious to us. Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back again. That’s part of what it means to be alive.”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “Living is Easy with Eyes Closed.”
author: John Lennon

quote: “Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.”
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: “No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.”
author: Heraclitus

quote: “Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse.”
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: “Life seems sometimes like nothing more than a series of losses, from beginning to end. That's the given. How you respond to those losses, what you make of what's left, that's the part you have to make up as you go.”
author: Katharine Weber

quote: “Sometimes life knocks you on your ass... get up, get up, get up!!! Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “What makes big boobs and perkiness so attractive to boys? I mean, really. Two round, mounds of fat and a fake smile. Yeah, winning attributes.”
author: Gena Showalter

quote: “We are all the pieces of what we remember. We hold in ourselves the hopes and fears of those who love us. As long as there is love and memory, there is no true loss.”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: “Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome.”
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: “Do what you love, love what you do, and with all your heart give yourself to it.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Life is worth living as long as there's a laugh in it.”
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

quote: “The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense.”
author: Tom Clancy

quote: “The meaning of life is that it stops.”
author: Franz Kafka

quote: “Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others.”
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: “We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand.”
author: Randy Pausch

quote: “When you do the right thing, you get the feeling of peace and serenity associated with it. Do it again and again.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “If you care about something you have to protect it – If you’re lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it.”
author: John Irving

quote: “Don't be afraid to be confused. Try to remain permanently confused. Anything is possible. Stay open, forever, so open it hurts, and then open up some more, until the day you die, world without end, amen.”
author: George Saunders

quote: “That's what people do who love you. They put their arms around you and love you when you're not so lovable.”
author: Deb Caletti

quote: “Once you realize you deserve a bright future, letting go of your dark past is the best choice you will ever make.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “At the time, my life just seemed too complete, and maybe we have to break everything to make something better out of ourselves.”
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: “Now and then it's good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.”
author: Guillaume Apollinaire

quote: “There is no good and evil, there is only power and those too weak to seek it.”
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: “The right thing and the easy thing are never the same.”
author: Kami Garcia

quote: “What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness.”
author: John Steinbeck

quote: “No matter how long you train someone to be brave, you never know if they are or not until something real happens.”
author: Veronica Roth

quote: “In everybody’s life there’s a point of no return. And in a very few cases, a point where you can’t go forward anymore. And when we reach that point, all we can do is quietly accept the fact. That’s how we survive.”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “I can choose either to be a victim of the world or an adventurer in search of treasure. It's all a question of how I view my life.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning.”
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: “I'd learned that some things are best kept secret.”
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: “How would your life be different if…You stopped making negative judgmental assumptions about people you encounter? Let today be the day…You look for the good in everyone you meet and respect their journey.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Don't be afraid of enemies who attack you. Be afraid of the friends who flatter you.”
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: “Sometimes you have to kind of die inside in order to rise from your own ashes and believe in yourself and love yourself to become a new person.”
author: gerard way

quote: “Whoever saves one life, saves the world entire.”
author: Thomas Keneally

quote: “People make mistakes in life through believing too much, but they have a damned dull time if they believe too little.”
author: James Hilton

quote: “There’s no such thing as ruining your life. Life’s a pretty resilient thing, it turns out.”
author: Sophie Kinsella

quote: “why are trying so hard to fit in, when you're born to stand out”
author: Oliver James

quote: “If you believe very strongly in something, stand up and fight for it.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The outer world is a reflection of the inner world. Other people’s perception of you is a reflection of them; your response to them is an awareness of you.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Let me be, was all I wanted. Be what I am, no matter how I am.”
author: Henry Miller

quote: “A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live.”
author: Lao Tzu

quote: “A pain stabbed my heart, as it did every time I saw a girl I loved who was going the opposite direction in this too-big world.”
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: “The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.”
author: Mark Twain

quote: “I think I've discovered the secret of life -- you just hang around until you get used to it.”
author: Charles Schultz

quote: “It's never too late to change your life for the better. You don't have to take huge steps to change your life. Making even the smallest changes to your daily routine can make a big difference to your life.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “There is not a particle of life which does not bear poetry within it”
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: “You can search throughout the entire universe for someone who is more deserving of your love and affection than you are yourself, and that person is not to be found anywhere. You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.”
author: Sharon Salzberg

quote: “Almost nobody dances sober, unless they happen to be insane.”
author: Howard Phillips Lovecraft

quote: “Always remember people who have helped you along the way, and don’t forget to lift someone up.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “There is some kind of a sweet innocence in being human- in not having to be just happy or just sad- in the nature of being able to be both broken and whole, at the same time.”
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: “In the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: “Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.”
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: “There is nothing more rare, nor more beautiful, than a woman being unapologetically herself; comfortable in her perfect imperfection. To me, that is the true essence of beauty.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Focus on your strengths, not your weaknesses.Focus on your character, not your reputation.Focus on your blessings, not your misfortunes.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The only person who can pull me down is myself, and I'm not going to let myself pull me down anymore.”
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: “One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.”
author: Antonio Porchia

quote: “This must be Thursday,' said Arthur to himself, sinking low over his beer. 'I never could get the hang of Thursdays.”
author: Douglas Adams

quote: “There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.”
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: “The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.”
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: “I don’t live in either my past or my future. I’m interested only in the present. If you can concentrate always on the present, you’ll be a happy man. Life will be a party for you, a grand festival, because life is the moment we’re living now.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.”
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: “The thing about getting older is that you don't need everything to be possible any more, you just need things to be certain.”
author: Monica Ali

quote: “How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours.”
author: Wayne W. Dyer

quote: “If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.”
author: Woody Allen

quote: “The trouble with being in the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.”
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: “I think that we are like stars. Something happens to burst us open; but when we burst open and think we are dying; we’re actually turning into a supernova. And then when we look at ourselves again, we see that we’re suddenly more beautiful than we ever were before!”
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: “The biggest wall you have to climb is the one you build in your mind: Never let your mind talk you out of your dreams, trick you into giving up. Never let your mind become the greatest obstacle to success. To get your mind on the right track, the rest will follow.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The problem with people is they forget that most of the time it's the small things that count.”
author: Jennifer Niven

quote: “Accept what life offers you and try to drink from every cup. All wines should be tasted; some should only be sipped, but with others, drink the whole bottle.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “Why do they always teach us that it's easy and evil to do what we want and that we need discipline to restrain ourselves? It's the hardest thing in the world--to do what we want. And it takes the greatest kind of courage. I mean, what we really want.”
author: Ayn Rand

quote: “I live my life in widening circles that reach out across the world.”
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: “Many people die at twenty five and aren't buried until they are seventy five.”
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: “Maturity is when you stop complaining and making excuses, and start making changes.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “When in a relationship, a real man doesn't make his woman jealous of others, he makes others jealous of his woman.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Never complain, never explain. Resist the temptation to defend yourself or make excuses.”
author: Brian Tracy

quote: “What's done is done. What's gone is gone. One of life's lessons is always moving on. It’s okay to look back to see how far you’ve come but keep moving forward.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Strong people have a strong sense of self-worth and self-awareness; they don’t need the approval of others.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Smile more. Smiling can make you and others happy.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The world is a tragedy to those who feel, but a comedy to those who think.”
author: Horace Walpole

quote: “That's what literature is. It's the people who went before us, tapping out messages from the past, from beyond the grave, trying to tell us about life and death! Listen to them!”
author: Connie Willis

quote: “I believe that words are strong, that they can overwhelm what we fear when fear seems more awful than life is good.”
author: Andrew Solomon

quote: “[H]iding how you really feel and trying to make everyone happy doesn't make you nice, it just makes you a liar.”
author: Jenny O'Connell

quote: “Develop an interest in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself.”
author: Henry Miller

quote: “I think prime numbers are like life. They are very logical but you could never work out the rules, even if you spent all your time thinking about them”
author: Mark Haddon

quote: “Sometimes all a person wants is an empathetic ear; all he or she needs is to talk it out. Just offering a listening ear and an understanding heart for his or her suffering can be a big comfort.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Do not despise your own place and hour. Every place is under the stars, every place is the center of the world.”
author: John Burroughs

quote: “Life, although it may only be an accumulation of anguish, is dear to me, and I will defend it.”
author: Mary Shelley

quote: “Sometimes the hardest part isn't letting go but rather learning to start over.”
author: Nicole Sobon

quote: “To be creative means to be in love with life. You can be creative only if you love life enough that you want to enhance its beauty, you want to bring a little more music to it, a little more poetry to it, a little more dance to it.”
author: Osho

quote: “When the going gets tough, put one foot in front of the other and just keep going. Don’t give up.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Everyone you meet is a part of your journey, but not all of them are meant to stay in your life. Some people are just passing through to bring you gifts; either they're blessings or lessons.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Don't ask for guarantees. And don't look to be saved in any one thing, person, machine, or library. Do your own bit of saving, and if you drown, at least die knowing you were heading for shore.”
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: “You're on Earth. There's no cure for that.”
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: “Is this thing safe?""Safe as life," Gansey replied.”
author: Maggie Stiefvater

quote: “Simplicity is the keynote of all true elegance.”
author: Coco Chanel

quote: “You must not ever stop being whimsical. And you must not, ever, give anyone else the responsibility for your life.”
author: Mary Oliver

quote: “Nothing ever happens like you imagine it will”
author: John Green

quote: “You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present.”
author: John Green

quote: “If there's a thing I've learned in my life it's to not be afraid of the responsibility that comes with caring for other people. What we do for love: those things endure. Even if the people you do them for don't”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: “Count your blessings, not your problems. Count your own blessings, not someone else's. Remember that jealousy is when you count someone else's blessings instead of your own.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Believe something and the Universe is on its way to being changed. Because you've changed, by believing. Once you've changed, other things start to follow. Isn't that the way it works?”
author: Diane Duane

quote: “Stop giving other people the power to control your happiness, your mind, and your life. If you don't take control of yourself and your own life, someone else is bound to try.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “People are like stained-glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.”
author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

quote: “Some of us get dipped in flat, some in satin, some in gloss...." He turned to me. "But every once in a while, you find someone who's iridescent, and when you do, nothing will ever compare.”
author: Wendelin Van Draanen

quote: “I believe there is another world waiting for us. A better world. And I'll be waiting for you there.”
author: David Mitchell

quote: “Sleep my little baby-ohSleep until you wakenWhen you wake you'll see the worldIf I'm not mistaken...Kiss a loverDance a measure,Find your nameAnd buried treasure...Face your lifeIts pain, Its pleasure,Leave no path untaken.”
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: “Pull up a chair. Take a taste. Come join us. Life is so endlessly delicious.”
author: Ruth Reichl

quote: “At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Life's as kind as you let it be.”
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: “I wonder why I don't go to bed and go to sleep. But then it would be tomorrow, so I decide that no matter how tired, no matter how incoherent I am, I can skip on hour more of sleep and live.”
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: “I envy people that know love. That have someone who takes them as they are.”
author: Jess C Scott

quote: “Learning to let go should be learned before learning to get. Life should be touched, not strangled. You’ve got to relax, let it happen at times, and at others move forward with it.”
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: “You've a good heart. Sometimes that's enough to see you safe wherever you go. But mostly, it's not.”
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: “Human life is but a series of footnotes to a vast obscure unfinished masterpiece”
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: “I can see how it might be possible for a man to look down upon the earth and be an atheist, but I cannot conceive how a man could look up into the heavens and say there is no God.”
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: “We could do it, you know.""What?""Leave the district. Run off. Live in the woods. You and I, we could make it.”
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: “We all make mistakes, have struggles, and even regret things in our past. But you are not your mistakes, you are not your struggles, and you are here NOW with the power to shape your day and your future.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass...It's about learning to dance in the rain.”
author: Vivian  Greene

quote: “The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware.”
author: Henry Miller

quote: “Who says life is fair, where is that written?”
author: William Goldman

quote: “Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being.”
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: “You cannot change what you are, only what you do.”
author: Philip Pullman

quote: “It all goes away. Eventually, everything goes away.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: “We leave something of ourselves behind when we leave a place, we stay there, even though we go away. And there are things in us that we can find again only by going back there.”
author: Pascal Mercier

quote: “Keep your best wishes, close to your heart and watch what happens”
author: Tony DeLiso

quote: “The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself.”
author: Carl Sagan

quote: “Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous, possessive love that grabs at what it can. But life leaps over oblivion lightly, losing only a thing or two of no importance, and gloom is but the passing shadow of a cloud...”
author: Yann Martel

quote: “I am fated to journey hand in hand with my strange heroes and to survey the surging immensity of life, to survey it through the laughter that all can see and through the tears unseen and unknown by anyone.”
author: Nikolai Gogol

quote: “When a woman becomes her own best friend life is easier.”
author: Diane Von Furstenberg

quote: “Throughout life people will make you mad, disrespect you and treat you bad. Let God deal with the things they do, cause hate in your heart will consume you too.”
author: Will Smith

quote: “I was always an unusual girl.My mother told me I had a chameleon soul, no moral compass pointing due north, no fixed personality; just an inner indecisiveness that was as wide and as wavering as the ocean.”
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: “Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue. Realize the strength, move on.”
author: Henry Rollins

quote: “Parents were the only ones obligated to love you; from the rest of the world you had to earn it.”
author: Ann Brashares

quote: “Friends are the family you choose (~ Nin/Ithilnin, Elven rogue).”
author: Jess C Scott

quote: “If you have a strong purpose in life, you don't have to be pushed. Your passion will drive you there.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “How can I be reasonable? To me our love was everything and you were my whole life. It is not very pleasant to realize that to you it was only an episode.”
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: “It's better to burn out than to fade away.”
author: Neil Young

quote: “It's not the men in your life that matters, it's the life in your men.”
author: Mae West

quote: “Those who are willing to be vulnerable move among mysteries.”
author: Theodore Roethke

quote: “I will not try to convince you to love me, to respect me, to commit to me. I deserve better than that; I AM BETTER THAN THAT...Goodbye.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Magic exists. Who can doubt it, when there are rainbows and wildflowers, the music of the wind and the silence of the stars? Anyone who has loved has been touched by magic. It is such a simple and such an extraordinary part of the lives we live.”
author: Nora Roberts

quote: “Every luxury must be paid for, and everything is a luxury, starting with being in this world.”
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: “What would come, would come...and you would have to meet it, when it did.”
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: “I see it all perfectly; there are two possible situations — one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it — you will regret both.”
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: “Often, it’s not about becoming a new person, but becoming the person you were meant to be, and already are, but don’t know how to be.”
author: Heath L. Buckmaster

quote: “One of the few good things about modern times: If you die horribly on television, you will not have died in vain. You will have entertained us.”
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: “The whole of life is just like watching a film. Only it's as though you always get in ten minutes after the big picture has started, and no-one will tell you the plot, so you have to work it out all yourself from the clues.”
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: “I learned this, at least, by my experiment; that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours..”
author: Thoreau Henry David

quote: “Life is a comedy to those who think, a tragedy to those who feel.”
author: Jean Racine

quote: “Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much”
author: Helen Keller

quote: “Make a pact with yourself today to not be defined by your past. Sometimes the greatest thing to come out of all your hard work isn't what you get for it, but what you become for it. Shake things up today! Be You...Be Free...Share.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Then, one stupid person, no different from any other stupid person, wanders into your stupid life...you give them a piece of you. They don't ask for it. They do something dumb one day like kiss you or smile at you, and then your life isn't your own anymore.”
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: “nothing in this world was more difficult than love.”
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: “One always has a better book in one's mind than one can manage to get onto paper.”
author: Michael Cunningham

quote: “I'm sorry for my inability to let unimportant things go, for my inability to hold on to the important things.”
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: “How much I missed, simply because I was afraid of missing it.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “Time takes it all, whether you want it to or not.”
author: Stephen King

quote: “To perceive is to suffer.”
author: Aristotle

quote: “The strongest people find the courage and caring to help others, even if they are going through their own storm.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Life is too short, or too long, for me to allow myself the luxury of living it so badly.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “Closed in a room, my imagination becomes the universe, and the rest of the world is missing out.”
author: Criss Jami

quote: “Spring passes and one remembers one's innocence.Summer passes and one remembers one's exuberance.Autumn passes and one remembers one's reverence.Winter passes and one remembers one's perseverance.”
author: Yoko Ono

quote: “It’s never an insult to be called what somebody thinks is a bad name. It just shows you how poor that person is, it doesn’t hurt you.”
author: Harper Lee

quote: “The surest way to make your dreams come true is to live them.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “There are ships sailing to many ports, but not a single one goes where life is not painful.”
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: “I'm the most terrific liar you ever saw in your life. It's awful. If I'm on my way to the store to buy a magazine, even, and somebody asks me where I'm going, I'm liable to say I'm going to the opera. It's terrible.”
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: “I know that the whole point—the only point—is tofind the things that matter, and hold on to them, and fight for them, and refuse tolet them go.”
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: “I'm not in search of sanctity, sacredness, purity; these things are found after this life, not in this life; but in this life I search to be completely human: to feel, to give, to take, to laugh, to get lost, to be found, to dance, to love and to lust, to be so human.”
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: “My body is my journal, and my tattoos are my story.”
author: Johnny Depp

quote: “Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.”
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: “Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.”
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: “Every woman that finally figured out her worth, has picked up her suitcases of pride and boarded a flight to freedom, which landed in the valley of change.”
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: “I can't decide whether I'm a good girl wrapped up in a bad girl, or if I'm a bad girl wrapped up in a good girl. And that's how I know I'm a woman!”
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: “There comes a time in your life when you have to choose to turn the page, write another book or simply close it.”
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: “To have what you have never had, you have to do what you have never done.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Oh, Life, I am yours. Whatever it is you want of me, I am ready to give.”
author: William Steig

quote: “Live the Life of Your DreamsWhen you start living the life of your dreams, there will always be obstacles, doubters, mistakes and setbacks along the way. But with hard work, perseverance and self-belief there is no limit to what you can achieve.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “He's not your prince charming if he doesn't make sure you know that you're his princess.”
author: Demi Lovato

quote: “Nothing can disturb your peace of mind unless you allow it to.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Kindness is not a business. True kindness expects nothing in return and should never act with conditions.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Of all creatures that breathe and move upon the earth, nothing is bred that is weaker than man.”
author: Homer

quote: “Who are you?Are you in touch with all of your darkest fantasies?Have you created a life for yourself where you can experience them?I have. I am fucking crazy.But I am free.”
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: “You never know what's around the corner. It could be everything. Or it could be nothing. You keep putting one foot in front of the other, and then one day you look back and you've climbed a mountain.”
author: Tom Hiddleston

quote: “My one regret in life is that I am not someone else.”
author: Woody Allen

quote: “If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Oh the places you'll go! There is fun to be done! There are points to be scored. There are games to be won. And the magical things you can do with that ball will make you the winning-est winner of all.”
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: “When you can live forever what do you live for?”
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: “Perfectionism is the enemy of happiness. Embrace being perfectly imperfect. Learn from your mistakes and forgive yourself, you’ll be happier. We make mistakes because we are imperfect. Learn from your mistakes, forgive yourself, and keep moving forward.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Tears, idle tears, I know not what they mean, Tears from the depths of some devine despairRise in the heart, and gather to the eyes, In looking on the happy autumn fields, And thinking of the days that are no more.”
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: “Sacrifice is a part of life. It's supposed to be. It's not something to regret. It's something to aspire to.”
author: Mitch Albom

quote: “Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.”
author: Steve Jobs

quote: “Romance novels are birthday cake and life is often peanut butter and jelly. I think everyone should have lots of delicious romance novels lying around for those times when the peanut butter of life gets stuck to the roof of your mouth.”
author: Janet Evanovich

quote: “Don't leave a piece of jewelry at his house so you can go back and get it later; he may be with his real girlfriend.”
author: Amy Sedaris

quote: “My father had taught me to be nice first, because you can always be mean later, but once you've been mean to someone, they won't believe the nice anymore. So be nice, be nice, until it's time to stop being nice, then destroy them.”
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

quote: “Knowledge, like air, is vital to life. Like air, no one should be denied it.”
author: Alan Moore

quote: “When the going gets weird, the weird turn professional.”
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: “How far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed in a weary world.”
author: William Shakespeare

quote: “Life is a series of pulls back and forth... A tension of opposites, like a pull on a rubber band. Most of us live somewhere in the middle. A wrestling match...Which side win? Love wins. Love always wins”
author: Mitch Albom

quote: “We’re here, and then we’re gone, and it’s not about the time we’re here, but what we do with the time.”
author: Rick Yancey

quote: “A fit, healthy body—that is the best fashion statement”
author: Jess C Scott

quote: “It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,”
author: Amit Ray

quote: “People are unhappy when they get something too easily. You have to sweat--that's the only moral they know.”
author: Dany Laferrière

quote: “Do not let arrogance go to your head and despair to your heart; do not let compliments go to your head and criticisms to your heart; do not let success go to your head and failure to your heart.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “A smile puts you on the right track. A smile makes the world a beautiful place. When you lose your smile, you lose your way in the chaos of life.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Courage is feeling fear, not getting rid of fear, and taking action in the face of fear.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.”
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: “Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.”
author: Thomas Merton

quote: “You Are the Master of Your AttitudeYou cannot control what happens to you, but you can control the way you think about all the events. You always have a choice. You can choose to face them with a positive mental attitude.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “There is nothing more frightful than ignorance in action.”
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: “It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “It wasn’t my day. My week. My month. My year. My life. God damn it.”
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: “No! Try not. Do, or do not. There is no try.”
author: George Lucas

quote: “Just living is not enough," said the butterfly, "one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.”
author: Hans Christian Anderson

quote: “Renew, release, let go. Yesterday’s gone. There’s nothing you can do to bring it back. You can’t “should’ve” done something. You can only DO something. Renew yourself. Release that attachment. Today is a new day!”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “You were given life; it is your duty (and also your entitlement as a human being) to find something beautiful within life, no matter how slight.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: “People say that eyes are windows to the soul.”
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: “I just wanted to tell you that I understand if you go. It’s okay if you have to leave us. It’s okay if you want to stop fighting.”
author: Gayle Forman

quote: “Even for me life had its gleams of sunshine.”
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: “It was always the becoming he dreamed of, never the being.”
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: “Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, "What's in it for me?”
author: Brian Tracy

quote: “Life was meant to be lived, and curiosity must be kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.”
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: “Whenever something bad happens, keep calm, take a few deep breaths and shift the focus to something positive.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “My life didn't please me, so I created my life.”
author: Coco Chanel

quote: “The only way to survive eternity is to be able to appreciate each moment.”
author: Lauren Kate

quote: “Your life is an occasion. Rise to it.”
author: Suzanne Weyn

quote: “Guard well your thoughts when alone and your words when accompanied.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “You cannot change anyone, but you can be the reason someone changes.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Each day brings new opportunities, allowing you to constantly live with love—be there for others—bring a little light into someone's day. Be grateful and live each day to the fullest.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “I know it seems hard sometimes but remember one thing. Through every dark night, there's a bright day after that. So no matter how hard it get, stick your chest out, keep ya head up.... and handle it.”
author: Tupac Shakur

quote: “You are in charge of your own happiness; you don't need to wait for other people's permission to be happy.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “If you've never eaten while crying you don t know what life tastes like.”
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: “You don't have to disrespect and insult others simply to hold your own ground. If you do, that shows how shaky your own position is.”
author: Red Haircrow

quote: “When two people are under the influence of the most violent, most insane, most delusive, and most transient of passions, they are required to swear that they will remain in that excited, abnormal, and exhausting condition continuously until death do them part.”
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: “We are all connected; To each other, biologically. To the earth, chemically. To the rest of the universe atomically.”
author: Neil DeGrasse Tyson

quote: “I don't want to achieve immortality through my work; I want to achieve immortality through not dying. I don't want to live on in the hearts of my countrymen; I want to live on in my apartment.”
author: Woody Allen

quote: “For I have known them all already, known them all—Have known the evenings, mornings, afternoons,I have measured out my life with coffee spoons.”
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: “Art is to console those who are broken by life.”
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: “There's nothing more embarrassing than to have earned the disfavor of a perceptive animal.”
author: Michael Chabon

quote: “Nobody wants to be here and nobody wants to leave.”
author: Cormac McCarthy

quote: “Growing up happens when you start having things you look back on and wish you could change -Clary Fray”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: “Don’t let the noise of others’ opinions drown out your own inner voice."[Stanford University commencement speech, 2005]”
author: Steve Jobs

quote: “Cynics are simply thwarted romantics.”
author: William Goldman

quote: “Our lives are defined by opportunities, even the ones we miss.”
author: Eric Roth

quote: “You do not immortalize the lost by writing about them. Language buries, but does not resurrect.”
author: John Green

quote: “Very occasionally, if you pay really close attention, life doesn't suck.”
author: Joss Whedon

quote: “Yea, all things live forever, though at times they sleep and are forgotten.”
author: H. Rider Haggard

quote: “I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty...But I am too busy thinking about myself.”
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: “Being grateful does not mean that everything is necessarily good. It just means that you can accept it as a gift.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “He is terribly afraid of dying because he hasn’t yet lived.”
author: Franz Kafka

quote: “You're both the fire and the water that extinguishes it. You're the narrator, the protagonist, and the sidekick. You're the storyteller and the story told. You are somebody's something, but you are also your you.”
author: John Green

quote: “Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness.Listen to it carefully.”
author: Richard Bach

quote: “Some things you hear with your ears. Others, you hear with your heart.”
author: Sarah J. Maas

quote: “Moral wounds have this peculiarity - they may be hidden, but they never close; always painful, always ready to bleed when touched, they remain fresh and open in the heart.”
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: “They had an ordinary life, full of ordinary things—if love can ever be called that.”
author: Leigh Bardugo

quote: “When you compare the sorrows of real life to the pleasures of the imaginary one, you will never want to live again, only to dream forever.”
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: “Prime numbers are what is left when you have taken all the patterns away. I think prime numbers are like life. They are very logical but you could never work out the rules, even if you spent all your time thinking about them.”
author: Mark Haddon

quote: “There are no random acts...We are all connected...You can no more separate one life from another than you can separate a breeze from the wind...”
author: Mitch Albom

quote: “Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash.”
author: Leonard Cohen

quote: “If there was anything that depressed him more than his own cynicism, it was that quite often it still wasn't as cynical as real life.”
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: “Don’t let others tell you what you can’t do. Don't let the limitations of others limit your vision. If you can remove your self-doubt and believe in yourself, you can achieve what you never thought possible.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Don't think about making life better for other people who don't even deserve you, rather, focus on making your life the best, for yourself and those who love you.”
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: “She just smiled, said that she loved books more than anything, and started telling him excitedly what each of the ones in her lap was about. And Ove realised that he wanted to hear her talking about the things she loved for the rest of his life.”
author: Fredrik Backman

quote: “The best of us must sometimes eat our words.”
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: “In all of living, have much fun and laughter. Life is to be enjoyed, not just endured.”
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: “Life is like a novel. It's filled with suspense. You have no idea what is going to happen until you turn the page.”
author: sidney sheldon

quote: “Remember that everyone you meet is afraid of something, loves something and has lost something.”
author: H. Jackson Brown

quote: “If you need something from somebody always give that person a way to hand it to you.”
author: Sue Monk Kidd

quote: “The person you became with her is worth being.”
author: Veronica Roth

quote: “There was beauty in the idea of freedom, but it was an illusion. Every human heart was chained by love.”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: “Great leaders create more leaders, not followers.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “How would your life be different if…You walked away from gossip and verbal defamation? Let today be the day…You speak only the good you know of other people and encourage others to do the same.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “I'll never know, and neither will you, of the life you don't choose. We'll only know that whatever that sister life was, it was important and beautiful and not ours. It was the ghost ship that didn't carry us. There's nothing to do but salute it from the shore.”
author: Cheryl Strayed

quote: “Forget yesterday - it has already forgotten you. Don't sweat tomorrow - you haven't even met. Instead, open your eyes and your heart to a truly precious gift - today.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “The story of life is quicker than the wink of an eye, the story of love is hello and goodbye...until we meet again”
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: “It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!”
author: Robert T. Kiyosaki

quote: “Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors for you where there were only walls.”
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: “It is wise to direct your anger towards problems -- not people; to focus your energies on answers -- not excuses.”
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: “Too many people spend money they haven't earned, to buy things they don't want, to impress people that they don't like.”
author: Will Rogers

quote: “At some point we all look up and realize we are lost in a maze.”
author: John Green

quote: “I am afraid. Not of life, or death, or nothingness, but of wasting it as if I had never been.”
author: Daniel Keyes

quote: “When a man cannot choose, he ceases to be a man.”
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: “The best way to predict your future is to create it.”
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: “If there were such a thing as terminal literalism, you'd have died in childhood.”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: “When things go wrong, don't go with them.”
author: Elvis Presley

quote: “I'm the girl nobody knows until she commits suicide. Then suddenly everyone had a class with her.”
author: Tom Leveen

quote: “Life is funny. Things change, people change, but you will always be you, so stay true to yourself and never sacrifice who you are for anyone.”
author: Zayn Malik

quote: “We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.”
author: Douglas Adams

quote: “I want words at my funeral. But I guess that means you need life in your life.”
author: Markus Zusak

quote: “Oh, don't cry, I'm so sorry I cheated so much, but that's the way things are.”
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: “Life, with its rules, its obligations, and its freedoms, is like a sonnet: You're given the form, but you have to write the sonnet yourself. - Mrs. Whatsit”
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: “I want to live my life in such a way that when I get out of bed in the morning, the devil says, "aw shit, he's up!”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “We demand rigidly defined areas of doubt and uncertainty!”
author: Douglas Adams

quote: “Then I discovered that being related is no guarantee of love!”
author: Stieg Larsson

quote: “Don’t sacrifice yourself too much, because if you sacrifice too much there’s nothing else you can give and nobody will care for you.”
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: “If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself, tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for to the creator there is no poverty and no poor indifferent place.”
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: “Life will not break your heart. It'll crush it.”
author: Henry Rollins

quote: “All human beings have three lives: public, private, and secret.”
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: “I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.”
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: “You are not the victim of the world, but rather the master of your own destiny. It is your choices and decisions that determine your destiny.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not. ”
author: Carl G. Jung

quote: “To travel is to live.”
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: “He died that day because his body had served its purpose. His soul had done what it came to do, learned what it came to learn, and then was free to leave.”
author: Garth Stein

quote: “Just keep moving forward and don't give a shit about what anybody thinks. Do what you have to do, for you.”
author: Johnny Depp

quote: “I don't think that there are any limits to how excellent we could make life seem.”
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: “Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.”
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: “Earth's crammed with heaven...But only he who sees, takes off his shoes.”
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: “In the end, it wasn't death that surprised her but the stubbornness of life.”
author: Jeffrey Eugenides

quote: “Hardships make or break people.”
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: “Always have a willing hand to help someone, you might be the only one that does.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Most of the basic material a writer works with is acquired before the age of fifteen.”
author: Willa Cather

quote: “But I don't believe that life is supposed to make you feel good, or to make you feel miserable either. Life is just supposed to make you feel.”
author: Gloria Naylor

quote: “The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is.”
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: “And therein lies the whole of man's plight. Human time does not turn in a circle; it runs ahead in a straight line. That is why man cannot be happy: happiness is the longing for repetition.”
author: Milan Kundera

quote: “Life isn't as serious as the mind makes it out to be.”
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: “The cost of a thing is the amount of what I will call life which is required to be exchanged for it, immediately or in the long run.”
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: “As far as we can discern, the sole purpose of human existence is to kindle a light of meaning in the darkness of mere being.”
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quote: “All opinions are not equal. Some are a very great deal more robust, sophisticated and well supported in logic and argument than others.”
author: Douglas Adams

quote: “This isn't life in the fast lane, it's life in the oncoming traffic.”
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: “Life is a funny thing. We only get so many years to live it, so we have to do everything we can to make sure those years are as full as they can be. We shouldn't waste time on things that might happen someday, or maybe even never.”
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: “Women, they have minds, and they have souls, as well as just hearts. And they’ve got ambition, and they’ve got talent, as well as just beauty. I’m so sick of people saying that love is all a woman is fit for.”
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: “To sell your soul is the easiest thing in the world. That's what everybody does every hour of his life. If I asked you to keep your soul - would you understand why that's much harder?”
author: Ayn Rand

quote: “Those who will not reason, are bigots, those who cannot, are fools, and those who dare not, are slaves.”
author: George Gordon Byron (Lord Byron)

quote: “Breathe. Let go. And remind yourself that this very moment is the only one you know you have for sure. ”
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: “What were you before you met me?""I think I was drowning""And what are you now?""Water”
author: Ocean Vuong
