quote: “The trick. . .is to find the balance between the bright colors of humor and the serious issues of identity, self-loathing, and the possibility for intimacy and love when it seems no longer possible or, sadder yet, no longer necessary.”
author: Wendy Wasserstein

quote: “Push yourself to do more and to experience more. Harness your energy to start expanding your dreams. Yes, expand your dreams. Don't accept a life of mediocrity when you hold such infinite potential within the fortress of your mind. Dare to tap into your greatness.”
author: Robin S. Sharma

quote: “We fool ourselves so much we could do it for a living.”
author: Stephen King

quote: “Live your life. Be happy as you can be, let go of the things that don't matter, and fight.”
author: Kiera Cass

quote: “I define nothing. Not beauty, not patriotism. I take each thing as it is, without prior rules about what it should be.”
author: Bob Dylan

quote: “The friends you make in college are friends you'll have for life, even if you don't talk for years at a time.”
author: Jessica Park

quote: “I liked being a person. I wanted to keep at it.”
author: John Green

quote: “There is a very fine line between loving life and being greedy for it.”
author: Maya Angelou

quote: “Life is life. You choose to live it or you do not.”
author: Carrie Ryan

quote: “In the haunted house of life, art is the only stair that doesn't creak.”
author: Tom Robbins

quote: “Life is a winking light in the darkness.”
author: Hayao Miyazaki

quote: “Dead people can be our heroes because they cant disappoint us later; they only improve over time, as we forget more and more about them.”
author: Veronica Roth

quote: “There is no endTo what a living worldWill demand of you.”
author: Octavia E. Butler

quote: “To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone and a funnybone.”
author: Reba McEntire

quote: “Until death it is all life”
author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

quote: “Isn't it strange that I know you'd risk your life to save mine, but I don't even know what your favorite color is?”
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: “Even though our time in this life is temporary, if we live well enough, our legacy will last forever.”
author: idowu koyenikan

quote: “The struggles we endure today will be the ‘good old days’ we laugh about tomorrow.”
author: Aaron Lauritsen

quote: “In my many years I have come to a conclusion that one useless man is a shame, two is a law firm, and three or more is a congress.”
author: Peter Stone

quote: “Everything that happens before Death is what counts.”
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: “Life is fragile and temporary. The faces of today quickly become the faces of the past. Sorrow, pain, and anger... it all fades- except love. Love is forever and there after, even when we've fallen to our graves.”
author: Lee Argus

quote: “What if it's the thereand not the herethat I long for?The wanderand not the wait,the magicin the lost feetstumbling downthe faraway streetand the way the moonnever hangsquite the same.”
author: Tyler Knott Gregson

quote: “The longer we live, the more weight we carry in our hearts.”
author: Ai Yazawa

quote: “The others in the dorm thought I wanted to be a writer, because I was always alone with a book, but I had no such ambition. There was nothing I wanted to be. ”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “Ah, Nothing is too late, till the tired heart shall cease to palpitate.”
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: “Hope is not a feeling of certainty that everything ends well. Hope is just a feeling that life and work have a meaning.”
author: Vaclav Havel

quote: “The key to life is accepting challenges. Once someone stops doing this, he's dead.”
author: Bette Davis

quote: “Live authentically. Why would you continue to compromise something that's beautiful to create something that is fake?”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “People will always have opinions about your decision because they're not courageous enough to take action on their opinion.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Fuck it... That's really the attitude that keeps a family together, it's not "we love each other", it's just "fuck it, man.”
author: Louis C.K.

quote: “The soul is like an uninhabited worldthat comes to life only whenGod lays His headagainst us.”
author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quote: “I think of life as a good book. The further you get into it, the more it begins to make sense.”
author: Harold Kushner

quote: “Given that we can live only a small part of what there is in us -- what happens with the rest?”
author: Pascal Mercier

quote: “Things will get easier, people's minds will change, and you should be alive to see it.”
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: “Tristan was silent for a few moments, looking at the leaves before them. "Life isn't about the past and the future. It's about today." He paused. "It's about five minutes from now and two seconds ago. It's moments, you know? Not years. Years aren't what define us.”
author: Chelsea Fine

quote: “Suspect each moment, for it is a thief, tiptoeing away with more than it brings.”
author: John Updike

quote: “It’s always about timing. If it’s too soon, no one understands. If it’s too late, everyone’s forgotten.”
author: Anna Wintour

quote: “Life did not stop, and one had to live.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: “It's much easier to not know things sometimes. Things change and friends leave. And life doesn't stop for anybody.”
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: “If you want to be a new man you have to stay in new places, and do new things, with people who never knew you before. If you go back to the same old ways, what else can you be but the same old person?”
author: Joe Abercrombie

quote: “Quietly endure, silently suffer and patiently wait.”
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: “I feel no need for any other faith than my faith in the kindness of human beings. I am so absorbed in the wonder of earth and the life upon it that I cannot think of heaven and angels.”
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: “People who fit don’t seek. The seekers are those that don’t fit.”
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: “But what is life if you don't live it?”
author: James Patterson

quote: “Don't you bully me with your politeness! Love is hard to believe, ask any lover. Life is hard to believe, ask any scientist. God is hard to believe, ask any believer. What is your problem with hard to believe?”
author: Yann Martel

quote: “Whoever said that the past isn't dead had it backward. It's the future that's already dead, already played out.”
author: Gayle Forman

quote: “I don't understand a thing about this world: about people, and why they do the things they do. The more I find out, the more I uncover, the more I know, the less I understand.”
author: Craig Silvey

quote: “The best way to prepare for life is to begin to live.”
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: “It shocks me how I wish for...what is lost and cannot come back.”
author: Sue Monk Kidd

quote: “Hurt is a part of life. To be honest, I think hurt is a part of happiness, that our definition of happiness has gotten very narrow lately, very nervous, a little afraid of this brawling, fabulous, unpredictable world.”
author: Julian Gough

quote: “Your life is a print-out of your thoughts.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Receive with simplicity everything that happens to you.”
author: Rashi

quote: “It's faith in something and enthusiasm for something that makes a life worth living.”
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: “But I think we both knew, even then, that what we had was something even more rare, and even more meaningful. I was going to be his friend, and was going to show him possibilities. And he, in turn, would become someone I could trust more than myself.”
author: David Levithan

quote: “Imagine others complexly.”
author: John Green

quote: “Just because life is hard, and always ends in a bad way, doesn't mean that all stories have to, even if that's what they tell us in school and in the New York Times Review. In fact, it's a good thing that stories are as different as we are, one from another.”
author: James Patterson

quote: “Life is such a glorious trauma, is it not?”
author: J.R. Ward

quote: “In love, as in life, one misheard word can be tremendously important. If you tell someone you love them, for instance, you must be absolutely certain that they have replied "I love you back" and not "I love your back" before you continue the conversation.”
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: “Dogs are great. Bad dogs, if you can really call them that, are perhaps the greatest of them all.”
author: John Grogan

quote: “That woman doesn't have the sense God gave a retarded flea.”
author: Nora Roberts

quote: “You can't do anything about the length of your life, but you can do something about its width and depth.”
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: “I want to drag knives over my skin, just to feel something other than shame, but I'm not even brave enough for that”
author: Paula Hawkins

quote: “I loved you long before you loved me. It's the only thing I have you beat at, and I'll bring it up every chance I get.”
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: “It may be true that the law cannot make a man love me, but it can stop him from lynching me, and I think that's pretty important.”
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: “Watching my back is the perfect opportunity to stick a knife in it.”
author: Holly Black

quote: “The world is wide, and I will not waste my life in friction when it could be turned into momentum. ”
author: Frances Willard

quote: “Every time I thought I was being rejected from something good, I was actually being re-directed to something better.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Well, sometimes I worry that my whole life will be based about what's comfortable and easy. I'll care too much about what makes me feel good to ever really reach for anything. And then I worry that even if I do, I won't succeed.”
author: Julia Hoban

quote: “Opinions are the cheapest commodities on earth. Everyone has a flock of opinions ready to be wished upon anyone who will accept them. If you are influenced by "opinions" when you reach DECISIONS, you will not succeed in any undertaking.”
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: “Never give up on what you really want to do. The person with big dreams is more powerful than one with all the facts.”
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quote: “There are no classes in life for beginners: right away you are always asked to deal with what is most difficult.”
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: “Even a snail will eventually reach its destination.”
author: Gail Tsukiyama

quote: “Once your mindset changes, everything on the outside will change along with it.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “We are star stuff harvesting sunlight.”
author: Carl Sagan

quote: “I just want to do something that matters. Or be something that matters. I just want to matter.”
author: John Green

quote: “Life is a moderately good play with a badly written third act.”
author: Truman Capote

quote: “I’m not a bad person. I haven’t killed anyone. I (rarely) lie. I don’t kick little puppies. So why do people look at me as if the world would be a better place without me?”
author: Gena Showalter

quote: “Spend the afternoon, you can't take it with you.”
author: Annie Dillard

quote: “Like madness is the glory of this life.”
author: Shakespeare

quote: “Oh, something is there, waiting for me. Perhaps someday the revelation will burst in upon me and I will see the other side of this monumental grotesque joke. And then I'll laugh. And then I'll know what life is.”
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: “Tomorrow belongs to those who can hear it coming”
author: David Bowie

quote: “Slow down and enjoy life. It's not only the scenery you miss by going too fast - you also miss the sense of where you are going and why.”
author: Eddie Cantor

quote: “We do not need to eat animals, wear animals, or use animals for entertainment purposes, and our only defense of these uses is our pleasure, amusement, and convenience.”
author: Gary L. Francione

quote: “It is said that power corrupts, but actually it's more true that power attracts the corruptible. The sane are usually attracted by other things than power.”
author: David Brin

quote: “It does not take courage to kill. It takes courage to live.”
author: Renee Ahdieh

quote: “In examining disease, we gain wisdom about anatomy and physiology and biology. In examining the person with disease, we gain wisdom about life.”
author: Oliver W. Sacks

quote: “Always live your life with your biography in mind.”
author: Marisha Pessl

quote: “I know now, after fifty years, that the finding/losing, forgetting/remembering, leaving/returning, never stops. The whole of life is about another chance, and while we are alive, till the very end, there is always another chance.”
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: “If you wish to achieve worthwhile things in your personal and career life, you must become a worthwhile person in your own self-development.”
author: Brian Tracy

quote: “When you know what you want, and you want it bad enough, you'll find a way to get it.”
author: Jim Rohn

quote: “People are not lazy, they simply have impotent goals..that is..goals that do not inspire them.”
author: Anthony Robbins

quote: “People see stories everywhere...We take random events and we put them together in a pattern so we can comfort ourselves with a story, no matter how much it obviously isn't true...We have to lie to ourselves to live. Otherwise, we'd go crazy.”
author: Patrick Ness

quote: “Always choose the future over the past. What do we do now?”
author: Brian Tracy

quote: “Sometimes life doesn't happen in chronological order.”
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: “The world is terrible," said Mark tonelessly. "And some are drawn down into it and drown there, and some rise above and carry others with them.”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: “Ships that pass in the night, and speak each other in passing,Only a signal shown and a distant voice in the darkness;So on the ocean of life, we pass and speak one another,Only a look and a voice, then darkness again and a silence.”
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: “I hate when people say 'I see'. It doesn't mean anything and I think it's hostile. Whenever anyone tells me 'I see' I think they're really saying 'Fuck you'.”
author: Peter Cameron

quote: “Sometimes it's better to stop trying to make sense of things. Life isn't clear cut, there are always gray areas.”
author: Alexandra Adornetto

quote: “I said "Somebody should do something about that." Then I realized I am somebody.”
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: “Your hand can seize today, but not tomorrow; and thoughts of your tomorrow are nothing but desire. Don’t waste this breath, if your heart isn’t crazy, since "the rest of your life" won’t last forever.”
author: Omar Khayyám

quote: “Whoever debases others is debasing himself.”
author: James Baldwin

quote: “Or, rather, let us be more simple and less vain.”
author: Rousseau Jean-Jacques

quote: “And everyone is alive, somewhere in time.”
author: Amal El-Mohtar

quote: “The Way is not in the sky; the Way is in the heart.”
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: “The demon that you can swallow gives you its power, and the greater life’s pain, the greater life’s reply.”
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: “You must learn to forgive a man when he's in love. He's always a nuisance.”
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: “In life, there are no mistakes, only lessons.”
author: Vic Johnson

quote: “The voice says, maybe you don't go to hell for the things you do. Maybe you go to hell for the things you don't do. The things you don't finish.”
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: “The very stone one kicks with one's boot will outlast Shakespeare.”
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: “People who keep stiff upper lips find that it's damn hard to smile.”
author: Judith Guest

quote: “In heaven an angel is no one in particular.”
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: “Sometimes we love with nothing more than hope. Sometimes we cry with everything except tears. In the end that’s all there is: love and its duty, sorrow and its truth. In the end that’s all we have - to hold on tight until the dawn”
author: Gregory David Roberts

quote: “Strange, how the best moments of our lives we scarcely notice except in looking back.”
author: Joe Abercrombie

quote: “We just had a near-life experience!”
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: “A very wise man once told me that you can't look back-you just have to put the past behind you, and find something better in your future.”
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: “People say I make strange choices, but they’re not strange for me. My sickness is that I’m fascinated by human behavior, by what’s underneath the surface, by the worlds inside people.”
author: Johnny Depp

quote: “Sometimes it seemed to him that his life was delicate as a dandelion. One little puff from any direction, and it was blown to bits.”
author: Katherine Paterson

quote: “Now this might disturb you, but I find I'm OK by myself;and I don't need you or your benevolence to make sense.”
author: Morrissey

quote: “It is a very natural human trait to destroy that which frightens us.”
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

quote: “Life equals running and when we stop running maybe that's how we'll know life is finally finished.”
author: Patrick Ness

quote: “But I’m not guilty,” said K. “there’s been a mistake. How is it even possible for someone to be guilty? We’re all human beings here, one like the other.” “That is true” said the priest “but that is how the guilty speak”
author: Franz Kafka

quote: “Grace doesn't depend on suffering to exist, but where there is suffering you will find grace in many facets and colors.”
author: Wm. Paul Young

quote: “You are in danger of living a life so comfortable and soft, that you will die without ever realizing your true potential.”
author: David Goggins

quote: “You're always with yourself, so you might as well enjoy the company.”
author: Diane Von Furstenberg

quote: “Dreams are hopeful because they exist as pure possibility. Unlike memories, which are fossils, long dead and buried deep.”
author: Shaun David Hutchinson

quote: “Love with all your heart and show kindness in all your actions.”
author: Lauren Asher

quote: “And you know, there's less charm in life when you think about death--but it's more peaceful.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: “The true miracle lies in our eagerness to allow, appreciate, and honor the uniqueness, and freedom of each sentient being to sing the song of their heart.”
author: Amit Ray

quote: “Through all of living have much joy and laughter, life is to be enjoyed, not just endured.”
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: “If one has no sense of humor, one is in trouble.”
author: Betty White

quote: “We cannot, after all, judge a biography by its length, by the number of pages in it; we must judge by the richness of the contents...Sometimes the 'unfinisheds' are among the most beautiful symphonies.”
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: “We all live inside the terrible engine of authority, and it grinds and shrieks and burns so that no one will say: lines on maps are silly.”
author: Catherynne M. Valente

quote: “Feeling lost, crazy and desperate belongs to a good life as much as optimism, certainty and reason.”
author: Alain de Botton

quote: “You'd think, 'What if I make a mistake today, I'll regret it'. I don’t believe in regret, I feel everything leads us to where we are and we have to just jump forward, mean well, commit and just see what happens.”
author: Angelina Jolie

quote: “But instead of spending our lives running towards our dreams, we are often running away from a fear of failure or a fear of criticism.”
author: Eric Wright

quote: “Life is a dream from which we all must wake before we can dream again.”
author: Robert Jordan

quote: “The joy in life is his who has the heart to demand it.”
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: “A 'no' does not hide anything, but a 'yes' very easily becomes a deception.”
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: “There's no point having wishes if you don't at least try to do them”
author: Sally Nicholls

quote: “Life is a train of moods like a string of beads; and as we pass through them they prove to be many colored lenses, which paint the world their own hue, and each shows us only what lies in its own focus.”
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: “You must learn to know the difference between tales and the truth, my Liza, she would say. Fairy tales have a habit of ending too soon. They never show what happens afterwards when the prince and princess ride off the page.”
author: Kate Morton

quote: “It was only high school after all, definitely one of the most bizarre periods in a person’s life. How anyone can come through that time well adjusted on any level is an absolute miracle.”
author: E.A. Bucchianeri

quote: “Taking on too much of other people's drama is just a poor excuse for not taking ownership and control over your own life.”
author: José N. Harris

quote: “The world is very lovely, and it's very horrible--and it doesn't care about your life or mine or anything else.”
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: “Be in love with your life, every detail of it.”
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: “Ten long trips around the sun since I last saw that smile, but only joy and thankfulness that on a tiny world in the vastness, for a couple of moments in the immensity of time, we were one.”
author: Ann Druyan

quote: “A lot of the conflict you have in your life exists simply because you're not living in alignment; you're not be being true to yourself.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “When I look at my old pictures, all I can see is what I used to be but am no longer. I think: What I can see is what I am not.”
author: Aleksandar Hemon

quote: “No amount of me trying to explain myself was doing any good. I didn't even know what was going on inside of me, so how could I have explained it to them?”
author: Sierra D. Waters

quote: “No matter what your history has been, your destiny is what you create today. What are you going to create?”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “People soon get tired of things that aren't boring, but not of what is boring.”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “How would your life be different if…You stopped validating your victim mentality? Let today be the day…You shake off your self-defeating drama and embrace your innate ability to recover and achieve.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Grace is what picks me up and lifts my wings high above and I fly! Grace always conquers! Be graceful in everything; in anger, in sadness, in joy, in kindness, in unkindness, retain grace with you!”
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: “Water and air, the two essential fluids on which all life depends, have become global garbage cans.”
author: Jacques-Yves Cousteau

quote: “If we don't change, we don't grow. If we don't grow, we aren't really living.”
author: Anatole France

quote: “In my end is my beginning.”
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: “Self-love is a good thing but self-awareness is more important. You need to once in a while go ‘Uh, I’m kind of an asshole.”
author: Louis C.K.

quote: “Regrets are about decisions that you know you should have done different.”
author: Laurell K Hamilton

quote: “They're animals, all right. But why are you so goddam sure that makes us human beings?”
author: Stephen King

quote: “One day you will be the one called Master (Naruto). You'll be the one to treat others to ramen. We can't stay kids forever."- Shikamaru Nara (Naruto)”
author: Masashi Kishimoto

quote: “The most important questions in life can never be answered by anyone except oneself.”
author: John Fowles

quote: “What did he have to mope about, really? What more did he want?...Love. Purpose. Those are the things that you can't plan for. Those are the things that just happen. And what if they don't happen? Do you spend your whole life pining for them? Waiting to be happy?”
author: Rainbow Rowell

quote: “For what it's worth, I think happiness is a fleeting condition, not a permanent state of goddamn mind. I've learned that if you chase after moments of bliss here and there, sometimes those moments will sustain you through the shit.”
author: Tiffanie DeBartolo

quote: “This is love, I think. A place where people who have been alone may lock together like hawks and spin in the air, dizzy with surprise at the connection. A place you go willingly, and with wonder”
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: “Look around you. Everything changes. Everything on this earth is in a continuous state of evolving, refining, improving, adapting, enhancing…changing. You were not put on this earth to remain stagnant.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Such a simple concept, yet so true: that which we manifest is before us; we are the creators of our own destiny. Be it through intention or ignorance, our successes and our failures have been brought on by none other than ourselves.”
author: Garth Stein

quote: “Leaders are limited by their vision rather than by their abilities.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “I can't seem to be a pessimist long enough to overlook the possibility of things being overwhelmingly good.”
author: John Corey Whaley

quote: “Life's pain. You just have to get over as much of it as you can.-Isabel Culpeper”
author: Maggie Stiefvater

quote: “If you are not the hero of your own story, then you're missing the whole point of your humanity.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “in a woman's womb.another chance.to make the world better.”
author: Ellen Hopkins

quote: “I know I'm not going to be in your head all the time. But once you know me, I'll be forever in your heart. ”
author: Crystal Woods

quote: “It's funny. No matter how hard you try, you can't close your heart forever. And the minute you open it up, you never know what's going to come in. But when it does, you just have to go for it! Because if you don't, there's not point in being here.”
author: Kirstie Alley

quote: “It's not always easy being her daughter.' I think,' she said, 'sometimes it's hard no matter whose daughter you are.”
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: “A wind that blows aimlessly is no good to anyone.”
author: Rick Riordan

quote: “Every single time you help somebody stand up you are helping humanity rise.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Only connect! That was the whole of her sermon. Only connect the prose and the passion, and both will be exalted, and human love will be seen at its height. Live in fragments no longer.”
author: E.M. Forster

quote: “But only he who, himself enlightened, is not afraid of shadows.”
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: “I had a dream about you last night. The champagne was non-alcoholic. You didn't notice, and laughed at my jokes anyway.”
author: Michael  Summers

quote: “Life lived in the absence of the psychedelic experience that primordial shamanism is based on is life trivialized, life denied, life enslaved to the ego.”
author: Terence McKenna

quote: “You will have to make up for the smallness of your size by your courage and selfless devotion to duty, for it is not life that matters, but the courage, fortitude and determination you bring to it.”
author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

quote: “There's a whole category of people who miss out by not allowing themselves to be weird enough.”
author: Alain de Botton

quote: “For the first time in a long time, I want more than I have.”
author: Nicola Yoon

quote: “You couldnt erase everything that caused you pain with recollection.Every memory was valuable; even the bad ones”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: “Being brave means that knowing when you fail, you won't fail forever.”
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: “To become vegetarian is to step towards the stream which leads to nirvana.”
author: Siddhārtha Gautama

quote: “To live is to be haunted.”
author: Philip K. Dick

quote: “My love is pizza shaped. Won’t you have a slice? It’s circular, so there’s enough to go around. ”
author: Dora J. Arod

quote: “Happiness is a state of mind, a choice, a way of living; it is not something to be achieved, it is something to be experienced.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Fame is foolish, it is pointless, meaningless. Even if the whole world knows you, how does it make you richer? How does it make your life more blissful? How does it help you to be more understanding, to be more aware? To be more alert, to be more alive?”
author: Osho

quote: “He saw very clearly how all his life led only to this moment and all after led to nowhere at all. He felt something cold and soulless enter him like another being and he imagined that it smiled malignly and he had no reason to believe that it would ever leave.”
author: Cormac McCarthy

quote: “See, as much as you want to hold on to the bitter sore memory that someone has left this world, you are still in it. And the very act of living is a tide: at first it seems to make no difference at all, and then one day you look down and see how much pain has eroded.”
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: “Many people pray to be kept out of unexpected problems. Some people pray to be able to confront and overcome them.”
author: Toba Beta [Betelgeuse Incident]

quote: “It’s not so much the journey that’s important; as is the way that we treat those we encounter and those around us, along the way”
author: Jeremy Aldana

quote: “You are always a little bit wrong”
author: Hank Green

quote: “What keeps life fascinating is the constant creativity of the soul.”
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: “Life sucks, and then you die.Yeah, I should be so lucky.”
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: “No, I regret nothing, all I regret is having been born, dying is such a long tiresome business I always found.”
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: “Leonard asks me if there's anything I need to know before he dies, I think about it for a minute, turn to him, say what's the meaning of life, Leonard? He laughs, says that's an easy one, my son, it's whatever you want it to be.”
author: James Frey

quote: “I am still in the land of the dying; I shall be in the land of the living soon. (his last words)”
author: John Newton

quote: “Never give up on anybody. Miracles happen everyday.”
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quote: “Everything has boundaries. The same holds true with thought. You shouldn't fear boundaries, but you should not be afraid of destroying them. That's what is most important if you want to be free: respect for and exasperation with boundaries.”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “We are all humiliated by the sudden discovery of a fact which has existed very comfortably and perhaps been staring at us in private while we have been making up our world entirely without it.”
author: George Eliot

quote: “I should have learned this, she thought. I wanted to learn fire, and pain, but I should have learned people.”
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: “When you are living the best version of yourself, you inspire others to live the best versions of themselves.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Me, I want to bloody kick this moronic bloody world in the bloody teeth over and over till it bloody understands that not hurting people is ten bloody thousand times more bloody important than being right.”
author: David Mitchell

quote: “It is your responsibility to find fault with me, it is mine to hear you out. But don't expect me to change.”
author: John Irving

quote: “A celibate clergy is an especially good idea, because it tends to suppress any hereditary propensity toward fanaticism.”
author: Carl Sagan

quote: “Often it feels like I am breathing today only because a few years back I had no idea which nerve to cut...”
author: Sanhita Baruah

quote: “Man is born to live, not to prepare for life.”
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: “I wake up and tear drops, they fall down like rain. I put on that old song we danced to and then, I head off to my job cause not much has changed. Punch the clock, head for home, check the phone. Just in case. Go to bed, dream of you. That's what I am doing these days.”
author: Rascal Flatts

quote: “I am not my body. My body is nothing without me.”
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: “But what are loyalty and caring really worth?""To me? Everything.”
author: Richelle Mead

quote: “She looked away. Her attitude seemed to suggest that she had finished with him, and would be obliged if somebody would come and sweep him up.”
author: P.G. Wodehouse

quote: “Life is a compromise of what your ego wants to do, what experience tells you to do, and what your nerves let you do.”
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: “If you care about someone enough, you’ll always be there for them no matter what.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “I feel like a big faker because I've been putting my life back together, and nobody knows.”
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: “Fame you'll be famous, as famous as can be, with everyone watching you win on TV, Except when they don't because sometimes they won't..”
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: “Each day is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift to Him.”
author: T.D. Jakes

quote: “Integrity is doing what is right and truthful, and doing as you say you would do.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “Scars show us where we have been, they do not dictate where we are going.”
author: David Rossi

quote: “Why not just live in the moment, especially if it has a good beat?”
author: Goldie Hawn

quote: “Did you ever dream you had a friend, Alec? Someone to last your whole life and you his. I suppose such a thing can’t really happen outside sleep.”
author: E.M. Forster

quote: “You’re frustrated because you keep waiting for the blooming of flowers of which you have yet to sow the seeds.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “No matter how many people give me advice, I am going to do what my heart tells me to do”
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: “There is one who remembers the way to your door: Life you may evade, but Death you shall not.”
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: “Until we can receive with an open heart, we are never really giving with an open heart.”
author: Brene Brown

quote: “I tried to contain myself... but I escaped!”
author: Gary Paulsen

quote: “Life is half delicious yogurt, half crap, and your job is to keep the plastic spoon in the yogurt.”
author: Scott Adams

quote: “No matter how strong you are, no matter how smart you are or tough you can be, the world will find a way to break you. And when it does, the only thing you can do is hold on.”
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid

quote: “A sailor chooses the wind that takes the ship from a safe port. Ah, yes, but once you're abroad, as you have seen, winds have a mind of their own. Be careful, Charlotte, careful of the wind you choose.”
author: Avi

quote: “But, in her life, nothing was going to happen. Such was the will of God! The future was a dark corridor, and at the far end the door was bolted.”
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: “I think when you become a parent you go from being a star in the movie of your own life to the supporting player in the movie of someone else's.”
author: Craig Ferguson

quote: “Become the leader of your life. Lead yourself to where you want to be. Breathe life back into your ambitions, your desires, your goals, your relationships.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “I saw a star, I reached for it. I missed, so I accepted the sky”
author: Scott Fortino

quote: “Nobody ever lives their life all the way up except bullfighters.”
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: “The ties that bind us to life are tougher than you imagine, or than any one can who has not felt how roughly they may be pulled without breaking.”
author: Anne Brontë

quote: “Life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future.”
author: John Green

quote: “Life sucks, then you die. Then it sucks again. ”
author: Tonya Hurley

quote: “...Life is much simpler if you don’t notice anything....”
author: Tom Upton

quote: “Life is a perpetual yesterday for us.”
author: Alice Sebold

quote: “Be yourself. Don't worry about what other people are thinking of you, because they're probably feeling the same kind of scared, horrible feelings that everyone does.”
author: Phil Lester

quote: “Life is grace. Sleep is forgiveness. The night absolves. Darkness wipes the slate clean, not spotless to be sure, but clean enough for another day's chalking.”
author: Frederick Buechner

quote: “Stop asking God to bless what you're doing. Find out what God's doing. It's already blessed.”
author: Bono

quote: “Know who you are, and be it. Know what you want, and go out and get it!”
author: Carroll Bryant

quote: “Yet, even amidst the hatred and carnage, life is still worth living. It is possible for wonderful encounters and beautiful things to exist.”
author: Hayao Miyazaki

quote: “Nevertheless, life and death are mysterious states, and we know little of the resources of either.”
author: Joseph Sheridan Le Fanu

quote: “Slowly, with many lost days, I come back to life.”
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: “The main facts in human life are five: birth, food, sleep, love and death.”
author: E. M. Forster

quote: “Strange, what being forced to slow down could do to a person.”
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: “You're only young once, but you can be immature forever”
author: Germaine Greer

quote: “You can play it safe, and I wouldn't blame you for it. You can continue as you've been doing, and you'll survive, but is that what you want? Is that enough?”
author: J.M. Darhower

quote: “My story will be over soon. But it’s not something to be sad about. Remembering those who went ahead. Remembering those who will follow after. And someday, we will meet all those people again, out beyond the horizon”
author: Hiro Arikawa

quote: “I regard the afterlife to be a fairy story for people that are afraid of the dark”
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: “Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its students."[Letter, November 1856]”
author: Hector Berlioz

quote: “No one is without troubles, without personal hardships and genuine challenges.  That fact may not be obvious because most people don't advertise their woes and heartaches.  But nobody, not even the purest heart, escapes life without suffering battle scars.”
author: Richelle E. Goodrich

quote: “Life must not be a novel that is given to us, but one that is made by us. ”
author: Novalis

quote: “It's a good idea always to do something relaxing prior to making an important decision in your life.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “Holding a grudge & harboring anger/resentment is poison to the soul. Get even with people...but not those who have hurt us, forget them, instead get even with those who have helped us.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Never curse a fall. The ground is where humility lives.”
author: Yasmin Mogahed

quote: “It takes no more time to see the good side of life than to see the bad.”
author: Jimmy Buffett

quote: “After all, it's all kinds of things that make up a life, right? The big, like falling in love and spending time with your family, and the little....like blow drying your hair, applying concealer, and cursing those magazine inserts. It all counts. It has to.”
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: “She thought about her life and how lost she’d felt for most of it. She thought about the way that all truths she’d been taught to consider valuable invariably conflicted with the world as it was actually lived. How could a person be so utterly lost, yet remain living?”
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: “The best writers tend to look the roughest in photos. At least that's the excuse I use for why I look so bad in mine.”
author: R.D. Ronald

quote: “I don't "lol". I tried it once but it just didn't agree with me.”
author: R.D. Ronald

quote: “I'm not sure if there's one right place I'm supposed to be, he said, but I know a couple of wrong places I'd give a second try in a heartbeat. ”
author: Brian Andreas

quote: “It is always betterto avenge dear ones than to indulge in mourning.For every one of us, living in this worldmeans waiting for our end. Let whoever canwin glory before death. When a warrior is gone,that will be his best and only bulwark.”
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: “The mind is a wonderful servant, but a terrible master.”
author: Robin Sharma

quote: “Like a running blaze on a plain, like a flash of lightning in the clouds. We live in the flicker.”
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: “..because never in my life have I ever been picked when there was another alternative.”
author: Jasmine Warga

quote: “Nobody is exempt from the trials of life, but everyone can always find something positive in everything even in the worst of times.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “To live greatly, we must develop the capacity to face trouble with courage, disappointment with cheerfulness, and triumph with humility.”
author: Thomas S. Monson

quote: “Shock is a merciful condition. It allows you to get through disaster with a necessary distance between you and your feelings.”
author: Lisa Kleypas

quote: “I don't expect life to make sense," he said after a few moments, "but it could certainly be pleasant if it would stop kicking us in the balls.”
author: Scott Lynch

quote: “Do you know what you're saying when you say, "Whatever"? It's just a code word for the f-word, followed by "you." And at your age, you never, ever. say that to anyone.' " Blaze leaned back. "So now, when someone says it to me, I just say, 'You too.' (72)”
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: “A person's rightful due is to be treated as an object of love, not as an object for use.”
author: Pope John Paul II

quote: “You didn't just cheat on me; you cheated on us. You didn't just break my heart; you broke our future.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “Nothing in this world compares to the comfort and security of having someone just hold your hand.”
author: Richelle E. Goodrich

quote: “We all give up great expectations along the way.”
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: “Love is forever. If it wasn't, it wouldn't be love. The world is beautiful. If it wasn't, it wouldn't be the world.”
author: Rick Yancey

quote: “The light at the end of the tunnel is just the light of an oncoming train.”
author: Robert Lowell

quote: “The world needs poetry now more than ever. It's the only thing that can keep music from copying itself and sounding the same.”
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: “They say that not matter how old you become, when you are with your siblings, you revert back to childhood.”
author: Karen White

quote: “I have to live if I want to be remembered.”
author: Suzanne Young

quote: “The best way to waste your life, is by taking notes. The easiest way to avoid living is to just watch. Look for the details. Report. Don't participate.”
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: “Anymore, no one's mind is their own.”
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: “Sure it could get rough sometimes, but life wasn't a Hollywood movie. Shit happened. You fought, you screamed, and somehow you worked like hell to get out the other side still intact.”
author: Samantha Young

quote: “It's not called being gay, it's called being fabulous!”
author: PewDiePie

quote: “Don't be afraid of the shadows, that only means there's a light nearby.”
author: Evanescence

quote: “All the stuff you can’t wait to get away from, until it’s not there anymore, and then you miss it like crazy.”
author: Morgan Matson

quote: “Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.”
author: Ashley  Smith

quote: “Vital lives are about action. You can't feel warmth unless you create it, can't feel delight until you play, can't know serendipity unless you risk.”
author: Joan Erickson

quote: “When life doesn't meet your expectations, it was important to take it with grace.”
author: Patricia Briggs

quote: “It's amazing how quickly nature consumes human places after we turn our backs on them. Life is a hungry thing.”
author: Scott Westerfeld

quote: “There are times I wish I were invisible. Which is silly, since I do everything I can to stand out.”
author: Gena Showalter

quote: “Perhaps the most "spiritual" thing any of us can do is simply to look through our own eyes, see with eyes of wholeness, and act with integrity and kindness.”
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

quote: “Timid men prefer the calm of despotism to the tempestuous sea of Liberty.”
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: “I can learn to live with guilt. I don't care about being good.”
author: Holly Black

quote: “Birthdays could be such a bummer when you were older than the country you lived in.”
author: Lynsay Sands

quote: “Oh, earth, you're too wonderful for anybody to realize you. Do any human beings ever realize life while they live it -- every, every minute?”
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: “Why, what is to live? Not to eat and drink and breathe,—but to feel the life in you down all the fibres of being, passionately and joyfully.”
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: “Knowing it and seeing it are two different things.”
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: “Grief is a cruel kind of education. You learn how ungentle mourning can be, how full of anger. You learn how glib condolences can feel. You learn how much grief is about language, the failure of language and the grasping for language”
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

quote: “The way you give your name to others is a measure of how much you like and respect yourself.”
author: Brian Tracy

quote: “What can a soldier do when mercy is treason, and he is alone in it?”
author: Laini Taylor

quote: “Even though human life may be the most precious thing on earth, we always behave as if there were something of higher value than human life.”
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: “It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped. ”
author: Anthony Robbins

quote: “What do you say when you feel your life is taken right from your chest, even though I miraculously find myself still breathing?”
author: Jason F. Wright

quote: “After a long, labored sigh, I said, “She was really happy when I got there. I’m pretty sure she was suicidal when I left.”“You do have that effect on people.”
author: Darynda Jones

quote: “I had a dream about you last night.. you were holding a pine cone and introducing him as Gerald.”
author: Nicole McKay

quote: “Do not become someone else just because you are hurt. Be who you are & smile, it may solve, all problems you have got.”
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: “To be sensual, I think, is to respect and rejoice in the force of life, of life itself, and to be present in all that one does, from the effort of loving to the breaking of bread.”
author: James Baldwin

quote: “It had always seemed to him a very plush kind of problem, a privilege, really, to consider whether life was meaningful or not.”
author: Hanya Yanagihara

quote: “Oh, for the years I have not lived, but only dreamed of living.”
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: “it takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeded.”
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: “You can't regret the life you didn't lead.”
author: Junot Díaz

quote: “Here was peace. She pulled in her horizon like a great fish-net. Pulled it from around the waist of the world and draped it over her shoulder. So much of life in its meshes! She called in her soul to come and see.”
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: “Be curious about the world in which you live. Look things up. Chase down every reference. Go deeper than anybody else--that's how you'll get ahead.”
author: Austin Kleon

quote: “We feel that even if all possible scientific questions be answered, the problems of life have still not been touched at all.”
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: “Something amazing happens when you're in love and don't give a damn about what day it is anymore.”
author: Chad Sugg

quote: “There's two kinds of women--those you write poems about and those you don't.”
author: Jeffrey McDaniel

quote: “Decide what you want to be....Pay the Price ...And be what you want to be.”
author: John A Widtsoe

quote: “girlsplease give yourbodies and yourlivestothe young menwhodeserve thembesidesthere isno wayI would welcometheintolerabledullsenseless hellyou would bringmeandI wish youluckin bedandoutbut notinminethankyou.”
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: “No matter what happened yesterday it is insignificant when compared to what lies within the core of your being today.”
author: Sandy Brewer

quote: “Life was not longer something to endure, but to live. ”
author: Hubert Selby Jr.

quote: “You just have to go after what you want and if it doesn't want you back then so be it; it doesn't deserve you anyways.”
author: Nicole Richie

quote: “The life so short, the craft so long to learn.”
author: Hippocrates

quote: “I will never deny that life isn't fair. It seems as though when a woman leaves a man she is strong and independent, but when a man leaves a woman he is a pig and a jerk.”
author: Criss Jami

quote: “This new day has greeted us with no rules; unconditional opportunity. Do not dilute the power of this new day with the hardship of yesterday. Greet this day the way it has greeted you; with open arms and endless possibility.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “I was not, I was, I am not, I care not. (Non fui, fui, non sum, non curo)”
author: Epicurus

quote: “You had a choice: you could either strain and look at things that appeared in front of you in the fog, painful as it might be, or you could relax and lose yourself”
author: Ken Kesey

quote: “The only certainty life contains is death.”
author: Patricia Briggs

quote: “Excellence/Perfection is not a destination; it is a continuous journey that never ends.”
author: Brian Tracy

quote: “Life isn't a book. There's no guarantee of a happy ending.”
author: Kristin Cast

quote: “The rain fluctuates between drizzle and torrential. It messes with your mind. It makes you think things will always be like this, never getting better, always letting you down right when you though the worst was over.”
author: Susane Colasanti

quote: “So I learned two things that night, and the next day, from him: the perfection of a moment, and the fleeting nature of it.”
author: Margaret George

quote: “It’s life. You don’t figure it out. You just climb up on the beast and ride.”
author: Rebecca Wells

quote: “Even if no salvation should come, I want to be worthy of it at every moment.”
author: Franz Kafka

quote: “Rule of life. If you bother to ask someone’s advice, then bother to listen to it.”
author: Sophie Kinsella

quote: “Every night I used to pray that I’d find my people, and finally I did on the open road.We had nothing to lose, nothing to gain, nothing we desired anymore, except to make our lives into a work of art.”
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: “Love changes things; hope allows us to endure until the change arrives.”
author: Iimani David

quote: “There are two ways to live a life either forget everything or, remember nothing.”
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: “After all, if you run far enough, no one can catch you.”
author: V.E. Schwab

quote: “Man cries, his tears dry up and run out. So he becomes a devil, reduced to a monster.”
author: Kouta Hirano

quote: “and every day I thank [God] that I am alive, not because I fear death, but because my wife has a husband and my son is not an orphan.”
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: “All that is transitory is but a metaphor.”
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: “I am a fashion person, and fashion is not only about clothes -- it's about all kinds of change”
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: “Life's not black-and-white. Sometimes the ends justifies the means.”
author: Emily Giffin

quote: “If you think something is missing in your life, it is probably YOU...”
author: Robert Holden

quote: “So, what is my story? I don't know. It's long and twisted and not quite finished yet.”
author: Caitlyn Paige

quote: “The more you seek security, the less of it you have. But the more you seek opportunity, the more likely it is that you will achieve the security that you desire.”
author: Brian Tracy

quote: “A man either lives life as it happens to him, meets it head-on and licks it, or he turns his back on it and starts to wither away.”
author: Gene Roddenberry

quote: “That is the challenge Companion. To take what has happened to you and learn from it. Nothing is quite so destructive as pity, especially self-pity. No event in life is so terrible that one cannot rise above it.”
author: Robin Hobb

quote: “Never judge someone's character based on the words of another. Instead, study the motives behind the words of the person casting the bad judgment.”
author: Suzy Kassem

quote: “You don't win races by wishing, you win them by running faster than everyone else does.”
author: Philip Pullman

quote: “For one day there will be nothing left, yet we will have something. -me-I tried to wait for my life to begin. Something has to happen. Like an amazing boy. I know he's out there. I just have to find him.”
author: Susane Colasanti

quote: “Solitude led to retrospective thinking, and if the past is what you are trying to get away from, then constant distractions in the present are needed.”
author: R.D. Ronald

quote: “Just been poisoned by my gran. Nothing says Christmas better than familicide and anaphylactic shock.”
author: R.D. Ronald

quote: “It is our wounds that create in us a desire to reach for miracles. The fulfillment of such miracles depends on whether we let our wounds pull us down or lift us up towards our dreams.”
author: Jocelyn Soriano

quote: “It's such a stupid question, in my opinion. I mean, how do you know what you're going to do till you do it? The answer is, you don't. I think I am, but how do I know? I swear it's a stupid question.”
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: “Isn’t it queer: there are only two or three human stories, and they go on repeating themselves as fiercely as if they had never happened before; like the larks in this country, that have been singing the same five notes over for thousands of years.”
author: Willa Cather

quote: “You have to rely on whatever sparks you have inside.”
author: Lisa Kleypas

quote: “All life is only a set of pictures in the brain, among which there is no difference betwixt those born of real things and those born of inward dreamings, and no cause to value the one above the other.”
author: HP Lovecraft

quote: “She who reconciles the ill-matched threadsOf her life, and weaves them gratefullyInto a single cloth – It’s she who drives the loudmouths from the hallAnd clears it for a different celebration.”
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: “Anything was better than nothing. Half-full was better than empty. Ignorance was the lowest form of humiliation and suffering.”
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: “The sharpest minds often ruin their lives by overthinking the next step, while the dull win the race with eyes closed.”
author: Bethany Brookbank

quote: “May your life be filled, as mine has been, with love and laughter; and remember, when things are rough all you need is ... Chocolate.”
author: Geraldine Solon

quote: “Life goes on. Get over it. You're still young. It'll get better. Blah, Blah, Blah”
author: David Levithan

quote: “The only true borders lie between day and night, between life and death, between hope and loss.”
author: Erin Hunter

quote: “Find a job you enjoy doing, and you will never have to work a day in your life.”
author: Mark Twain

quote: “She smiled. “Life is full of stories. Or maybe life is only stories. Good night, my dear Nao.”
author: Ruth Ozeki

quote: “Yes, we live, or we're given the chance to, at least, but sometimes living is hard and complicated because of fear.”
author: Adam Silvera

quote: “Every minute you spend in planning saves 10 minutes in execution; this gives you a 1,000 percent Return on Energy!”
author: Brian Tracy

quote: “Life is not easy. We all have problems-even tragedies-to deal with, and luck has nothing to do with it. Bad luck is only the superstitious excuse for those who don't have the wit to deal with the problems of life. ”
author: Joan Lowery Nixon

quote: “But in that moment I understood what they say about nostalgia, that no matter if you're thinking of something good or bad, it always leaves you a little emptier afterward.”
author: John Corey Whaley

quote: “Imagine no limitations; decide what's right and desirable before you decide what's possible.”
author: Brian Tracy

quote: “The heart has a heart of its own.”
author: Morrissey

quote: “What can we see, read, acquire, but ourselves. Take the book, my friend, and read your eyes out, you will never find there what I find.”
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: “So go out and live real good and I promise you'll get beat up real bad. But, in a little while after you're dead, you'll be rotted away anyway. It's not gonna matter if you have a few scars. It will matter if you didn't live.”
author: Rich Mullins

quote: “Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.”
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: “I always felt like you had to be important to have enemies.”
author: John Green

quote: “There is nothing perfect...only life.”
author: Sue Monk Kidd

quote: “I am afraid because I can so clearly foresee my own life rotting away of itself, like a leaf that rots without falling, while I pursue my round of existence from day to day.”
author: Osamu Dazai

quote: “Somewhere between love and hate lies confusion, misunderstanding and desperate hope.”
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: “We need people in our lives with whom we can be as open as possible. To have real conversations with people may seem like such a simple, obvious suggestion, but it involves courage and risk.”
author: Thomas  Moore

quote: “I think I’m always so much more happy with books and movies and stuff. I think I get more excited about well-done representations of life than life itself.- Celine”
author: Richard Linklater

quote: “Everything will be alright in the end so if it is not alright it is not the end.”
author: Deborah Moggach

quote: “It is rare for people to be asked the question which puts them squarely in front of themselves”
author: Arthur Miller

quote: “Full many a gem of purest ray serene,The dark unfathom'd caves of ocean bear:Full many a flower is born to blush unseen,And waste its sweetness on the desert air.”
author: Thomas Gray

quote: “I want an infinitely blank book and the rest of time......why didn't I learn to treat everything like it was the last time, my greatest regret is how much I believed in the future.”
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: “Try to exclude the possibility of suffering which the order of nature and the existence of free-wills involve, and you find that you have excluded life itself.”
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: “It is our failure to become our perceived ideal that ultimately defines us and makes us unique. It's not easy, but if you accept your misfortune and handle it right your perceived failure can become a catalyst for profound re-invention.”
author: Conan O'Brien

quote: “War had bled color from everything, leaving nothing but a storm of gray.”
author: Ruta Sepetys

quote: “It is the beginning of wisdom when you recognize that the best you can do is choose which rules you want to live by, and it's persistent and aggravated imbecility to pretend you can live without any.”
author: Wallace Stegner

quote: “My biggest fault is that the faults I was born with grow bigger each year.”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “Look beyond yourself..”
author: Michael  Jackson

quote: “The bright side of the planet moves toward darknessAnd the cities are falling asleep, each in its hour,And for me, now as then, it is too much.There is too much world.”
author: Czesław Miłosz

quote: “All teachings are mere references. The true experience is living your own life. Then, even the holiest of words are only words.”
author: Deng Ming-Dao

quote: “Pretend that every single person you meet has a sign around his or her neck that says, "Make me feel important." Not only will you succeed in sales, you will succeed in life.”
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: “I failed to communicate, that's why I chose to leave”
author: Bob Dylan

quote: “Happiness does not come from without, it comes from within”
author: Helen Keller

quote: “Paper is more patient than man.”
author: Anne Frank

quote: “Dreamers are mocked as impractical. The truth is they are the most practical, as their innovations lead to progress and a better way of life for all of us.”
author: Robin Sharma

quote: “But all I could think of was how when nothing made sense and hadn't for ages, you just have to grab onto anything you feel sure of.”
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: “God put us here, on this carnival ride. We close our eyes never knowing where it'll take us next.”
author: Carrie Underwood

quote: “I think choosing between men and women is like choosing between cake and ice cream. You'd be daft not to try both when there are so many different flavors.”
author: Björk

quote: “Being faithful in the smallest things is the way to gain, maintain, and demonstrate the strength needed to accomplish something great.”
author: Alex  Harris

quote: “All evil is good become cancerous.”
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: “You know, people ask me. They say 'Dan, three years later do you really want to be drawing cat whiskers on your face?' but they don't understand. The cat whiskers, they come from within.”
author: Dan Howell

quote: “What will be left of all the fearing and wanting associated with your problematic life situation that every day takes up most of your attention? A dash, one or two inches long, between the date of birth and date of death on your gravestone.”
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: “I look out into the water and up deep into the stars. I beg the sparkling lanterns of light to cure me of myself — my past and the kaleidoscope of mistakes, failures and wrong turns that have stacked unbearable regret upon my shoulders.”
author: Jennifer Elisabeth

quote: “Werner wonders in the dead of night, isn’t life a kind of corruption? A child is born, and the world sets in upon it.”
author: Anthony Doerr

quote: “In the year 2025, the best men don't run for president, they run for their lives. . . .”
author: Stephen King

quote: “Life is an intricate play with actors waiting for an explanation. Each added act confers a new interpretation of the story. ( "Waiting for the pieces to fall into place" )”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “We perceive the world through the rear window of life, observe all the puzzles and little pieces of our existence and assemble them in a comprehensive pattern. This allows us to reassess and evaluate our world view. ( "Waiting for the pieces to fall into place" )”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “We must laugh and cry, enjoy and suffer, in a word, vibrate to our full capacity … I think that’s what being really human means.”
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: “I admire those who do good and expect nothing in return.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “For some, life may be a playground to undermine the brainwaves of others or simply a vainglorious game with an armory of theatrics, illustrating only bleak self-deception, haughty narcissism and dim deficiency in empathy. ("Another empty room")”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “But now, I know, how absence can be present, like a damaged nerve, like a dark bird.”
author: Audrey Niffenegger

quote: “Many things are not as they seem: The worst things in life never are.”
author: Jim Butcher

quote: “No new horror can be more terrible than the daily torture of the commonplace.”
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: “Life is something that happens when you can't get to sleep.”
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: “Only when you accept that one day you'll die can you let go, and make the best out of life. And that's the big secret. That's the miracle.”
author: Gabriel Bá

quote: “Anything that doesn't take years of your life and drive you to suicide hardly seems worth doing.”
author: Cormac McCarthy

quote: “I just want someone to hear what I have to say. And maybe if I talk long enough, it’ll make sense.”
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: “Life starts out with everyone clapping when you take a poo and goes downhill from there. ”
author: Sloane Crosley

quote: “And now I am here, as alone as I've ever been. I am seventeen years old. This is not how it's suppose to be. This is not how my life is suppose to turn out.”
author: Gayle Forman

quote: “Something that is yours forever is never precious”
author: Chaim Potok

quote: “Life is a waste of time and time is a waste of life, so let's all get wasted and have the time of our lives.”
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: “CLEMENTINE: This is it, Joel. It's going to be gone soon.JOEL: I know.CLEMENTINE: What do we do?JOEL: Enjoy it.”
author: Charlie Kaufman

quote: “To escape fear, you have to go through it, not around.”
author: Richie Norton

quote: “Yesterday was a closed book, tomorrow, however, was another story.”
author: Cecelia Ahern

quote: “In life there are two things which are dependable. The pleasures of the flesh and the pleasures of literature.”
author: Sei Shōnagon

quote: “Without God, life has no purpose, and without purpose, life has no meaning. Without meaning, life has no significance or hope.”
author: Rick Warren

quote: “Like lost children we live our unfinished adventures.”
author: Guy Debord

quote: “People live on the flow of the daily reality and they surge on the waves of hazy expectations. They can experience pleasant junctures and try to catch and enjoy each special moment that is offered to them. Until life takes them by surprise.”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “Sing your life; any fool can think of words that rhyme.”
author: Morrissey

quote: “Soldiers live. He dies and not you, and you feel guilty, because you're glad he died, and not you. Soldiers live, and wonder why.”
author: Glen Cook

quote: “Love is blind. Love of money is blind. Greed and money make people forfeit the quiddity of life, banish them from what is essential and alienate them from themselves. They lose their identity and become drifting exiles. ( "Money rocking and rolling" )”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “Life is a peephole, a single tiny entry onto a vastness--how can I not dwell on this brief, cramped view of things? This peephole is all I've got!”
author: Yann Martel

quote: “Those who don't jump will never fly.”
author: Leena Ahmad Almashat

quote: “Our love was a two-person game. At least until one of us died, and the other became a murderer. ”
author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo

quote: “When we are smitten, we await love to be “remontant” and to be blooming over and over again”, like remontant roses, with blossoms scenting through all the seasons of life. Passion and patience are to be good allies, though.”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “To pay attention, this is our endless and proper work.”
author: Mary Oliver

quote: “He who robs us of our dreams robs us of our life.”
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: “I can chase you, and I can catch you,but there is nothing I can do to make you mine.”
author: Morrissey

quote: “Money is better than poverty, if only for financial reasons.”
author: Woody Allen

quote: “A life isn't measured in hours and minutes. It's the quality, not the length.”
author: Gabrielle Zevin

quote: “The more you believed in yourself, the more you could trust yourself. The more you trust yourself, the less you compare yourself to others.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “What was the point of even having a conversation when words couldn't be trusted?”
author: James Dashner

quote: “By all evidence we are in the world to do nothing.”
author: Emil Cioran

quote: “The more you talk about them, the more important they will feel. The more you listen to them, the more important you will make them feel.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The things that stress me out haven't changed.But I don't wanna lose anything.So I thought that at least I would change.I'm lucky...that I'm afraid of losing something.”
author: Ai Yazawa

quote: “You will have five hundred million little bells, and I shall have five hundred million springs of fresh water...”
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: “But to believe that getting stuff is the purpose and aim of life is madness.”
author: Hubert Selby Jr.

quote: “When it rains it pours. Maybe the art of life is to convert tough times to great experiences: we can choose to hate the rain or dance in it.”
author: Joan Marques

quote: “It's better to have a few faithful friends than numerous shallow friendships.”
author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett

quote: “I'm hungry for a juicy life. I lean out my window at night and I can taste it out there, just waiting for me.”
author: Brigid Lowry

quote: “I am so grateful for my troubles. As I reflect back on my life, I have come to realize that my greatest triumphs have been born of my greatest troubles.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “We are biology. We are reminded of this at the beginning and the end, at birth and at death. In between we do what we can to forget.”
author: Mary Roach

quote: “Sometimes you just have those days where everything goes wrong. But sometimes, and totally unexpectedly, something can go right.”
author: Leila Sales

quote: “I would think for hours how strange it was that some parts of words are silent, just like some parts of our lives. Did the people who wrote the dictionaries decide to mirror language to our lives, or did it just happen that way?”
author: Rene Denfeld

quote: “Don't set your goals by what other people deem important.”
author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

quote: “To be heroic is to be courageous enough to die for something; to be inspirational is to be crazy enough to live a little.”
author: Criss Jami

quote: “The people I distrust most are those who want to improve our lives but have only one course of action.”
author: Frank Herbert

quote: “Take advantage of it now, while you are young, and suffer all you can, because these things don't last your whole life.”
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: “Be a true Heart, not a follower.”
author: Ed Sheeran

quote: “Atheism, a religion dedicated to its own sense of smug superiority.”
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: “Isn't it sad how some people's grip on their lives is so precarious that they'll embrace any preposterous delusion rather than face an occasional bleak truth?”
author: Bill Watterson

quote: “Poetry is a way of taking life by the throat.”
author: Robert Frost

quote: “HOBBES:Virtue needs some cheaper thrills.”
author: Bill Watterson

quote: “I cannot forecast to you the action of Russia. It is a riddle wrapped in a mystery inside an enigma. But perhaps there is a key. That key is Russian national interest.”
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: “No, darling! To die it's easy... But you have to stuggle for life!”
author: Art Spiegelman

quote: “I know how you feel, Willem," Andy had said in one of their secret conversations, "but he doesn't want you to admire him; he wants you to see him as he is. He wants you to tell him that his life, as inconceivable as it is, is still a life.”
author: Hanya Yanagihara

quote: “Real change is difficult at the beginning, but gorgeous at the end. Change begins the moment you get the courage and step outside your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: “The best laid schemes o' mice an' men gang aft agley.”
author: Robert Burns

quote: “Emotion often outwits intelligence, while intuition renders life surprisingly fluent and enjoyable. ("Le ciel c'est l'autre")”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “If consumption is a main goal in life, labor has become a painful gate to buying things, which are often unnecessary or totally useless. "Sorry, insufficient funds, goodbye!".”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “When the door starts to creak it may be time to take it off the hinges. If things get rusted, life has to be called into question and matters re-evaluated. ( “In the doorway” )”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “When people become prisoners of daily habits and happen to be hostages of choices, which they made in the past, but which they finally do not actually want, they experience the need to abandon their corporeal prison at a certain time in life. ( "Corporeal prison" )”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “It is pointless to say that this or that night was the worst of my life. I have so many bad nights to choose from that I've made none the champion.”
author: Yann Martel

quote: “Life is a full circle, widening until it joins the circle motions of the infinite.”
author: Anais Nin

quote: “Sometimes problems don’t require a solution to solve them; instead they require maturity to outgrow them.”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “I had a dream about you. I was sitting on your couch, relating my succession of ideas on subconscious influence. I asked you what they meant, and you told me that free associations were a bad way to advance my political career.”
author: Bauvard

quote: “Every ounce of my cynicism is supported by historical precedent.”
author: Glen Cook

quote: “Hope is such a beautiful word, but it often seems very fragile. Life is still being needlessly hurt and destroyed.”
author: Michael  Jackson

quote: “Her happiness floated like waves of ocean along the coast of her life. She found lyrics of her life in his arms but she never sung her song.”
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: “You know my name, not my story. You've heard what I've done, but not what I've been through.”
author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett

quote: “You're here to be light, bringing out the God-colors in the world.(Matthew 5:14, The Message)”
author: Anonymous

quote: “We started off trying to set up a small anarchist community, but people wouldn't obey the rules.”
author: Alan Bennett

quote: “May all that have life be delivered from suffering”
author: Buddha

quote: “The greatest wealth is health”
author: Virgil

quote: “Properly practiced, knitting soothes the troubled spirit, and it doesn't hurt the untroubled spirit either.”
author: Elizabeth Zimmerman

quote: “He stood up straight and looked the world squarely in the fields and hills. To add weight to his words he stuck the rabbit bone in his hair. He spread his arm out wide. "I will go mad!" he annouced.”
author: Douglas Adams

quote: “When humans were young, they were pushed around in strollers. When they were old, they were pushed around in wheelchairs. In between, they were just pushed around.”
author: Tom Robbins

quote: “Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.”
author: Steve Jobs

quote: “Accidents happen. Our bones shatter, our skin splits, our hearts break. We burn, we drown, we stay alive.”
author: Moïra Fowley-Doyle

quote: “On this road there are no godspoke men. They are gone and I am left and they have taken with them the world.”
author: Cormac McCarthy

quote: “When was the last time you woke up and realized that today could be the best day of your life?”
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: “I could just remember how my father used to say that the reason for living was to get ready to stay dead a long time.”
author: William Faulkner

quote: “Liberty is only possible on the condition of regularity. We cannot be free and play the game of life without abiding to the rules, but the rules have to be adapted constantly in line with our experiences and the events we encounter. ( “If he doesn't play ball “ )”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “You better start swimming, or you'll sink like a stone. Because the Time's they are a-changing.”
author: Bob Dylan

quote: “Regret is counterproductive. It's looking back on a past that you can't change. Questioning things as they occur can prevent regret in the future.”
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: “There really is only one ending to any story. Human life ends in death. Until then, it keeps going and gets complicated and there's loss. Everything involves loss; every relationship ends in one way or another.”
author: Charlie Kaufman

quote: “Friends always forget those whom fortune forsakes.”
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: “The mind-is not the heart.I may yet live, as I know others live,To wish in vain to let go with the mind-Of cares, at night, to sleep; but nothing tells meThat I need learn to let go with the heart.”
author: Robert Frost

quote: “We strive for harmony, but it is not always realized.”
author: C. Toni Graham

quote: “Those guys who want to have the Mohawk...which, to me, is the new business casual.”
author: Gerard Way

quote: “The life of every man is a diary in which he means to write one story, and writes another; and his humblest hour is when he compares the volume as it is with what he vowed to make it.”
author: J.M. Barrie

quote: “It is part of the human nature always to judge others very severely and,when the wind turns against us,always to find an excuse for our own misdeeds,or to blame someone else for our mistakes.”
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: “Art and life are subjective. Not everybody's gonna dig what I dig, but I reserve the right to dig it.”
author: Whoopi Goldberg

quote: “The whole house seemed to exhale a melancholy breath of emptiness”
author: Michael Chabon

quote: “Know what you want to do, hold the thought firmly, and do every day what should be done, and every sunset will see you that much nearer the goal.”
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: “I'll be happy if running and I can grow old together.”
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: “Men's lives have meaning, not their deaths.”
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: “your life will not end with death. You are Immortal. You were always there and you always will be.”
author: Zain Hashmi

quote: “Life is dear to every living thing; the worm that crawls upon the ground will struggle for it.”
author: Solomon Northup

quote: “All art is but dirtying the paper delicately.”
author: John Ruskin

quote: “I was diamond on the outside, and I would not break.Inside, though, I was already broken.”
author: Shaun David Hutchinson

quote: “I must die. Must I then die lamenting? I must be put in chains. Must I then also lament? I must go into exile. Does any man then hinder me from going with smiles and cheerfulness and contentment?”
author: Epictetus

quote: “When you're the most happening person at the party, it's time to leave”
author: Kelly Cutrone

quote: “Your body is the church where Nature asks to be reverenced.”
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: “If her enemies were Brigan's friends and her friends were Brigan's enemies, then the two of them could walk through the world arm in arm and never be hit by arrows again.”
author: Kristin Cashore

quote: “If we only see things through the cold-eyed lens of factuality and don’t listen to the yearning and screaming of unexpressed feelings, life may remain bleak in a mire of clinical hollowness, sodden in apathy and indifference. ("Morning after")”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “Imagine being sentient but not alive. Seeing and even knowing, but not alive. Just looking out. Recognizing but not being alive. A person can die and still go on. Sometimes what looks out at you from a person's eyes maybe died back in childhood.”
author: Philip K. Dick

quote: “When we stay locked up in the spectrum of unsolved life stories and keep hiding in an arcane prism, life remains a mystery behind perpetual tensions and a journey in a world beyond appearances. (“Une femme peut en cacher une autre")”
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: “If I never went home, what exactly would I be missing? I pictured my cold cavernous house, my friendless town full of bad memories, the utterly unremarkable life that had been mapped out for me. It had never once occurred to me, I realized, to refuse it.”
author: Ransom Riggs
